review_body: Incredibly unprofessional! We're in the middle of a pandemic, and they charged us almost $500 to cancel a reservation which the government is currently forbidding us from keeping. We tried contacting them for 4 weeks with zero response and finally just had to pay to cancel the reservation through Booking.com or pay the full $1300 for the stay. Booking.com contacted them on our behalf and their response was basically "too bad, pay to cancel". Deplorable.

review_body: She gave us an awesome customer service from the time of check in, she made sure if we had any questions to let her know...she really showed us the ALOHA spirit and we need more people like her in this field of service!! She made us feel very welcoming and family oriented kind of personality!!! Because of her we had an amazing and awesome stay and will be again very soon!!!!

This hotel is not with frills. You get all of the basics you would expect for your great time in Hawaii. It’s in a great area close to everything. There are several restaurants in the building and a 7/11 and ABC store next door. Check in was super easy and all staff was very nice!!

Check in staff were very friendly. They even called a taxi when we check out. Rooms were clen and our view was amazing. Bed was comfy. Reasonably priced hotel. Love the pool. I would go back there again.

Check in staff and Front Desk Staff were very friendly and efficient throughout my stay. One elevator of 3 out of service the entire time.Air Conditioning unit in the room was very noisy and the remote control unit did not work. It was necessary to turn off the unit at night because it would continuously turn on and off all night long making it impossible to sleep.Windows were not air tight so you could hear the wind whistling outside. Nice view of the Canal and mountains.Bed was comfortable. Dresser and bed table outdated and well used with lots of scratches and holes visible. No cupboard space or hangers to hang clothes available.Bathroom had been renovated and was actually quite nice. Shower only.Coffee Unit sketchy... heating unit completely burnt.

Our family had multiple rooms within the Waikiki Monarch hotel. The location of the hotel is nice if you want to be away from the hustle and bustle and nightlife of the main strip of Waikiki. Waikiki Monarch is a family friendly hotel with a pool, hot tub, laundry facilities, dining options, a bar, and car rental on site. It’s a short walk to the beach or lagoon which is very good he have small children swim. From my understanding the hotel is under some renovations so my room was newer and more updated. The housekeeping was not the best. There where bits of broken glass in the entry of the room and some potato chip crumbs in the seating area. My sons room had partial renovations just yet we had to have maintenance come in and do a minor repair while we were there. Day two the entire bank of elevators was down for maintenance for a couple of hours. I realize maintenance has to be done, don’t know if there was a way around shutting down all the elevators for the hotel side at one time?Not sure what the deal is with the key cards for this hotel we had to have our key cards programmed multiple times within a short five days day didn’t matter which room other guess were experiencing the same problem I think maybe they need to upgrade that system from my understanding it’s a huge problem. Finally, it seems as though the alarm system for the adjoining condominium complex is linked to the hotel and an entire evacuation was call at 11:42pm it seemed chaotic we finally were informed that it was a false alarm by word of mouth nothing official. I can tell the staff is truly concerned about making the customer experience better I’ll probably give it another try in another year or two and see if they’ve managed to pull everything together right now I can only offer 2 1/2 to 3 stars.

Reasonably priced hotel with a super sunny swimming pool with airconditioned with a laid back not to bother guest atmosphere. The hotel is close to everything and has a 24-hour store right next to the hotel with everything one could need. This hotel could even offer kitchenette if you would like to save money on food by purchasing and cooking meals. One can also find supermarkets that are close by within convenience.

Turned up to the room and it just generally feels run down. The room hadn’t been cleaned and the bed was totally uncomfortable. I feel bad because I know they’re trying, but I’d recommend looking elsewhere.

We arrived on Saturday Dec 21....Checked in....kinda trashy reception area....Im like ok....what are we getting into...dude at front desk tells us if we have a car, we can park in the parking garage....and it will be $30 per night and it will be cash.....no credit card or anything like that....Ok.....get to the elevator, took about 15 minutes as it was the only one on that side that worked...im still ok...not mad yet....of course the photos were awesome looking.....get to the room....2 full size beds, not queen like most hotels have....It was myself, my wife and Mom....shes 83...we took her on the trip because she needed to get out of the house where she lives....so the hotel needed lots of repairs....but our stay was admirable....the downstairs restaurant was not part of the hotel, but a private owner....Just beware if you stay here, of the parking and the Advance Cash feature....

I would like to express my appreciation to Miss Vanessa the General Manger of this hotel for the outstanding service provided by her company and her friendly personality and consistently excellent assistance. I have been impressed with her outstanding qualities, resources, creativity and initiative that didn’t go unnoticed.How she treats the customer as an example when I asked for anything she respond at once. This is the woman who’s an example of how the boss can be.I couldn’t let my visit to Honolulu without telling I how I pleased. I have been with such excellent qualities courteous service in my room I found everything I need.Its pleasure to deal with people who know the meaning of hospitality like Miss Vanessa the General Manager of this hotel.I appreciate the wonderful service she provide and the experience I have with her companySincerely Hany Morries Wahba GobranEgypt. Cairo Hany.mories2@gmail.com

This place is terrible don’t stay here the building is haunted. The service is horrible the rooms are old and terrible, the towels don’t look white and the front desk asks for your ID and signature even for extra towels!! RIDICULOUS! The photos on Expedia and Orbitz aren’t the real rooms and your experience will be horrifying if you stay here. The man that works the night shift in the front desk is very rude as well and has an attitude every time you ask something. A truly bad experience here and won’t be coming back here again.

Hawaian monarch security always helpful. I sometimes forget my key and get charged but they are always nice. But there is a new security guard Joshua super rude and wouldn't even let me pay $20 to get a new key he called another guy who is always buy the book and thank god he let us a buy a new one so we could get in our house!I feel harassed by Joshua I hope he was having a bad day and apologized.

My family and I recently stayed here for our first Hawaiian vacation and will be staying here again next time. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Everyone from the front desk, cleaners and manager Vanessa made extra efforts to make our stay even better.The location was great. We were on foot most of the time and was able to walk everywhere. The beach was just a 5 min walk. The mall with all the restaurants was just 10 mins walk.The hotel itself had several food options. A great coffee place, pizza place, burger and takeaway shop. For breakfast there is a breakfast cafe that will remind you of eating at home. At night there was a bar for drinks.One thing we really appreciated was the pool area. Most other hotel pools closed at 8pm. This pool and hot tub was open until 11pm. There wasn't a lot to do in the city for the kids at night. Was great to be able to take them from a night swim.The room was nice. We had a good view from the 22nd floor. 2 comfortable beds, with a mini fridge, which was very nice with the kids. Flat screen tv with netflix. This places is well worth the cost. In the future we will be returning back here. Would recommend saving the money on the more expensive hotels. Waikiki monarch has everything you need

We really enjoyed our stay at Monarch Hawaiian. The room had excellent valley view. Room service was prompt. We got electric iron in couple of minutes. Bathroom had some water problem. But we were told Tuesday mornings are maintenance days. Front desk well attended, though not there all the time. Gym was ok. Pretty small in the basement. And not much equipment. Overall it was enjoyable stay.

It is definitely not worth the money you pay. You'd rather pay $50 more. Disappointed as this Hotel is more a Motel / YMCA than anything else. Would not recommend it at all. It is a place to sleep but nothing more, there isn't even a hanger to hang up a shirt.

This is an older Hotel that meets all of your needs at a very good price. It's not a 5 star but you are there mostly for rest and sleep. My room 1004 had been updated with new paint, tile floors, very comfy beds. They feature a pool, fitness room, pizza shop, fast food place with great burgers, coffee vendor with sweets vert good wake me up, parking and auto rentals. What more could you ask for.

Had an amazing experience here! The rooms are affordable for what you get. About a ten minute walk to the beach with restaurants nearby. Plus a nice pool area. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Will definitely be returning!

Be prepared to spend an additional $30 A NIGHT to park your car at the hotel. Water pressure is terrible. I mean it's a place to sleep. The views are pretty if you are on the higher floors. We just parked on the street but had to move our by 6am every morning. Finding parking is a hassle.

My husband and I stayed here for two days and it was a place to sleep, but it’s in need of an update. It was relatively clean, but everything was very old and the air conditioner was not able to keep the room cool even at night.

Terrible. To charge a "resort fee" on top of exorbitant rate was ridiculous. Bathroom was extremely sub-par. Very dissapointing. Biggest discrepency to description I have encountered so far on Hotel.com. Sorry help too. Worst place I have stayed in quite some time. Would reccomend finding some place else to stay for sure.

Stayed here only one night due to the location and you couldn’t pay me to stay here again. Old, dirty, shady and dingy. Whatever you do don’t stay here. The entire place needs to be bulldozed. Old and hideous hotel

Very disappointed, didn’t stock up every day on tea and coffee, needed to tell them. Didn’t clean the room, needed to tell them. Internet was playing up in room. No toweled for pool which I had to pay extra. Missing bath mat, had to use hand towels.

We just got back from a beautiful vacation. Hawaiian Monarch Hotel, was confortable, clean, and within walking distance from the beach. We stayed at the 17 floor. Yes, is a bit old, the carpets are not super clean.. but! Our room was always clean, gave us many towels, and took care of us. We arrived before check in, and they allowed us to leave our bags until check in time. There is a Chinese food on the first floor and the food was great and convenient. There is also a bakery, we bought a malasadas and they were not cooked right. The poo was big, and my children were so happy to swim after swimming in the ocean. If you are looking for a clean place, that is comfortable and convenient , Hawaiian monarch hotel is the place for your vacation.

An old hotel without any renovations. Would’ve been great in 1975. Paint peeling in the bathtub. I gave it one star because it had a pool that my kids liked swimming in. They’re little so any pool is cool. Worst place I’ve ever stayed. The mattresses, sheets, carpet was at least 40 years old. Dingy and disgusting.

I slept in someone else's blood! DO NOT STAY HERE! When I noticed it in the morning I told the front staff that I would need my sheets completely changed and they asked my room number. When I got home late that night the bed was made, but the blood was still there! I had to call down to the front desk, was told housekeeping was gone, I had to insist on them finding a clean sheet and insist that it be brought to my room as I was already ready for bed. This coupled with someone else hair on top of the toilet paper sickened me! They double booked the same room so gave me an upgrade, but when I got to the room it was not updated it was a horror scene: the carpet so stained and gross the room super small, a Motel 6 would have been a paradise compared to this room. Thank goodness I got a call that they had given me the wrong key. I switched and at least the "deluxe" room didn't feel like I needed a mask to walk around. The elevators are very slow, there is no air conditioning in the hallways or elevator so on a hot summer day it's stifling waiting to get to the 20th floor. Parking is now $30 a day with hotel key per 24 hours which is very high for such a low scale hotel.If you are wanting a pleasant stay for vacation or business, don't ruin it with such a crappy hotel as this.

We stayed there on the 16th floor. The room looked ok but the beds were uncomfortable and there were stains all over the carpet. The bathroom was very dated and the shower was hard to adjust the temperature of water. The room had a small noisy aircon and I had to use ear plugs to sleep. Over all I was so glad that I booked here for only a night before we headed back home next day

The building is close to bus stops and a convenience store but is very old and dated. Being next to a busy road we heard sirens all night, even on the 38th floor. It is quite a long walk from the beach and the shops. Rarely were all lifts working and even permanent tenants had trouble with the card reader. The walls are paper thin so we were kept awake by the ukulele player next door and noisy conversations from other tenants. The condo was just a room with a kitchen and was so small we had trouble leaving our suitcases out without tripping over them. The pool had paint peeling from around the edge and only half the spa jets were working. There appeared to be some onsite parking but one tenant had his car stolen from across the street. We thought seriously about moving out the day we arrived and would not recommend anyone stay here- we certainly won't be back.

I have quite a bit of experience staying in different levels of hotels. This is bt far the worst one. Carpet is disgusting. Bathroom is disgusting. Unsual "amenities fee" of 12 dollars when checking in. The hotel should be paying its guests to stay here not the other way around. A $30 price tag on this room would be too steep. Funny part is they actually request people to review on trip advisor. Well if you insist but im going to tell it how it is. Cracked out. Rank. Also the bed sucks. Please dont give this hotel your hard earned money.

Bundled this hotel with flights for the first few nights of an island hopping vacation. The location was good-rooms were mostly clean-parking was a bit tight. There was a bakery on the 2nd floor that we bought a quick breakfast sandwich from one morning. The elevators were a bit muggy, as were the halls, but the rooms were cool with AC. It’s nothing fancy, but it worked well for us. Picture is canal view from window.

I shouldn’t tip hotel at all due to poor service and how bad the room was, but I did anyway. The mattress is very thin and when I moved I could hear the spring box screeching. Pillows are very thin and uncomfortable. After we came back in the evening they made the bed, but didn’t replace the only bar of soap that we used the night before. Front desk customer service reps were not very friendly. Very noisy when people walking on upper level. AC unit was Sooooo loud!

This hotel is on the edge of Waikiki, about 3 blocks from the beach and 7 or 8 blocks from the center of Waikiki.The staff were really friendly and welcoming, the room was spacious, with a small fridge and coffee making equipment.There's a gym and a spacious pool area.The hotel is within walking distance to plenty of diners/restaurants and the area's to get picked up by the tour buses.This is a very good hotel to stay if you're on a budget.

The room I was provided did not match any of the photos advertised above. There were stains all over the curtains, doors, and carpets. Unsure if they were blood or not? As well, there was A large brown stain in the tub, and did not appear to have ever been cleaned. My fiancé and I slept with our clothes covering the sheets out of fear that it hadn’t been cleaned. The entire operation was a scam. When we confronted the receptionist at checkout she stated they were, “making Renovations” to the place, however I saw no evidence of this. As well, there was never an offer to rectify the situation. Funny part is, on our bed it actually asked for a review on TripAdvisor, so here it is. Your “resort fee” is supposed to pay for WiFi, however good luck trying to indentify which WiFi account is yours, as there were 50 with no rhyme or reason to know which to select. I wouldn’t recommend this place to ANYONE, not even a dog. PS- no public free parking at the hotel! $25 garage parking fee!

The Monarch is in a good location with walking distance to the beach and not far from the Ala Moana Mall. (15 Minute wall or close bus ride). A short walk to the centre of Waikiki. The hotel is basic, clean, tidy and the front desk / security are friendly and professional. The double room is ample for family and extra large for a single. Great bakery and pizzeria next door.

Great place to stay closed to the beach and restaurants. Room is clean and the view is spectacular I was few floor up and saw the lake, people walking with their dogs, jogging/running & kayaking on the lake Customer service great, friendly and helpful. Surrounding area is quiet, cleaned & well lit at night. No problem with parking.

Unfriendly staff.. no one smiles... everyone seems miserable.. Never again... needed a late checkout ...had to book another night... made me move rooms... because I had to book up grade room... which was a down grade... a smaller icebox.. dirty floor... nasty.. couldn't wait to leave.

My friend booked this place though Expedia. The only good thing about this place is that the beaches and shops are a 10 to 15 min walk but that is literally it. To begin with this place is like half Airbnb and half hotel? Very strange. They have a parking structure that they share with a ton of other people. If you’re staying here you get a “discounted” parking rate of $25 a day. Our first night they almost didn’t let us park because they were too full. They also charge you $12 a day per person for the hotel amenities which I think included a gym that we didn’t even touch but were charged for it anyways. The rooms at this place are tiny. The beds are old and squeaky. When you’re getting to and from the rooms from the lobby there’s signs warning about an update the the fire alarm ( doesn’t say when) and a warning about ants in your room. Not very appetizing. We had a non smoking room but through the vents somehow are room wreaked of cigarette smoke. The pool here is decent but the jacuzzi needed some attention. The AC unit in our room looked like it was being held up by some napkin of sorts. There was only ONE plug in in the room to charge electronics. That was very inconvenient. It appeared that although both the hotel and Airbnb were located in the same place, the pricing for amenities was different which made no sense. This hotel is very old. I definitely recommend spending more money to stay at one of the nicer hotels down the block.

We were two couples spending 6 days in this two apartment air b&b.It looks like the pictures on the website but it was very old and tired, It is an ex hotel and is situated in the very centre of Waikiki. From our room on the 34th floor we had a view of the ocean. It was walking distance to the beach and close to an early morning breakfast location. The apt offered everything that we needed. It was clean, the bed was very comfortable, shower was good and there was plenty of hot water. The previous guests had left shampoo / dish detergent etc all of which we were expecting to have to buy. We shall do the same.The big downside was with the second bedroom. The slats in the blinds were missing so definitely should be replaced. The window A /C blew directly into your face as one tried to sleep, which resulted in having to turn it off at night, the bed should be moved to the opposite wall otherwise having A/C in that room is useless. It is also stuck at one temperature, so can't be regulated.Three of the lights were not working, again a maintenance issue.We were paying $400 CAD per night ( $200 CAD per night per couple ) so quite expensive especially if it were two adults with children. At those prices it would have been great if the maintenance people had at least checked that everything was in working order before each new guest came in.As we only used the rooms for sleeping in it didn't really spoil our holiday, but if one was cooking and spending a lot of time there it would definitely have been an issue.

This place was terrible. I booked a queen bed with bathtub on my work credit card. Upon arrival, we couldn't park in the lot because we needed a room key to get the low rate (of a steep $25/day!). My partner waited in the car, parked illegally, while I checked in. I was told i needed to provide another card to charge because I didn't physically have the work credit card, and that work could "just pay you back", which is not terribly convenient. I travel for work several times a month and have never had this issue. After we went through the process, I was told "I got you a good bed", just to finally park and crawl up 18 floors to find out we had two full sized beds and no bathtub. We were too afraid to have to go in and out of the parking garage again so we ordered dinner through a delivery service (awesome!) and stopped by the little bodega in the lobby (fine, nice guy). We tried to take showers but had no hot water. Ww tried to watch TV, and could only watch someone's Netflix account that was signed into the Roku TV because the antenna wouldn't hold long enough to watch anything local. We tried to find the pool, and found a hot tub. Excited, we jumped in....to a hot pool of foul-smelling human urine. No joke. It was just steamy urine with broken buttons and flashing lights. Back to our room to cool down in our cold shower (the soap smelled really lovely though) and tried to sleep. Unfortunately, the entire time, day or night, it sounds like chihuahuas driving tiny slick track go carts while a murder of crows cheers them on. We had a lovely view of the boarded up windows across the way, and met a few meth heads on the sidewalk while waiting for our food. Nice front desk staff, and kama'aina discount, but otherwise worse than my hotel in Philly where I found a bloody crack pipe in the bathroom. Definitely a never-again!

This has got to be the MOST filthy and disgusting place I've ever stayed at. Save yourself some trouble, DO NOT STAY HERE. I actually laughed because they take your credit card info for room damage and when I saw the room that was so gross, it looked like a crackhead had lived there for 5 years, we thought: "damage what?" Unless I set this room on fire, it could not get any worse. Smelly, gross, carpet stinks and is dirty with all kinds of nasty crap... I mean, just don't!ASLO, there is absolutely no parking unless you pay extra $25 a day and don't forget the "facility fee". All and all, at the end, you end up paying the same you would for a real hotel.

This hotel is not a 3 star hotel. I’ve stayed in nicer 1 star. There was no microwave. The halls were dirty and a strange absinthe color. My room was dirty, it was not cleaned every day. Dirty cups were left and the sink was not cleaned. There were not even covers on the bed, just scratchy old brown blankets. The only saving grace was the location.

Initially had good interactions confirming reservation. My father became very ill prior and we couldn’t travel. Hotel never even acknowledged my correspondance. Won’t bother when we can rebook trip to Hawaii. I can respect we may have been a day within our ability to get any sort of reimbursement, but was disappointed at not even receiving an email confirming cancellation.

Super convenient location in the perfect spot in Waikiki. 2 min walk to Waikiki Brewing Co....our daily stop on the way out and way back in. Beautiful views, convenient shops and a very clean pool. Close to the world famous beaches of Waikiki. 10 me n walk from Ft Derussey and the Hale Koa Resort.

This place was great for convenience, but sucked with service. We checked in for 3 nights beginning Friday. Our tv did not get any local channels and the WiFi was intermittent. When we called down and reported it on Saturday, housekeeping came and made it worse. Sunday came and and they sent the same housekeeper and the front desk AND housekeeping admitted they had no maintenance workers on the weekend. Seriously?!?! That’s your biggest check in and out days. The front desk gal offered to change rooms and was going to call me back after speaking to her supervisor, yep, no call back. Poor management, stay somewhere else, not here.

Stayed here with my other half for two days. Cheryl at the parking gate was really rude. Went to check-in and there was no one at the Front Desk. They informed me check-in was at two and when I arrived they said it isn't until three. Worst customer service I have ever experienced. Stay somewhere else!

I stayed one night at the hotel. The hotel was worn. The room had a rather dirty wall to wall carpet. The bathroom was not clean. The bed was very hard; it felt like sleeping on the floor. The pillows were hard and lumpy. The air conditioning was efficient but very noisy. I stayed at the fourteenth floor but I could hear the traffic. The WiFi was bad. On top of all the hotel added a $10.47 resort fee. There was no explanation what it covered and you still needed to pay extra fees for using the room safe and the fitness room.

We were given a newly renovated room. (We have been told that the hotel is undergoing renovations) It was clean, and the view was amazing! Nykky the front office manager was very warm and accommodating. Suzie, the young lady who facilitated our check in was very gracious and welcoming. This is our 4th trip and i would say that this is the most memorable because of the wonderful gestures we have been accorded by the people in the hotel. We are definitely coming back... Mahalo

Please DO NOT stay at this hotel ever - very expensive and totally disgusting! We paid $132 a night Run down, stink and moldy - carpets worn & desperately in need of cleaning,(s/be removed), beds hard & lumpy! Pillows worn flat. Bathtub was painted - who paints a tub????? It was peeling!!!Shower walls & shower head was moldy & both had mildew. Basin was disgusting too!!! Housekeeping showed a few days but might as well hadn't because they didn't clean anything! Only straightened the beds. Not one single day! WTF - how is this place still open?????? OMG! My friend booked the room obviously without reviewing it properly. We had no where else to go! Staff not very friendly either. To top if off, they have a pest problem but that's not surprising considering how nasty it is. Also it was extremely noisy in our room no. 1601 - all night & day it repeatedly sounded as if a plane was taking off!! OMG not an exaggeration!!!!!!!If you do come here, do Airbnb only- apparently those units have been remodelled and modernised by their owners.We had to go out and buy slippers just to walk around in the room & stand in the shower. Absolutely revolting and disgusting place! Wifi in room was slow too & apparently they were working on the fire system upgrade but that's not what was making it noisy. I was scared to even take pics of the place.!!!!!!!!!!! Meant to but was in a real hurry to leave the place.But I refuse to make this awful place spoil the beauty of Hawaii & it's people.

The carpet in the room was stained and smelled awful. There was mildew growing in the shower. When I talked to the front desk they refused to give us a different room or a discount. They didn't seem to care their guests were unhappy..

Hawaiian Monarch is one of best regarding location, just 10 minutes walk to the famous Waikiki Beach; Bus closeby buses such as #2 that goes to Downtown; #3 takes you to Pearl Harbor. Their service is great, too, friendly and very helpful.

I booked this accommodation via AirBnb and on that note I felt I got exactly what I expected and paid for in the price, however having seen some of the advertisements of the place elsewhere and the website I feel they could be misleading. I opted for a corner unit on the 22nd floor which was like a studio apartment. The space was nice and perfectly comfortable but the view is what really sold it for me. There are shops, take away food, a bakery and a bar right in the lobby so you don’t have to even leave the hotel to get the essentials if you don’t want to. Should you decide to venture further afield there are several convenience stores and restaurants within a few minutes walking distance. The beach is only a 10-15 minute walk depending on which part you’d like to visit. I would stay here again via the same booking process as it provided value for money, however given the unnecessary additional fee’s I’ve seen charged directly at the hotel I sadly wouldn’t book directly as the price significantly increases thus not providing that same value for the facilities you receive.

A huge thank you to Vanessa and Christine from this Hotel for their compassion and help with me after my husband had a bad fall and had to have major surgery to fix his smashed femur! I am eternally grateful fto them both. It was a relief to have them near as l was alone on the other side of the world from home. The hotel did not have to look after me as l was actually staying in the airbnb side but when we come back again l will definately stay here. The hotel is close proximity to most places, with buses going by on a regular basis. You do need cash for that though. For Vanessa and Christine l wish to say THANK YOU so very much and to let them know Rob is still not walking without a frame but he is getting better each day.

Just pay the extra 30-50 bucks a night for a decent hotel. Aint worth the penny pinching. The bar downstairs is pretty solid. Great bartender. Place to order a burger and sushi in hotel was actually pretty good.

Just like previous reports - Severe liquid stained, discolored carpet, rust on the toilet, major chips, and discoloration in the bathtub. The smell was bad, window shaker as AC had mold all over it. Dust bunnies over the bed on the ceiling were the size of dimes. STAY FAR AWAY!!

Wow! Severe liquid stained, discolored carpet, doodling on the curtains, rust on the toilet, major chips and discoloration in the bathtub, peeling ceiling, an old box tv that wouldn’t even turn on, cockroaches on the coffee maker!!!It was utterly disgusting having to walk on that carpet to get to the bathroom! No one should have to encounter a room that gross! Don’t spoil a wonderful Hawaii vacation by staying here! You deserve better!!! Shocked this hotel passes inspection! This hotel should be condemned!!!!Called and talked to the manager and she wouldn’t admit the condition of the room and did nothing for me, rather hung up the phone on me!!!

The location was great, as it was quite close to Waikiki beach. However, the room and the bathroom weren't very clean. Plus, the staff wasn't very friendly and not helpful. You get what you pay for it seems.

Stayed 10 nights and found it completely adequate.Don't expect top quality, the rooms are run down, the carpets are stained, but clean, housekeeping done daily.Friendly Saff, no issues.The photos seem to indicate you have a microwave in your room, in my case that was not the case.Air Conditioning units are noisey, but thats just the nature of thew window mounted air conditioner, I found turning the aircon up to 75 at night means they barely turned on during the night.I was in a 'Room 16' (1716) which backs on to an Elevator which was quite noisey hearing the elevators going all night, I expect the '01' rooms would have the same issue.Pool is OK, wifi was actually pretty good (25 up / down), they have a new wifi provider so each room as a wifi modem, but the bandwidth is shared to your Cable TV so expect heavy surfing to make your TV signal degrade!Expect to pay $6 for a load of washing (Washed / Dryed)

I came at 10pm and after having me in the recepction for like 30 minutes we got to the room. First thing I saw was the carpet. Super dirty, kind of never cleaned cause a part of it is green and another brown. Then the bathroom. As a human being I need to go to the toilet. I was there for 30 seconds and I saw a lot of hair in the shower and on the floor. The shower was also dirtyWindows have never been replaced, they are rusted and hard to open.After that I was thinking that my bed wasn't clean but it seems to be. It's hard to find where it is cause there's no poster at the street and when you park the car in the entrance it seems to be a small mall.Also, paying 10$ more you can get better hotel and beds. I would not come back to this hotel.

I booked this hotel for six nights and after reading a lot of the reviews I wasn't sure I had made the right choice as many were not very favorable.Seriously, I don't know what is wrong with a lot of you travelers who have rated this hotel so poorly. For the price and location, this hotel is an AMAZING value. Sure, the carpets are a little outdated and it's clearly an older building, but you're on vacation - if these things matter that much to you you're seriously spending WAY too much time in your hotel room. The hotel must have updated their internet provider in the last few months because I'm happy to report they offer wifi in all of the rooms. The hotel does not provide breakfast but there are plenty of choices for food and drinks in the lower lobby and many more within walking distance. The Bus has stops just near the hotel as well. If you're not a stuck up snob expecting gold doorknobs and abalone sinks in the bathroom just because it's in Waikiki, you'll be more than happy in this hotel. Besides, your hard earned money is better spent for fun stuff like shark diving off North Shore or a dinner cruise, not a ridiculously overpriced hotel.

I could list the many things wrong with this place but I am hesitant, since I think this may give the false impression that it is really bad hotel. In fact I don't think it is a hotel at all, I think it is a scam being run by a few people to make a building look somewhat like a hotel. On the first night I found my bed covered in bed bugs, big ones. The 'hotel' staff didnt seem overly concerned about this and seemed bothered to have to find me another room in the 'hotel'. The second room was nicer and cleaner, but I was told that it was only available for me that night and I would have to move again to a different room the next night. The next room was horrible, I couldn't tell the original color of the carpet, there were stains everywhere, fixtures falling apart. However, these things dont bother me so much so I didn't complain, at least this time the bed was clean and no bugs, what luxury!

The hotel parking costs $25/night (cash only) and you have to have a room key for that, otherwise it is more expensive. The desk staff was amiable enough and got me checked in. The room key is required to use the elevator to go to the higher floors. The room was a bit shabby and very cramped. Everything worked and I did get a good night's sleep. The hotel has a salt water swimming pool and, in the lobby, there is a car rental service, places to eat, and a gift shop.

Pictures appear to be from another time... rooms are not what they appear on website. This place needs new carpets, renovations and a good scrubbing! Carpets are stained as well as lamp shades and window coverings. Yikes!!!

Price great and affordable! Front desk help very friendly and helpful! The rooms are okay for the price, and Security was on it. Our first day experience was absolutely great! But here is where we went from great to a not so great experience. On our second day we decided to go to the pool. It was windy out but my babies still wanted to swim. So we spent the day there. We got to the pool at about 1pm on Monday 3/19/18. The wind was whipping around the building. Knowing that the wind will blow all our clothes, cups, plates, food, napkins off the table we lifted the table and placed it behind a wall that was blocking the wind. It was a perfect spot on the pool deck! Our things didn't fly and we were in perfect eye view of our children swimming. It was such a perfect day, until about 4pm ( 3 hours later) when Security advised us that we needed to move the table back to it's original location. I asked him if we can move it back when we are done. I'll make sure of it. He said no it's the rules and we can't see you folks on our cameras. So we did and the wind started to blow our things off the table. I read the pool deck rules and there was no mention of it. I went down to the front desk and asked for a manager to see if the manager would kindly make a minor accommodation by letting us place the table where we were. I was able to talk to the Manager on the phone and asked if she would accommodate us. She explained Security is separate from them and they follow the pool rules. I explained that the pool rules does not mention anything about the moving the table or furniture. She said they follow the AOAO rules. I said okay I didn't get a copy of the AOAO rules when I checked in. She said yes it's their rules. I said okay so it's a rule that I can't see. She said yes and you can be written up for it. I was like written up OMG... LOL!!! I'm a customer here how am I going to get written up... LOL!!! I said you know what that's okay. I went back up to the pool with my family. Not even 15 minutes later a Asian couple dragged....the table and bench along the pool deck floor, and placed it along side the building wall. To not get the couple in trouble, we explained to them that Security will tell them to move the table and bench back. The Asian couple said no it's windy and it'll blow our things. I laughed and said that's what we said, and Security made us move it back. Few minutes after Security came up saw the Asian couple, went over to them, had small chat, and walked away without advising them or telling them to move the table back. I just shook my head and laughed. At that moment I was blown back! I was like what is the difference. Why is it okay for them and not for us. I felt discriminated against. We ended our day and went back to our room. Later that evening my wife goes down to the street sidewalk to smoke a cigarette clearly more than 20 feet away from every entrance, exit, ventilation, and window and Security advised her that she needed to go further around the corner or across the street. At that point I felt like we were being targeted. For what I don't know. They enforced a rule that I can't see, and enforced a smoking law that my wife was clearly in compliance with.... LOL!!! OMG! They have signs that says "no smoking within 25 feet" which is no big deal, but if you going to enforce it make sure it's following State regulations, and if you're going to enforce rules make sure it's readily available or visible so folks don't think they are being discriminated against or bullied. Maybe AOAO or management can come up with something that'll create a better experience. Just a thought. Have a great day everyone!

The room was dirty, the curtains were torn and dirty. There is an amenity of ~$11 on top of the room rate. The clerk could not describe what services we were going to receive for our fee. The shuttle to the hotel was an additional $16 a person. Breakfast at the on site café was very good.

My husband and his friend stayed here for a billiard tournament for a week. Christina at the front desk was AMAZING!!!! She is the best; helped us with our shuttle and our room move. When we got in, the guy at the front desk knew NOTHING and was so rude and unhelpful. Our original room was awful!!! Nasty carpets and needed updating so badly. The next room at least had tile. Honestly, if you really just want a room to lay your head at night, his is your hotel. It’s close to the beach, canal, and shops. Christina is the only reason this hotel got a 3... Everything else was pretty sub par and disappointing.

We stayed on the air bnb side of this hotel. Staff were friendly. Pool area was ok but we were there for the beach. Ten minutes walk to Waikiki. Nice location a short distance from the crowds. Would stay again.

The Hawaiian Monarch Hotel is a middle class hotel, nicely located, close to Waikiki (a walking distance) but not too close. The room was simple but confortable. The service is limited with only a reception, it is located in a big building with plenty of other flats and vacational rentals. I consider it was a good deal for my three days stay in Waikiki

Old, run down. No type of customer service. I had mold in the fridge and dirty baseboards. Reported it twice nothing done. Would never stay again. Hot tub not working and no response to fix it Bakery and take out were good.

This is not a great place by any standards, It also wasn't the worst experience of my life like so many idiot 1star reviewers give it. I will break it down in Pros/Cons. You can decide for yourself if these points are important to youCons:-Like most Hawaiian hotels it is dated. No major renos in the past 30+ years-Thin Thin walls, keeper down..-Drapery, sinks, and showers have major stains. I mean BLACK!-Elevators tend to open 4-6 inches above or below your floor, key card to operate can be clumsy especially after a long night out..- This is a hotel/Air BnB, condo, rent by the hour? I dunno... sketchy people live here. Lots of fighting going on -AC units dated, turning on and off every 5 mins- Room service will not clean your coffee maker, this became the running joke-Front desk staff is very hit or miss-Wifi doesn't exist, you are told it works only in the lobby, my experience the network didn't even show up in the lobby-hidden fees, AKA the gym..-lots of foot traffic in halls (plumbers, electricians, extermination) etc water was off 11-3 monday to friday though not a problem for usPros:-Location Location Location. 5 min walk to everything. beach, shopping, eats, bars, transportation for those single male travelers, close to strip joints if you are into that...-Depending on your room Awesome views-Linens were clean and soft-Parking on site ($25 daily)-Pubs and restaurants on location (never tried them though)-Beautiful pool deck, shallow pool (6feet)-Laundry on site-lowest "BRT tax" of any hotel I found $10.47 dailyWould I stay here again? Well it wouldn't be my first, second third... choice. If you are a single male, on a budget, sure go for it. Just remember "on a budget" I would tell couples and families, and those 1star reviewer A-holes to stay as far away as possible

If you need a hotel JUST to sleep in that is near Waikiki beach and restaurants ect then stay here. If you have any extra money, go to a different hotel. The front desk staff was crabby when we first checked in but other times they were quite helpful and friendly. Pros:1. Location2.comfortable bedCons: 1.Disgusting carpet, stains everywhere2.Bed cover was stained and they don't have fitted sheets on the bed so had to wrestle with keeping the flat sheet covering the bed and just tried not to think about it. Also no bed skirt to cover stains on side of mattress.3. Hot water was shut off on our last day and all they did was comp our resort fee for the day ($10.75) Would have been nice to get a heads up at least4. Walls are paper thin. Someone near us coughed in the middle of the night and I was startled awake thinking there was someone in our room.5. No wifi in the roomsLong story short: My bf is lucky I really like him but there's no way I'm putting him in charge of picking the hotel next time!

Hawaiian Monarch may be an outdated hotel compared to other ones, but Employees makes up for it. The staff were super friendly and very informative. Thanks to Nikkey for the smooth check in and helpul tips. We will definitely come back and recommend this hotel to our friends. Thank you!!!

Horrible place, worst hotel ever, seem to be completely different on photos. Bedroom with old and stinky forniture, a lot of bugs, cockroaches in the room. Poor cleaning. Attendants not very supportive. We ask to change rooms, but only if we pay a very salty difference. I strongly do not recommend!! No wifi in the bedrooms!

Parking is $25/night. There's free parking like a couple of blocks away on the street adjacent to the Ala Wai canal. The room walls are paper thin, so wear ear plugs if you want sleep. We were also near the elevators, so we could hear them all night. The AC was very loud. There is no internet in the rooms. Also, the internet is slow in the lobby. I can't really comment on service, since we didn't really talk to them much. There isn't really anything they can do to fix these issues.

These are the signs that eventually went up after we shared information on equipment conditions day after day after day. I have pictures of the rusted safe they charge an extra$3/ day for, pictures of the filthy stained carpet, drapes and water stained lamp shade in our room. Unfortunately, I can only upload three pictures. There are many more. There is NO internet in the rooms- only in the lobby. Although there is no smoking in the rooms, we could smell smoke nightly from neighbouring rooms. It was difficult to find staff. We often had to ask security to page them to come to the front desk. One time a guy came up wearing ear buds from the back room eating some supper. I guess that’s why he couldn’t hear us calling for assistance... brutal!

Brutal management... many services were out of order, but we still had to pay for most of them. A "resort fee" is charged which partially covers use of the business office. However, the printer in the business office was out of order, the office was adjacent to a night club that was thumping music full blast, and there was a microwave in the business office which resulted in a continuous stream of families with crying children and folks microwaving all types of interesting smelling foods. It was near impossible get anything done in the small space. The hot tub was cold all week, the treadmill in the gym stopped working and didn't get repaired all week, the remote control was dead, the plug-in on the wall, in our room wouldn't charge our phones. When we arrived, we had a plugged toilet and were handed a plunger to look after it ourselves as the maintenance staff had gone home. (This was around 5:30pm) We were told to plunge it ourselves or move rooms. This is after we just unpacked all our things. Vanessa, the manager is not focused on customers. She suggested we leave when we shared our disappointments. We agreed we would find alternative accommodations, but then she indicated she would charge us anyway because we didn't give her 72 hours notice of our departure. Although I had a hard copy of a printed confirmation on the pricing of the hotel in my room, we were charge a higher rate and were not allowed up to our room until we paid the higher rate. Once I returned to the front desk to show the proof of charges on our confirmation, the staff would not refund our money. We had to deal with Vanessa (the manager) the next morning. She then indicated she had to check with her staff. It was a total "gong show" that finally ended in my insisting that the rate on my confirmation letter be honored. Vanessa would then not agree to cancel a second reservation I had made for my children coming in from Canada for a week. She said I had to go online and cancel. So I went to the business office and online, instructions indicated to phone a number, (which was the front desk-Christine) so I walked from the business office to the front desk while on my cell phone to cancel the reservation. Pretty crazy eh? This isn't the whole story. It was a nightmare. I DO NOT recommend this place. It is a zero star in my opinion. I have pictures of the dirty carpets, stained lamp shades and drapes, the rusted safe that they charge $3/day to use and all the out of order signs that I'm happy to share.

wee rented a double apt.. i chose the smaller one as the "single" and my son and girl friend took the double.. they were clean, neat and had all the things you would expect in an apt. they actually had a stove while i had a microwave almost unusable on the stand it was on. my only issue was my silly tv.. it had obnoxious habit of blasting out on commercials and barely able to hear regular programing. and it faded away entirely about every 10 minutes. needs to be replaced.. the bed was comfortable and the open window at night provided lots of fresh air. the bathroom was a tiny bit small but i managed to find a home for everything. the closet was good size but could have used about 6 more hangers at least. the elevators were pokey but always worked good.. parking was ok unless you came in late. folks at counter were always friendly. felt like a safe area to be in at night.. just a few minutes walk to the beach via the hilton properties. we had friends at the hale koa and it was a short walk to see them. a few places to eat close by and several abc stores and 7-11 store. frig worked good and kept food really cold..might have been nicer to have more ice trays for taking lunch to the beach in our cooler, etc. liked the little breakfast nook table and plenty of outlets for all the things that needed charged. all in all i would say, we saved money over any of the nearby hotels and housekeeping was not missed... i did have to sweep up a lot of long black hair when we moved in. . mine is gray and curly so i know it was missed in the last housekeeping. like a lot of b and b's other folks had left some shampoo's and dish detergents, etc...it was easy to wash up dishes and there was an ample supply of anything you needed to eat out of. it was pretty easy to go across the canal and hop on the freeway to any place you wanted to go and easy to walk west to major shopping areas. i would give 4 stars to this property if your into saving money, and don't care about fresh towels every day.. (tho you can use the laundry room if you like. pay machines. )

The hotel charges a "resort fee" but does not have wifi in our room. You have to come to the main floor or business center to access wifi. We came to the hotel to use the Jacuzzi but the water was cold. They had three guys draining the Jacuzzi and filling it with hot water once we inquired about the temperature. After 20-30 minutes the water was still luke warm so they started bailing water out with a small pail. When I requested my "resort fee" be refunded, the front desk staff had to check with a manager.... we still have not been compensated. The rooms have old TV's that shut off randomly on their own and the hot water in the shower is rare. It appears to be a budget, but by the time all the taxes and resort fees etc are added, you might as well go to a "nicer" hotel as you end up paying the same.

OK the property is a little old, but I was told so is the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani and it was almost double the price when I made my booking! Water is hot in the shower and basin, bed was a little stiffer than I like - cable TV was good and a new air conditioner. Free local phone calls and wifi were handy for making local travel arrangements and small places to eat locally were great. Bus routes to everywhere are close by. Room service was great and they always gave me an extra coffee bag when I asked. For a three star room I couldn't ask for more. Thanks for reading!

For the total cost of 111$ (which included the 10$ resort fee)., it is ok for waikiki. The location is ok, it is a 2 block walk to the beach. I liked the pool and sundeck area. the wifi was only in the lobby. There is an weight room in the basement but I didnt have time to use it. it is an easy walk to the bus. The room size is small, the bed , TV and bathroom are ok. there is a coffee maker in room (the front desk will give you an extra coffee). This hotel is combination of condominiums and long stay rentals. The front desk is friendly. The place does show its age, it has had repairs. I have been to hawaii many times, staying in hotels seem such a waste, I spend more time out than in the room. I would stay here again as long as the price is low.

I'd give this place a D minus. Internet- didn't work. Printing boarding pass- no toner, so, printed one using the front desk's printer; it didn't work at the boarding gate. (Good thing we were early to the airport.) Cleanliness, grout was dirty, mirror had plaque spots, top of refrigerator door had old food crumbs. Shampoo- didn't always leave one. Towels and sheets- CLEAN! Shuttle service to the airport- cheaper if you called on your own. There were stains on the carpets, and little ants all over the bathroom! It is about the same level as a hostel - without the noise. Wouldn't stay here again!!!

1) The hotel is far away from the beach2) The room was small, the carpets had major stains on them, the bed was extremely uncomfortable3) The location of the hotel is also far away from multiple choices of food Overall, small and dirty room not worth the price paid.

I stayed at the Hawaiian Monarch Sept 12 to Sept 20. 44 Storey Hotel-Condo located to the far NW of Waikiki but near to many TheBus routes making it very easy to get around the whole of Honolulu. Around 800m from the beach via DeRussy Park and to the side the Ala Wai Canal with a lovely long canalwalk.Room was a corner SE view with great view (22nd floor) but downside was of the 5 venetian blinds only three actually worked as the other two's strings had been snapped. Bed comfy and bathroom neat. Air-con not great as only went down to 60F and with the sun pouring through the windows it got more than a little hot esp. with two blinds knackered.Counter staff were extremely courteous and keen to help no matter what the query was. Three eateries on site (2 breakfast cafes and 1 Chinese take-a-way) plus a small convenience store.Resort fee only $10 per night (compared to the other properties in Waikiki) gave access to a fitness ctr, basic pool and sundeck, Internet access downstairs by lobby and free local calls (on vacation who the hell do you know locally anyway?) and coffee-tea maker.

I travel on business, usually with short notice. I booked this as the least expensive hotel within walking distance of a meeting I was scheduled to attend in Waikiki. I had low expectations but was very pleased with this room. It is clean, well maintained and the hotel has internet services, There is a laundry room on the fifth floor. It has everything I needed or wanted for a 5 day business stay. I would stay here again if I was in Waikiki.Disadvantages include a small room. I am guessing about 250 square feet. This is enough for one or two people but not enough for a family of 4. The key card stopped working 2 times in a 5 day stay. The front desk was helpful in reprogramming the key to work.

Horrible Hotel, should be taken off Hotwire web site , Slum Hotel & terrible no customer service from Management Hotel had a water problem / leaks Room carpet water stains , dirty Bed Bugs , furniture looks like from the 70's , terrible bed every thing in room was Dirty bad condition , Hotel needs a total Remodel. Would never recommend any one stay to stay there. Hotel has a 2.5 star rating that's way over rated Hotel needs a half a star rating.

Stains on a real worn out green carpet, bed was uncomfortable and hard on my back, poorly working little a/c that is so rusted; bathroom needs to be remodeled and tub trashed. It wasn't clean and rusted around the drainage and fixtures. I've never been in a hotel before that in this bad condition and to top it off, the long haired front desk guy wasn't friendly. Its as if it'll hurt his face to crack a smile! I don't recommend this place to anyone!

Stayed at the Hawaiian Monarch hotel for 2 nights. The room is really old with stained green carpet. The bed was full size and it was hard. The bath tub was stained and it looked like it wasn't cleaned at all. Rust stains around the drain and shower fixtures. The a/c wasn't working like it should and to top it off, the morning from desk person wasn't warm or friendly. He didn't even crack a smile. That should be a good sign that he wasn't enjoying his job at this poorly maintained hotel. We checked in at Waikiki Sands Villa hotel after our 2 night stay at the Monarch. Much better place, friendly helpful staff and the hotel room is excellent plus, the balcony had a great view of Ala Wai Canal & part of Diamond Head. Just 2 blocks from Waikiki Beach. Don't waste your money staying at the Monarch! Disgusting!

I was surprised by how pleasant this hotel is for the low price. Room was clean with a great harbor view. Quiet and nothing fancy but an economical place to stay. I had not rented a car so parking was not a problem. Walking distance to the Ala Wai and the harbor and the Convention Center.

If you aren't spending a lot of time in your accommodations then renting a condo in this building is fine. We did not stay in hotel portion but got a two room condo with kitchen It was totally adequate for the price. Staff is not helpful The best part of the building is a small coffee shop-the Maleko right inside the entrance. The owner knew our orders the second day we were there and the pastries are homemade and delicious

1. The parking is cash only ??? I was staying and got stuck with no hotel parking. 2. Bathroom has mold. Paint doesn't kill mold!!3. No wifi in my room.4. Furniture and bed from the 60's5. Curtains carpet and lamps are stained and from the 60's6. Little money has been put back into the Monarch because it has popcorn ceilings ghetto carpet and rusted fridges. The hotel needs a lot of upgrading. 7. Even the lamp shades are nasty!Respectfully,A military combat vet

We stayed at the Hawaiian Monarch and rented a car. Parking at the hotel is $25 US a night at the associated but separately owned car park. The staff at the car park are rude and behave in a manner that could be described as bizarre. We pulled up and asked politely about the rates, stating that we were staying at the hotel. The female operator started yelling at us and stated that we must pay up front and clearly show that we paid the amount due as in her words,"everything is under camera." She then continued to rant and carry on. When we asked whether there was set parking bays she yelled anywhere except in a tow away zone. If we weren't staying at the hotel, we would have gone elsewhere.

Our client checked in at the Hawaiian Monarch and was sadly quite unimpressed. Photos were shared of filthy walls, counters, carpet, ripped sheets, etc. When your put the fate of others' reviews into your hands when making a reservation at an unknown property, it's clear you are aware of everything - good and bad. Therefore, note the pictures attached.

Do not expect a fancy hotel. Clean rooms with a TV, bar fridge, air con and a coffee maker that can be adapted to be a teapot. Wifi limited to the lobby, laundromat (which takes credit cards) and business centre. That would make it average but pushing it up to good is that(i) A convenience store and budget Japanese eatery are on site as a bakery cafe and the Cream Pot breakfast/brunch. (ii) It's close to a lot of things. The main and glitzy part of Waikiki and the beach are a 5 to 10 minute work, ditto the McCully restaurants and shops. The Ala Moana shopping plaza is also within walking distance. Diamond head, Waikiki Aquarium and Honolulu zoo are all just a short taxi/Uber away. So you can get the Waikiki experience without the hefty price tag

Stayed here for 5 nights 27TH of April checked out 2nd of May. Initial reaction to the place was disgraceful. John at reception left a huuuuuge impression and not in a positive way. He's attitude and customer service skills were unbelievable. Not how we wanted to start our holiday at all. To be honest all the staff were less than desirable and we avoided talking to them at all costs. This was until we met Jeremiah he was outstanding thank you. Friendly talkative helpful everything you would expect from a concierge. So thank you for your help and kindness.The room itself was spacious and open with the standout feature being the amazing view of the mountains. The air conditioning was loud so very loud though. Wi-Fi was non existent unless you were sitting in the bloody laundry and even then it was dial up slow. The place was about 10-15min walk from Waikiki which was nice. But I think I'd pay the extra to stay closer.I don't think I'd stay again nor recommend it. The extremely poor service from majority of the staff (except Jeremiah) the terrible Wi-Fi and distance from everything just makes this kind of a pointless place to stay. It doesn't feel Hawaiian and doesn't put you close enough to really justify being "in" Waikiki.As my title says, it did its job but I'd never come back sorry.

Great customer service. Thank you J for the excellent customer service! Our stay was wonderful. Definitely coming back!! Nice room with a spectacular view. Great location and affordable price!!!! Make your reservations and ask for J!!!

Checked in the room for 3 days. The AirBNB condo was very suitable for 5 people. The price is great and the condo had every thing a hotel wouldn't have (silverware, plates, washer and dryer, tubber ware) etc. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The room was also clean and smelled good. Yes there were loud noise from the traffic but I live in the Bay Area so I'm use to it. I would def stay again for the price and the location.

we had an AirBNB in this hotel. It was a penthouse booked through the agent Hide. It was very good and I have put a review on AirBNB. As to the hotel the lifts were a little slow but it was a budget hotel The pool was fine. The BBQ was clean and adequate. There was an on site laundry ( which we didn't use) and the location was fine. A 15 minute walk to downtown Waikiki. There was a small store on site which sold alcohol and other essentials. There was decent sized supermarket a short walk away. It was in Hobron Lane.

I was more than happy with this budget hotel (and one needs to remember that it is low cost and therefore no Sheraton). The room was adequately sized for two of us, it was serviced daily, we had a great view, TV, fridge and microwave. The jacuzzi and the pool on the roof moved this from a four to a five overall rating for me. My only VERY minor moan would be that wifi can only be accessed in the foyer or the business centre (which is just a room but a comfortable one).The hotel was in a great position, close to bus stops, shops and with really helpful staff. I'd most certainly stay at this hotel again.And don't be alarmed if there are a raft of police cars at the front of the hotel - unless they've sirens and lights happening, they're likely there for the sushi at the unassuming burger and sushi bar in the foyer.

I have too say first, i did book through Air BnB. But it was a condo in this hotel, Would i go back NO!! Nor would i recommend. The hotel itself is in need of a good clean up, it is smelly from the time you walk through the entrance, The lifts are slow, But have to admit most of the staff are friendly.Our room was meant to be a refurbished and remodeled room, But i would not think it was, Did have a new bed and sheets etc, but behind doors and in nooks and crannies it was dirty and dusty. Something scratching in the wall every morn ,like 2 am, woke us up every night. NOISE is huge, open window and the traffic and sirens were massive, and turn on a/c and it was to noisy. Also VERY tiny, You get a hard dining chair or a bed to sit on, thats it.

Jeremiah and Christina were helpful at front desk. Enjoyed the roof top jacuzzi. Location suited my family we enjoyed walking around the heart of waikiki and were happy to be staying on the outskirts where its not so congested.

just got back from 2 weeks in Hawaii. did 1 week in maui and 1 week in Oahu. Stayed at this hotel for 3 days. Ended up booking another hotel and left this room empty for the remainder of the trip. Hotel is dated and has a disgusting muggy smell. Rooms are dirty. Building very dated. Elevators are slow. parking is 25$ USD a day which is paid upfront. Stay elsewhere... Very outdated.

Had an excellent experience. Staff were friendly and social, sun terrace was beautiful with sun all day long. Close enough to shops, beach and restaurant. Good price for what is on offer! Would stay again!The only downside was finding holes in the bedsheets otherwise an overall superb stay.

I had a recent business meeting in Honolulu and my family decided to join me :-). It was cost prohibitive for me to book 2 hotel rooms at the Convention hotels.So we looked at various alternatives and found this location through Airbnb - a first for us.After reading all the reviews, mapping its location and proximity to the Hawaiian Convention Center, we settled on this location.Our flight arrived near midnight local time after having left the East coast around noon. We finally got to our condo, exhausted and tired. The ride from the airport was about 20 minutes. We got our keys and decided to park our car. We were surprised to learn that parking was $25/day - CASH for guests, payable upfront. Fortunately, we were able to muster some cash and pay in advance for the next several days and parked our car. We then proceeded to check into our condo. The entrance to our condo led us to 2 doors, each leading to an individual room/unit.The rooms were modest, each with a queen bed and individual bathrooms. They each had a tiny kitchenette, refrigerator and sink.We crashed and slept for a few hours to wake up to brilliant sunshine and spectacular views. The rooms were average, and the bathrooms really needed an upgrade with metal streaks in the bathtub and caulk falling off from various areas.I somewhat knew this but was surprised to how shoddy it was. But, we were not staying here for the amenities but rather the location and lower cost. It was in Waikiki, near the other big hotels, convention center and the beach - all within a 10-15 minute walk. And I feel, this is where this hotel/condo delivered. We had a great time and I do not recall anyone one ever complaining about the hotel or their room. We were able to get out every day and do what we wanted. Several chain stores like 7-11 and ABC are nearby for any amenities you may need and the the prices were comparable to the mainland.Overall, I would say, our stay was a pleasant one.

The location is the only thing good about this place. The rooms are filthy! The bathtub has not been properly cleaned in years! The beds are very hard, the pillows are flat, the sheets are not changed regularly. The walls and carpets are dirty. Don't even think of sitting on the room chairs without a towel. No wifi in rooms and is hit & miss in the "business centre". The attached parking is a rip off, they only have a 24 hour option. Cash only and they complain about writing a receipt. They never marked down my departure time and so I had to pay twice in the same day. Stay away from the Hawaiian Monarch Hotel ! I met several other people in the elevator that said the same things. By the way, elevators were always malfunctioning. Most days 1 or 2 of six , operating, leading to long waits. The place has a very bad odor.

Great amenities. Lovely pool, spa pool and BBQ area but the BBQ could do with a flat plate as well as the grill.Nykky was most helpful at Check out time calling a shuttle and ringing through to confirm ongoing places for us.

I'm embarrassed for the Malihinis (Visitors) who come from all around the world to come visit the beautiful Hawaii Nei and have booked this hotel.Please avoid staying here, unless you don't care about customer experience. It doesn't exist here at the Hawaiian Monarch. It used to...When I was younger, this was a popular go to place to stay and the night club used to host a line waiting to just get in.Today, it is barely a whisper of what it should be.Upon my arrival, the front desk guy who greeted me was not very welcoming. In fact, he's the opposite. In his very monotone and unenthusiastic voice with his blank facial expression, he checked me in. Actually, it was a painful process that doesn't blend in well with the Aloha spirit.I did like his unique "Bowl" style haircut. When I got into my room, it seemed okay at first glance but when I continued to settle in and unpack, I started to notice the unpleasant details.The rug. It's in many shades of green. Green mildew. Green stains. Green mold. Faded green to yellow patches from possible stain washes in the last several years.The furniture looks like items you may find on the street side walks to be repurposed to use as new furniture. Even the small refrigerator sits on the floor by the entrance door (#ghetto) - which makes it difficult to open and close the fridge.There's no wifi in the rooms but there is wifi in the laundry room.The hotel charges a $10.00 per day "resort fee", you would think they can work in a way for wifi.[Small note: just a heads up, the swimming pool is a salt water pool]The second desk person I met there was a young woman who was very charming and engaging. We chatted and she had a very nice disposition. I had asked about extending my stay to a later check out. She told me to call the front desk in the morning of check out.I called and recognized her voice, she told me the hotel was fully booked and I couldn't have my late check out.Well, I was a little sad but then, that sadness turned into being upset when I logged into Orbitz Com and discovered there were rooms available when I was told it wasn't.I don't like liars.My trip wasn't horrible, I spent most of my time with friends and family.Finally, when I checked out, there were 4 people behind the front desk. I stood there for a minute. Finally, with no greeting, I was asked, "do you need help?" I looked at all four them and thought, no wonder this hotel is a slum. They don't have the right people working here.I hope by reading this you'll find something else on our beautiful island as better accommodations.If you're young and don't care - this is the place for you.

Nykky at the front desk is everything!!!!!! I stayed here for 9 nights and upon arrival, I knew I will be in great hands when Nykky check us in. Very friendly and the customer service that was provided was exemplary! Affordable place and again THANK YOU NYKKY...Mahalo, til next time!!!

Nykky at the front desk got me a room without a prior reservation and no charge for early check in. Good service! I will be back. This hotel has come a long way back. The 7/11 next door is convenient for early coffee.

Stayed here for 8 nights in the condo section booked through another source. This place is almost like staying in the ghetto.Whilst the room wasnt anything special (get what you pay for) the window for the room is hard to open/close and can be easy to fall out of thereby being unsafe, especially those with children as there is no fly screen despite being up pretty high.Throughout the duration of our stay our floor and room constantly smelled of cigarettes and marijuana despite there being a no smoking policy enforced upon the building. We addressed this issue to the building security who did nothing about itPower outlets are hard to come by and if by chance you do find one its in a hard to reach place, laundry costs $6, the staff and security act like they are doing you a favour just by doing what they are paid to do and should NOT be working in a hotel residence. Dont even bother going to the spa, there is no heat.To top it off we recieved a noise complaint and was fined $25 due to the condo residents (who are smoking up the place btw) because our door kept "slamming" which is a maintenance issue due to our door being faulty and instead of being informed by security that they had recieved compliants they let it wait until the complaints built up and decided to fine us without a warning (going back to my point of incompetent and rude staff)--Too long didnt read--- Arrogant staff- Incompetent/lazy security- Some hallways smell like cigs/weed- Overpriced Laundry- Building residents are arrogant - Elevators take 6 years to get anywhere- Building needs a serious overhaul as it is still stuck in the 1980s Would not reccomend this place. It can easily ruin your holiday, opt for spending more for a 100% better quality stay.

I found the place close for shopping food etc but always a twenty minutes walk to go near a beach. Plus no chair available unless you pay for it 12$us per day. Also the place has a smell of dampness in the corridor...the condo apartment are cleaninside . First time in a condo apartment has a vacation and last time. Hawaii isn't for people who loves to swim in the ocean Wakiki is just full of rocksother places in the Bahamas are nicer than Wakiki beach. Pearl Harbor is a tourist attraction but a Tour to see more of Honolulu and the Doleplantation is worth it if you have to pick one of them.To just conclude if you want a city near a beach full of rocks this is the place very high buildings.If you want beauty, go to Turk & Caicos this is Paradise and much closer.

Things that surely can be evaluated positively are:- polite staff at the front desk & the cleaning ladies- location- additional services available in the hotel/surroundingsIt's a really good place for those who are not looking for a luxurious interiors, but rather plan enjoying the island during most of the day and just come back to sleep and rest. There was everything we needed for a medium-term stay like a refrigerator and microwave, so it was possible to prepare simple meals and get a breakfast quickly in the morning. The beds were wide and comfortable.

We booked through Hotwire, if I had known they would book this hotel for us I would never have done it. The internet was down the 4 days we were there. The excuse was it was down in all Waikiki...odd as it was available at a cost everywhere we went nearby, which we had to do to make our plans. We came for the marathon so not having an ice machine or be able to soak in a tub ( only a half tub that all the glazing was peeling off). We were refunded the amenities fee, I would have rather had the amenities and enjoyed my stay in Honolulu. I looked into taking the $750 for the four days as a loss and move to another hotel but due to the marathon it was almost impossible. We were on the 20th floor so didn't have the street noise other people complained of. When I read the reviews after my hotel was booked I was very worried about this hotel. They staff were pleasant and stated that this is a "basic" hotel. I may be wrong but wifi, ice and an undamaged tub should be expected in any basic hotel.

Stayed in a penthouse and the view was amazing but wished there was a balcony. Good location, 10 to 15 minute walk to beach, shops and restaurants. Furniture in rooms dated but place was clean. Would I stay there again?...probably not.

I stayed at room on 26th floor as vacation rental. It has a kitchen and two single beds as well as big window with canal view. The facility has a big pool with jacuzzi and laundry on 5th floor. You can enjoy the view of DeRussy park from there.The location is very good for walking to center of Waikiki, Ala Moana shopping center, Convention Center and Mccully/MoiLiiLi where there are a big discount supermarket, Don Quijote, and reasonable restaurants just the other side of Ala Wai canal. All are walking distance.There is a grocery store, bakery and cute restaurant on the first floor.You can get on the the BUS, #2 and #4 at the stop at "Kalakaua Ave. + McCully St." and #8, #19, #20, #23, #42 and #98A at "Ala Moana Bl + Opp Kalia Rd" by five minutes on foot.Well.., the room might depend on the owner. Fortunately, the room is cozy and clean with WiFi and basic cable TV included. Reasonable price. One thing the facility needs update is laundry on 5th floor, though.

On my arrival at Reception I was informed that although I believed I had paid fully on my booking prior to arrival, the Hotel charged me an additional $10 per day for the "..privilege of using the "facilities"...". This was charged although the Hotel had closed its poolside and pool for repair for a full month. In addition, although the Hotel provides a safe for secure storage in each room, this was at an additional daily charge of $3; ie the safe obviously is not falling within the Hotel's "facilities" charged at the $10 per day!! Otherwise the room was clean, sufficiently large and the cleaning personnel were good. The Hotel should be more upfront with ALL its actual costs and not mislead guests by a Policy of ....catch 'em on the "cheaper booking" then hit them with the REAL charges when they arrive!!

This is a very Bad Hotel. I don't recommend this hotel to anyone. The hotel is pricey too. Doesn't suit to couples, families with kids. I went to Hawaii vacation recently with my wife. We first landed in Honolulu and were excited as soon as we landed at HNL airport. But as reached hotel we were very depressed by the look of the room. I paid 200$ for 2 nights which was very pricy. Please don't consider this hotel.Cons:1. Very bad carpet. There were stains on the carpet2. Room was very very small.3. No wifi in the room. 4. No free parking, I have to pay $50 for 2 days for car parking.5. The person at the front desk was unfriendly.Pros:Just one. The location is close to Waikiki beach, 15 mins walk.

Room was nice, clean and quiet. The super helpful Nykky at the front desk upgraded us to a higher floor with an ocean view - and he did this without us having request it. Super customer service from the front desk! That sweet gesture made our stay. True, the interior needs some updating and upgrading. We got a wonderful rate $80/night and are just a block or two from the beach and Ala Moana. Parking garage is $25 cash only per night. All in all, I'd stay here again. Just a quick FYI - the hotel pool is closed November 1, 2016 to December 1, 2016.

Was expecting something a little nicer after seeing website - boy was I wrong. Got there and got slapped with a 90 amenities fee even though have the amenities weren't working. Have access to the laundry room was great paying six bucks a pop to use dryer or washer not so much. Everything was run down and the carpets in the room were not clean. Got charged 5 dollars extra to clean towels because it had a spot of makeup on it. And the best thing you could only use the Internet - which was charged as part of the amenities fee in the lobby.
