No room access, in today's ages that's almost ridiculous. The TV in the room was tiny, and the air conditioner was incredibly loud. I'm sitting here trying to find a positive and I'm just lacking. The staff were OK. Would not come back here and would actively discourage people from wasting there money here!

Outdated, dirty, old, bed hard as a rock.. those words pretty much sums up the room. The first thing I saw when I got to our room was a cockroach, and there was pest control sign all over the elevators and lobby. Initially booked for 5 nights but we left after the first night. The receptionist staff refunded us for the rest of the nights. Would not recommend !

Hotel was old and outdated. Wifi only available in the foyer, not the room. Lady on reception when we first got there was lovely and super helpful. Later on when we came back the guy on reception was rude and uninterested and unmanned with no bell to ring for service. The rooms were clean and tidy and bed was comfy. Air con is loud and clunky and shoots straight onto the beds. If u want something cheap for a night or two it's ok but wouldn't stay for an extended period. Needs some work done but is a roof over your head.

This hotel sits just off the main road and is about a 5-10 min walk from the beach. The lobby area was a bit of a mess with an independent bar/nightclub on the basement level, uninterested staff at front desk and a fast food shop is the first unit that greets you. The nightclub was quite loud but couldn't hear it from our room (we were on the 20th floor). The view from the room was lovely and the bed was comfy. Bathroom was clean and spacious. There was also a safe in our room.There is a 7/11 shop around the corner and a couple of good eats within walking distance. Hotel prices in Waikiki tend to be quite expensive. At $115 per night this hotel was quite cheap and I was very happy with what we got. For that reason I'd stay here again.

Tired, grubby and over priced. Well overdue for refurbishment. Not recommended. Hard to be complimentary of this establishment but I suppose the location is ok. Pool is very basic.Staff were rather disinterested. I wouldn't stay again.

This place posts photos on its site making it look like it's a Condo you are renting.. albeit outdated but still looks livable, it is not, we were given a room the size of a broom closet with stains all over the carpet, the bathroom was moody and even the toilet seat was so discoloured it looked like it was from the Stone Age and if you sat on it you might either get a disease or a sliver on your butt.. we walked right back out, I'm not uppity I don't mind outdated but I do want a room that's habitable and clean.. what they advertise and what you get are not the same thing.. at 2am myself who is a brain cancer patient and my other half were looking for a safe clean place to stay in.. they still charged us for the night, craziness..

For what we paid for it was not worth it.. It was old, we felt like we were at a quick stop cheap dirty hotel. The day we arrived on the 09th Sep 16 we kindly asked front desk for assistance trying to get checked in, the guy (I wouldn't call him a gentlemen) was so rude and unhelpful. After a long flight, long queues at the airport we were relieved arriving to the hotel but it wasn't the welcoming we were hoping for, by my second question to the guy at the front desk he literally rolled his eyes at us pointing to the lower level.Old, dirty feeling in the lifts and through the corridors right to the rooms, most nights we couldn't sleep feeling so dirty and disgusting. The bed we slept on felt like it was falling apart!!! Luckily we were in and out everyday and it was just a place to leave our bags and sleep. We've never been so happy leaving once we checked out. Don't recommend at all!!

Considering what we paid to stay in this hotel, I am sorry to say that it is not worthy the price... The hotel is really old, the carpet is terrible (the housekeepers use to perfume it every day when they clean the rooms...), the bath was rusted... And the staff don't care about guests at all! Bad bad bad...

Check in staff was definitely not welcoming but the other staff were good. Flight from Australia we got there at 1.30pm and couldn't check in until 3.00.Went to bar to get something to eat and was verbally abused by drunk/drugged local. Don't recommend at all!

I wouldn't recommend this hotel because the room was small and not so clean. The bathroom was very tight and the bathtub was stained and looked dirty, The person who checked us in was not friendly at all. I had to remind him that I paid the fees through you folks. For the price charged, I was quite disappointed. The parking fee was $25.00 cash if you stayed at the hotel and $30.00 if not. We paid but had no parking when we returned and had to part along the non marked wall.

Clifford Johnson was a very helpful staff. He actually guided us and told us about buses and places to visit. He has been a very approachable person. The hotel was not very clean and was very outdated. If you are just there to sleep and do activities during the day then it is ok. But to relax ...noooo.

Staff makes me feel like they are doing me a favor to be there. Old and tired, mattress should have been retired years ago. I have stayed in a lot of properties in this area, and this is the worst. Skip it and try one of the others

Stayed here for the great price very reasonable rates, cost included use of the business center, gym and pool. Also the location is very near to the Convention Center where the Comic Con was held...it was a very short 5 minute walk. Also the location of this hotel is near to lots of restaurants and not just one 7-11 but 2 directly across each other not to mention an ABC store. The lobby area where you check in seemed a bit dirty and dusty and the elevator was slow but the room was very clean with a nice view. Didn't spend much time in the room did mostly visit old friends and family inaddtion to the Con. I would definitely stay here again.

I'm a local braddah that, reluctantly, booked a one night stay at the Hawaiian Monarch. I had stayed here a while ago and gave it an unfavorable rating. I now give it a "terrible" rating. I would not advise this hotel for anyone traveling with family. I'm a large guy but even I felt a bit uneasy walking through the lobby during evening hours and, heaven forbids, early morning. After my function I checked out the bar in the lower level of the hotel for a night cap and quickly made an "about face". Looking in, the people there were sketchy and a local dude at the front suggested that I not go in(?). Had an early flight so I checked out at 4;30 am. It seems that all the drunken low-budget Waikiki party goers (two dozen or so) congregate in the front of the hotel waiting for the bus(?). Some were still drinking alcohol! Now about the hotel. I would rate my room "fair" but my bath tub "horrific"! It was terribly discolored (stained) and filthy. I wore my slippers (flip flops) when I showered and I still felt yucky!!!!!! Didn't want to touch anything in the bathroom, especially the tub. Logistically, nothing is really in easy walking distance of the hotel except for a few convenience stores and a burger/pub across the street. Beyond that, it's a 20 - 30 minute walk to anything of interest. Waikiki Beach, I'm guessing, is a 30 - 45 minute walk away. Parking is a joke. If you're staying at the hotel, it's $25 a day. Parking is limited so I saw the attendant telling numerous hotel guests that the lot was full but they could "double park" if they wished?????????? I was extremely fortunate to find on street parking so I was free of this debacle. On my previous review, I mentioned nearby pay parking lots that were more affordable. These, however, were closed and fenced off. Check-in was a joke and you get charged an additional fee upon check-in. Don't know what the fee was for since I paid additional fees on-line. I think it was called a "convenience fee" but I could be wrong. Long story short, I would only suggest staying here if you are extremely short of funds and only need a place to sleep. Keep away if bringing your family and loved ones. This was my second stay at this hotel and my last.

Rooms are a lot smaller than pictured on site. Carpet ,beds & bath tub very old and worn . Free wifi only works in Lobby&laundry room. Entire place full of termites .staff acts like its a bother if you ask for anything like towels . At $158 a night I expected at least a cleaner place. This felt like a motel .

My wife and I rented out a newly renovated vacation rental for a week during our stay in Oahu. The room had a TV, Desk, pull out island to cook stuff, full kitchenware, dinner table for 2, stove, microwave, fridge, ironing board, iron, hair dryer, the tub/shower had a soap/shampoo dispenser, bbq set for the grill downstairs, beach towels, and more i'm sure im forgetting. The view was actually good from the 29th floor. The customer service at the desk is horrible. They acted like we were interrupting there candy crush time. There is a gym on the bottom floor for 5$ a person for your full stay, laundry room is also in hotel but it costs quarters, pool and bbq grill is free. The parking was 25$ a night but we found free parking on the canal, its hard to find parking but its worth it if you find one for free.

Pictures looks good but once you get in your room, it's a dump, everything! Sooo disappointed. The check in process was so bad we only ended up staying one night instead of one week. Unprofessional and quite rude asian man at the counter who fought with us when we show him our receipt/confirmation from "booking.com" that it's all wrong, etc. Needless to say...stay out of this hotel.

Booked hotel through Hotwire for an overnighter Dr. visit. The front desk person was very friendly and helpful. The hotel room was a little run down and could use could use some renovating but we knew it wasn't a luxury hotel to begin with and didn't expect much. The overnight parking is pricey but there were a lot of stalls and the access to the elevator to our room was very close and easy to navigate. I would stay there again if we had to.

PROS: 1. Good value in comparison to other hotels in the area.2. Friendly staff.3. Clean accommodation.4. Nice sized pool.5. Well equipped gym (cost included in amenities fee).6. Air conditioner was very cold (a little noisy, but didn't bother us).7. Nice view of the Ala Wai canal.CONS:1. Bad signage making it difficult to locate the front desk for check in.2. Elevators are not well marked (one side services the hotel and the other services the condos).3. Smaller than average room size.4. Poor water pressure (shower).5. Parking garage is not owned by the hotel, so you can't charge it to your room. Parking is $25.00 for 24 hours. Cash only.6. There is no balcony and the only window seemed to been sealed shut.7. The mini fridge had a big crack in the door insulation, so even with the temperature set to max, it wasn't very cold.8. WiFi available only in the lobby and laundry room (cost included in amenities fee).OTHER POINTS:1. Bring toiletries, even if you're only staying overnight because there's just one small, thin bar soap for both hand and body washing.2. Pack or buy pool towels. There are none available at the pool, but you can check out a regular bath towel from the front desk (if available).We only stayed for 3 nights, so none of the above "cons" were crucial enough for us to complain to management about and overall, we did enjoy our stay and would return again.

I felt like we were at home. I would recommend this hotel for everyone I know. We received exceptional customer service from Nykky Valaiz, and Rachel. We were just amazed and the energy these two employees have.

front desk girl cristina has a bad attitude when checking you in. my husband and I ended up checking out the next day. supposed to have stayed for 1 week, but ended up finding another hotel with a way more better experience. price was a bit more but worth it. cristina made us feel like we were bothering her. she kept talking over my husband, and I whispered to my husband to talk slow because maybe she doesnt understand what hes asking her. we asked for the manager, but she was in a meeting. rooms were clean, and it comes with a microwave! definitely a PLUS. housekeeping came quick when we requested more towels. the other guy nicky was very pleasant, and I wish we would have had HIM check us in instead of her. then maybe we would have stayed longer.

Booked this hotel through Expedia. I got lost finding the lobby! It was actually located on the second floor!! Checking in was easy. The lady that checked us in talked so soft I could barely hear anything she was saying/explaining. There's a parking garage next door which you'll have to pay for. I believe it was $25/day with proof of room key. It was sort of a hassle to be checked by the ticket clerk everytime you go in or out of the garage since they charge for expired tickets. The room was small and decent for a couple like us who won't be staying in much. Air conditioner was those portable ones where you stick through the window. Bathroom was tiny. Even the tv was tiny. Bed was okay. No room service like other yelpers have mentioned before. Even no ice machine! Errr. Also, no wifi even though the front clerk gives you the wifi info and password. My phone couldn't find their wifi connection so it was no use!! Location was great though, it was part of waikiki so close to every tourist spot. Overall, just a nice decent place to leave your things and come back to rest.

I had a room, not a condo so I can only speak for the rooms. The rooms are Motel quality, not hotel. I stayed there 3 nights as part of a solo business trip. I was in room 2302 on the 23rd floor. I am not a picky person and living here locally only needed a place to sleep and wash up, but this place was even below these basic requirements. They are not cleaning the rooms properly. There was foreign hair on my shower wall upon arrival, and the same hair was there throughout my stay. Also, I had dinner on the table provided in the room and there were crumbs left over. The next day the crumbs were still there which tells me they did not wipe the table, or clean the shower. The walls are REALLY thin. You can hear the next room conversation, so it is NOT the place for a "romantic" getaway. The AC in the room is really LOUD. And if you turn it off, the room gets hot and stuffy really fast. I had to turn the TV up just to hear it, but outside the room I could hear my TV clearly in the hallway which made me uncomfortable to think I was disturbing others although I could barely hear it in my room. The boxspring had brown stains on it and I was scared to walk barefoot on the faded green dingy musty carpet. You will need to use your room key to ride the elevator up, and after the first day, my card refused to work to take me back up to the 23rd floor. The receptionist acted like they couldn't do anything about it saying it should still work for my room door, but never expressed how I was going to get up there? I had problems with this a few times. Sometimes it never gave me the green light and I had to ask others to use there card to push my number. It is embarrassing to be on an elevator with my card flashing yellow holding up other people. You will have to pay extra to use the gym and the safe in your room. The only thing going for this hotel is the price is one of the lowest you will find in the area, its location, a pool, and the city view I had from my room. Personally, I would find somewhere else to stay next time unless I was seriously strapped for cash.

Was cleanly with everything you should need from condiments in the kitchen to floating things for the beach. Could have used a couple more bath towels there was only 3 beach towels so we had to use a bath towel. The closet door only opens on one side. Great place for the price.

That's it. I gave it 3 stars because I only booked it due to price & location, knowing I would spend little time in my room. If I had to do it again I would spend a little more & stay at a more central hotel in Waikiki. Ultimately you could walk anywhere in 15-20 minutes in Waikiki & there is plenty of public transportation. The rooms were pretty bad. They're musty, stained, & just don't appear to be cared for. The hotel houses regular residents & there is a bar in the lower level that appear to bring in a rough crowd. I stopped by on my way in one night & was literally offered heroin. The staff wasn't overwhelmingly friendly, but I didn't need them for anything so could care less. The take out restaurant & conveinent store in the main lobby were nice to have. I'd say if it's all you can afford--do it. Waikiki is a great experience. If you can swing a couple hundred more (depending on the length of your stay of course), I'd definitely do that. There were several hotels for not much more I saw in my hotel search that appeared to be much nicer & more central to all the action.

I love this hotel because people from the front desk were so nice and friendly. They can help you anytime you need them. What a wonderful experienced staying with this Hotel.KUDOS to Front Desk Agent, Christina, Nykky, Rachel.Because of you guys, i would love to come back again. From the 21st floor, I had a great view of the mountainside.

Horrible manager; other staff members were decent. Room was a trash dump. Do not expect you fridges to work, nor your curtains to be unstainied. In fact, you can reasonably expect goo somewhere in the room (it was on my pillow). We booked a week here, but left after the first night's stay. The hotel manager cursed at us for leaving and refused to refund the first 3 nights of our stay, although we only stayed for one night. They do not accept requests to change rooms either.

Check in- we came in late, after 10 pm. Clifford saved the day. Hands down on of the best front desk agents I have ever interacted woth. He was peraonal, plesant, and helpful. He went above and beyond to make sure everything was complete. He offered to gather extra blankets and pillows for the kids. He told us that as soon as he could step away, he would bring them up to the room. He did so within 20 minutes. I am only sharing my expierence because of Clifford. If you manage a hotel in Waikiki, go steal him and give him 10% more than where you normally start someone at or what he makes now, whichever is greater. The room- the only thing about the room which seemed to be not younger than 20 years was the television. Ac did work and worked well. Bathroom and overall flooring were out dated. Smallest room I have ever been in that had 2 beds. Deal breaker- even with Clifford, I knew I would not return when my wife wanted more coffee for the coffee maker. When she called down to the front desk, they offered more for a $2 charge and we would need to come down to get it. Overall: we were only staying here 1 night to fill a gap in travel plans. The location was decent and the price was right. I found out why. Would like to rate a 3.5 because of Clifford.

My adult daughter and I stayed here in late January for 4 nights and were quite happy with our accommodation. Having read some reviews prior to booking, I was abit sceptical but the price was right so we thought we'd take the chance. I was pleasantly surprised with our experience here at this hotel and so was my daughter who has travelled worldwide and stayed well in excess of 100 + hotels across the world. I say with honesty, this place is not the Ritz but if you want that, you can go and pay the price elsewhere. Beds were very comfortable; room was clean with no musty smells present. The room was of sufficient size given it had two double beds in it and we did not feel cramped. The inclusion of a microwave was great. Despite there being a bar under the building, it did not interfere in our stay at all, there was no excess noise and no interference by others during our stay from the rooms adjacent. Any people we saw within the building, permanent residents or guests were pleasant. Staff were friendly, probably just a little quietly serious but still friendly. The surrounding area is very close to ABC stores to buy necessities and a pleasant walk of about 10-15mins to Waikiki Beach. I have read other reviews stating the location of this hotel had lots of emergency sirens going off all the time, but I think this had nothing to do with the hotel itself or surrounding area. During my stay in Oahu, we also stayed at another hotel in the southern Waikiki area and there was often emergency sirens going off down there too so I think this is just what goes on in Waikiki due to the amount of people and busyness of such a popular area. The hotels wifi was great, but unfortunately was only available in the lobby. The addition of more comfortable seating in the lobby would significantly improve guests’ experience, given that they cannot access wifi freely within the privacy and comfort of their room. All in all, a pleasant stay at a budget hotel and would happily stay there again.

Stayed overnight in the hotel room. On checkin the front office guy was super helpful. The rooms are tired but you know that with the price. They are clean however and I was in the 15th floor which had good views. Great place for breakfast by the lobby!

review_body: Cheap hotel, good basic room, good location near the shops and 3 blocks from beach.We were on the 22 floor and had ocean views, good size rooms for the price. safe and clean this is all you want if you are on a budget like me.I would book again, but remember you get want you pay for

Stayed for a week and had no trouble whatsoever. It is a bit dated but so are most of the units in Honolulu. Close to everything, staff helpful and polite. Room cleaned daily.Only small issue is the mattresses and to need to be upgraded. Awesome view as we stayed high up. Pool was clean and good size.Would stay again no problems.

Stay here with my partner for just 1 night as we were flying out very early the next day and was just looking for a cheap and clean functioning room at the very least.Upon arrival, the lobby area was rather sad and dismal with just several old chairs sitting out but staff was nice, accomodating and knowledgeable. Unfortunately no early check-in was available for us.Only 2/3 elevator was working (with the 3rd looking like it had not been working for quite some time). Other tenants looked of the unsavoury kind, the hotel seems to cater to more budget-wise individuals such as backpackers and longer term residents. The overall condition of the hotel is below average and looked very run down. Our room itself thankfully was atleast clean and we were happy enough to be able to sleep comfortably (however my partner who is heavier than I am, sat down on his bed and it groaned and caved in the middle and it slightly did the same on mine too). The decor itself is extremely dated and mismatched. Many of the items were very old and in worn condition, there were stains apparent on many things such as the carpet and the bottom part of the mattress. The toilet was extremely cramped, and old as well however it all worked properly at the very least thankfully. Air-con is of the old kind, being a loud dusty box situated in the window. The room however provides microwave, an appliance that a few higher end hotels have failed to provide.The free wi-fi is misleading as it is actually only available in the lobby which is a frustrating as like I said, there is only about 5 chairs to sit down upon. You will find many residents sitting hours on end using the wifi and taking up the available chairs.There are a few restaurants/shops located in the hotel but absolutely nothing worth noting. There is also a rental car booth available.The location of the hotel itself is outside of the main hub of the Waikiki strip however I suppose if you're up for the walking, it is not such an unreasonable distance.Overall an extremely underwhelming stay, not a hotel that I would return to even for the price I paid which wasn't exactly 'budget' either. If they could update the wifi so that it was available in-room, then that could've made a huge difference to our stay.

Stayed in a condominium apartment. Was a little small but clean. Perfect location and close to everything. Walking distance to everything and buses also close by.....cheapest way to travel is by bus. At least you get to sight see.Every night between 5-6pm is 'Happy Hour' $1 drinks!!!!.......downstairs at the bar

This hotel is clean and comfortable but a little further from the beach. We don't mind the short 5 or 10 minute walk to the Waikiki area and we don't go to the beach everyday. It is actually easier to get in and out of Waikiki from the hotel because it is closer to the freeway and the Ala Moana shopping center. If you plan to rent a car, you will find it much more convenient to stay away from the traffic jams in Waikiki.

We picked up a cheap deal to stay here so I guess we got what we paid for! The room was probably clean but because it was very run down, dated and stained carpet it didn't feel clean. Air con was an in-window version that was very noisy through the night. Roof top pool area was great with clean BBQ area. The front desk provided extra towels and were nice and friendly, so can't fault them. Also stored our luggage for a late flight out for no charge. Overall I wouldn't recommend this place unless you get a very cheap rate and don't care about anything else.

Oh what a night. We stayed in an Air BNB for one night of a planned six on the mystical Isle of Oahu. Being a cheapskate did not work (this time) out as planned, the room itself was clean however the building itself is quite run down and the area itself is less than desirable. From what we saw we were some of the lucky few that had a clean condo.We ended up booking elsewhere for the remaining five nights to give us peace of mind. For what they charge there are better options in the heart of Waikiki. Avoid as better low budget options out there.

This place needs to be torn down. Built around WW2 it is too old. They have sucked the life out of this property!24floors and NO ice machine on the premises! NO biz center, no wifi except at the front desk.

This place was absolutely disgusting.We did an air BNB for one night before we had to fly out. OMG. She male prostitutes everywhere. Seedy bars. The room was filthy dirty. This place is absolutely NOT suitable for children. GROSS GROSS GROSS. Steer clear.

review_body: It is a 2 star hotel, if I’m being generous, and don’t be fooled by the term free Wifi available in lobby, the lobby is 5 chairs (kitten table, chairs) in front of front desk and the wifi is spotty at best. air-conditioning is a joke, but not a funning one. Location sucks, long way to anywhere. The good points were, the staff are great, room was clean and no hidden charges.

The hotel is located in a good area, close to restaurants and shops. But, there is no wifi in the room (only on the lobby) and there was a cockroach (flying) in our room. When I complaint they moved us to another room and tried to justify as been the hot weather. As soon as I left the room I saw it moving underneath the door to another room... So my husband placed a towel underneath the door in an attempt to avoid the cockroach to enter in the new room. Besides this, the carpet of the room is really old and seems dirty. The bathroom has stains everywhere. I don't recommend it.

This hotel looks like a regular residence building, because it front desk looks like the valet parking stand and there is no lobby actually. It is not a fancy place at all, but it is functional and clean. The staff is helpful. On 5 floor, it has the laundry room. That room is of course not fancy. It even looks a little like a parking lot. (Yes, it is next to the parking lot.) The washer is $3 per load and the dryer is $2.75 per load, both take credit card only. The free wifi is only available on the same level of the front desk area. The room only has paid wifi. The whole building is old, because it has no central A/C system. The room only has installed window air conditioner. The location is good because there are two 7-11 nearby, one ABC store is just across the street. Within 4 minute walking distance, there is a marketplace that has several affordable Asian restaurants. In general, this place may not be romantic for a honeymoon stay, but it is very functional if you are here for a conference at waikiki beach. We stay on 23rd floor, the night city view is fantastic. My husband comments it is one of the best views in waikiki area beside starring the beach side.

I moved into one of the condo units recently and it seemed nice at first, great views, nice front desk guy. Parking- Parking attendent lady yelled at people like i read in other reveiws, but I thought that was just something rude from the driver. Fees looked high, also there is parking validation if you want to come eat at the restaurant there, which is pretty good food, for a high price again. Laundry-First time i try to do laundry here I get harrassed by a woman bugging me about the laundry credit card use not working for her. I said call the number for the laundry company/maintenence, but she kept going on and on. I just kept saying uh huh, yea, etc and finally I left. Pest Control- Innefective. They come every few month, claiming natural pest control that works. Then came the roaches, nothing when i first moved in, but then black biting roaches one after the next. I had to get a roach hotel, spending money out of my own pocket, and that has helped the problem a bit. $Building Water access/Cleanliness- At this point I thought ok, this isnt too bad, after all i should expect some problems. Then when I went to do laundry a 2nd time, I was seeing signs that the building shuts off water twice a month, AND it affects hot water in the laundry room as well. I also noticed that the new machines were very dusty behind them in the maze of pipes, looks like it had never been cleaned. Window slats upon a closer look were broken, and it is above the smoking area as well, so i was getting all that while trying to do my laundry on the 5th Floor.Pool & Clientele: On my way up the stairs from the 5th floor, the only way to access the pool from the condos, I encounter a very slow disabled woman in a walker trying to open the pool door. She wanted me to hold the door for her but took her several minutes to walk through the open door. I thought maybe she should relocate to a older folks home or more accessible single story complex? When you come in there is a very large cemented floor area for the very tiny pool. No shade, grill area and hot tub are there but have never seen anyone use them. The surprise here was the supposedly nude tanning area behind cement slabs which i thought was somewhat odd at a hotel. Hotel Policies- Inconsistent. After living there awile I found that pool hours posted in elevator seem to change each week from 9pm closing to 10pm the next week, to 11pm the next week, then back to 9pm another week. Quiet hours must need to be constantly adjusted here to suit someone's needs? Also there are signs in there always saying not to feed the birds. I noticed there was no notice about real more relevant issues like smoking in the building, even though smoke in the elevator, bars present downstairs, and people smoking very close to the building under the roof area when it rains too, coming right into the lobby and elevator area sometimes. Mail- area smelled like fish and smokey also most of the time. Security takes packages that wont fit in the package boxes. They will not notify you that you have recieved a package, and if you call them, sometimes they cannot find your package or will tell you that you have not recieved any. Only upside to this was calling the company to say i never recieved my package and then finally getting security to give me both packages when they finally "discover" it. Phonebooks when delivered are just thrown in a pile on the ground under the mailboxes. Outgoing mailbox is convenient with small slot. Post office is pretty far if you need to pick up a package from them though, but not something bad about the building there.People - Lots of budget tourists, many people from outside of usa, mainly europe, exciting to meet lots of different young people and people from asia as well. Nighttime gets the bar crowd, police showing up and that kinda thing. Probably a safety issue and bars should be relocated elsewhere, not in the hotel, or atleast not on the ground floor with uncontrolled access. Smoking area needs to be designated AWAY from the building entrance areas, on the ala wai side, rather than outside the hotel entrance and then another outside the condo entrance. Security- Mixed. I like most of the people that work in security and have talked with many of them, very nice people. The problem is that I dont feel safe here. Elevators are breaking down regularly and people must use the steps. Often times there is no one at the security desk after hours. Fire department at building several times in the few months ive lived here. Steps are unsafe, very narrow stone steps, especially if you live higher up in the bulding. Very narrow space too going up the steps. Building has almost 40 floors. Would be very scary having to evacuate the building in such a small staircase too. Building is old, built in 1979, unsure if there is asbestos in the popcorn cielings, but I would assume there is. Most of the building has a musty odor to it. Cigarette smoke odors coming from my bathroom and power outlets made me think it could be a fire or other issue in the building if they drop thier cigarette while sleeping or something. I could wake up to a fire. Plumbing - Bad. First week I moved in my toilet clogged up, and could not plunge it. I thought that was strange considering I used only regular toilet paper and nothing else. Then had to turn off the water as it started overflowing/kept running the water. Called maintenence/security. Got a few towels wet. Then the toilet started bubbling, and I called again, this time the Bathtub had a sewage backup in it! Then had to call security, landlord, and Landlord ddint want to call a plumber but finally did. Plumber came and cracked the tub with the machine, and sprayed sewage on the walls etc, and then had to do same thing under the sink. Could have mentioned to take stuff out of the sink drawers as well because that was also spattered a bit. Landlord did not pay for cleanup of the mess left behind, even though I do think was legally responsible for. Front desk guy was helpful when i needed to use the phone, as my cell phone was broken at the time. The lady there was rude afterwards though, telling me to use a payphone. I told her that if if cant call that the hotel may get raw sewage backed up into the elevators and other floors. She quickly let me use the phone after that. Landlord/Owner- Nice at first but then decided they only want to fix certain things but not others with the apartment. Also they tried to tell me that nothing was wrong and not to call them when things break etc. I thought that was very rude and inconsiderate and not doing thier job at all. Needless to say things did get fixed after having to call them several times and follow up double time on everything that needed to be done. Terrible experience. The condo association does not seem to be addressing issues in the building very well either. The board meetings are not clearly posted or accessible to tennents and owners of the building. Also the building needs to have an on site maintenence man and do some interior and exterior renovations to the building.Cost - Very High for what you get. I pay over 1200 a month for a small 350 sq foot studio. Not a fan of having no dishwasher or washer dryer in the apartment for that price either. My unit does have full kitchen w/tiny sink in kitchen and in bathroom which i heard is rare here! Only good thing is the convenient location being in the outskirts of waikiki and the high floor view of the city and you can see part of the ocean. No free internet unless your a hotel guest. I do get free cable from the building though, that is a nice benefit, with good channels.Rooms - Average overall, noisy, thin walls. Overall can only give it a one star rating because it doesnt have any functional saving grace other than being good for a short stay as a hotel. Can hear tv or talking through the walls, doors slam shut here with the keycard entry, noise from sirens outside go through hotel windows (which are somewhat sound proof). I dont hear much of the traffic except for gunning it motorcycles every now and then. Have ac unit, which is nice, but could be maintained or cleaned more regularly (not sure if anything here is cleaned regularly or maintained properly). No vent to the outside from kitchen vent, just blows things around inside. Bathroom is a nice size and partially upgraded with granit countertop. KItchen itself has water damage that was only partially fixed by landlord. Popcorn cieling falls off when you come in contact with it in any way. Curtains let a lot of light in if your trying to sleep, can also get very hot inside if your facing the sun, not a lot of protection there either. Dust on cieling is tough to clean off, stains on cieling never cleaned off either, fortunately small. Sleep quality i would give 2 or 3 stars, except i have woken up to cigarette smoke smells from both outside or from the bathroom or electrical outlets and had to move my bed to be further away from it. The one rule i noticed that is followed is there are no pets in the building allowed. They must have enough trouble keeping track of all the people that live here, adding pets wandering the floors and emergency stairwells would be a real health and safety hazard i bet!Overall - Very dissapointed, not alot of choices for decent housing in the Waikiki area, so I came here and thought this place could meet my very basic needs. Alot of other negative reviews for this place make perfect sense with how poorly the place is run. Needs a change in management and a remodel for safety reasons and funtionality, as this could be operating at a much higher standard and bringing in more money for the owners and provide a good place to live. I will not be renewing my one year lease here! If i could rent a storage unit and go put up a tent somewhere safe I would do that instead and probably have a better living experience!

The hotel was older but clean and did not have it's own restaurants etc. However, it was close to amenities and shopping. We were not in the room long so couldn't see the point in paying a fortune for a room anywhere else. The staff were very friendly and we would go back there again.

I lived here in 2003-2004 but at the condo side of the building. It was a great location close to Waikiki beach and walking distance to Hawaiian Hilton hotel and Fort Derussy park, which were my walking route when I was there. Also close to The bus route/stops.

This is a high rise apartment building. The bed was stained, the carpet was black, which once was 1970's green, people were cooking in the room next door. The Honolulu police and EMT were there all night and the next morning. And it is a one mile walk to Waikiki beach.

I attended the General Assembly of the International Astronomical Union, held in the Hawaii Convention Center, Waikiki, Honolulu. There was a list of recommended hotels sent by the organizers, but I chose the Hawaiian Monarch, which was not on the list, for its proximity to the Convention Centre. It turned out to be just what I needed. Not a luxury hotel, but a práctical well situated place to stay. All the staff were very friendly, the room was very well maintained and cleaned. The view from my 24th floor room was attactive enough, over the Ala Wai canal towards the mountains. The swimming pool on the pool deck was big andrelaxing, and seldom crowded. The laundry room allowed me to look after my clotheswell at a modest price, helped by the iron and ironing board in the room (I was there for two weeks). The hotel is farther from the beach than the more expensive hotels, but still walkable. There is a breakfast cafe within the building, (not included inthe hotel itself) with very good quality breakfasts, and there is a small restaurant also within the building, based on local Japanese style food, which was very practicalfor quick evening meals. As well as being within short walking distance of the Convention Centre, the Hawaiian Monarch is within walking distance of a largefraction of the Waikiki tourist scene, with a wide variety of restaurants and coffee bars. to summarize, a very practical solution for a business trip.

But I was puzzled as it is still a 25 minute walk to the beach. I got tired of walking that every day in the hot sun so luckily the hotel does have a wonderful pool. The front desk staff were hit and miss, I stayed for two weeks and met a lot of the staff, some went out of their way to help you some went out of their way not to. The building and fittings are dated but if you are wanting the Hilton it is just down the road.

We stayed in a two bedroom apartment, beautiful views, clean lots of room to move. Central to shopping precinct, and restaurants. Great air con, kitchen net, wonderful shower. Large swimming pool. We were up near the penthouses so it was very peaceful.

We rented a condo in this hotel through Vrbo "home away" the only reason I give this hotel a 2.5 is because of the condo we occupied and the location. The hotel section is not somewhere I would stay. Dirty, smelly, inadequate. Will not reccomend and resent being cheated of hard earned money I could not get back. Want refund. Not worthy of international standards.hi would expect at least the quality of a cheap chain.

Clifford at front desk was fantastic...paying for parking and Wifi separately was such an inconvenience and its a wonder the actual hotel price was cheap because the cost of the parking daily and wifi made up for it and therefore it was not cheap at all. The air con was loud and noisy throughout the night.The ladies at recep ( one in particular) needed some retraining in customer service ( attitude changed once i requested a mtg with a manager). Overall i would not stay here again given that other hotels would cost less with free wifi and free parking for our rental. However Clifford you were fantastic and thank you for taking such great care of my family and I.
