Runnitty P
Auckland, Auckland, New Zealand

review_body: The hotel needs to come into the 21st century; carpets need to be replaced; bathrooms need to be updated; overall hotel sadly in need of a facelift. WiFi not working and one staff member needed an attitude adjustment

The carpets were a dingy green if you walk barefoot on it the bottoms of your feet will be a dark brown. The room keys were not working and they wanted us to go walk to a security office to get some. The woman at the desk was very snappy and rude. I am surprised they hire people like that. The whole place is very old and they have people who live inside the hotel and have for years. The people who live here drag their laundry around in a basket attached to a shoe string. For 20$ more a night you can get breakfast and be right on the beach with the Waikiki Resort Hotel which is very clean and they have very friendly staff.

The location of the Hawaiian Monarch is good. It is only a 10-15 minute walk to the closest beach, and is right on the road out of town for other attractions. The hotel itself was rather run-down and could benefit from cleaner carpets and fresh paint. The car park was convenient, but you had to check in at the hotel before you could park. There was nothing inviting about the pool and I never saw anyone using it. The hotel is not only for over-night guests was there were people who lived there permanently. The air-conditioner was located right next to the head of the bed. Not having it on wasn't an option, but hard to sleep with the frigid air blowing on my head.I would probably stay there again if I was on my own because of the location and price, but I would only sleep there. I chose this hotel as my friend wanted one with a microwave and fridge. Because of the grubby nature of the room, we didn't eat in the room. The only option for eating in the hotel was small and expensive. The closest 'family-style' restaurant was a 10-minute walk away.

First time at this hotel. I've read several negative reviews but, keep in mind, you cannot expect Neiman Marcus service and quality when you pay Walmart prices. Checking in was a challenge. You're not allowed to park in the hotel's parking lot until you have registered and there is limited parking near the reception desk. Not unexpectedly, there was a lone receptionist who was checking people in, people out, answering the phone, taking questions from registered guests calls, talking to housekeeping, etc. In spite of all she had to do, when she was able to get to me, she was extremely pleasant and courteous. Parking is $20 a day. Read a review that said there was public parking across the street but I couldn't find it. Street parking is not really an option. I was on the 20th floor with a spectacular view of the Ala Wai Canal. My room was very clean and modern. It had a safe, small refrigerator, micro-wave, etc. What surprised me was that the room actually had glass cups! I travel a lot and most budget hotels only provide plastic ones. This hotel is located at the top of Waikiki. If you are able to walk at least a mile or two, you can easily walk to all that Waikiki has to offer. In summary, for the price, this hotel cannot be beat!

i've booked a room for three people and arrived later afternoon like normal guests. Our car was stopped outside the hotel with emergency lights on as it's not a parking area. Well, i then went to check in like the past 16 days that i was here in the State. The reception was rude and asked me to get other two peoples' ID. Then i went to grab other twos' passports and handed to the reception. The lady then said " when i meant ID, i need them to come here to see me as most of the BIG hotels required their guests information so we can instruct all the guests their hotel rules". I was thinking "wth, this is not the first hotel i've stayed and this is a small hotel comparing to all the big ones in las veags and other places". Anyway, then had to stopped the car and parked at illegal area but the receptionist said it's legal. But afterall she didnt give us any instruction as she said before. We went to the room and most of the stuff was rusted. Only two sets of towels were given. 6am in the morning, two guys locked at the door and claimed water leakage, didnt say sorry for interruption or what so ever. After that, they turned off the main water tap, we had to call reception to get them to turn it on. When we got up, we realised no water is available and called reception and she said the notice is already sticked on the elecator. I would think they could have remind us when we checked in or call us half an hour earlier. But nothing! With similar price, i strongly recommend you to go stay in othet hotels.

We stayed here for Thanksgiving 2013 and enjoyed our stay. The hotel in conveniently located central to many attractions; Waikiki Beach; Ala Moana Center, and many more. The room was a tad outdated as are many others but had no complaints about the hotel itself. We are adventure and nature enthusiasts so we didn't stay in the room besides to sleep. Warning! There is a garage BUT parking is $20 a night unless you don't take your car out. There is some street parking and a small parking lot across the street for about $10. We did love the restaurant that was downstairs (Cream Pot) and attended for breakfast. Would stay here again.

The hotel is in a great location that you might not beat for the price. Yes, it's a budget hotel but it's close to Waikiki and if you can't afford one of the big hotels then this is an option. The room I had was very dated and required maintenance asap but it was generally clean. Microwave, fridge and air con. Hotel pool was well looked after and a nice surprise considering the rooms. It was safe with card access to lifts which was important to me as a solo traveler.

Older room but it was clean and comfortable. Good laundry facility and rooftop pool. Great pizza and bar downstairs. Convenience store, and two restaurants in the lobby. The parking is separate and cash only.

I've stayed in cheaper hotels than this one that were far cleaner! I guess box spring covers don't need to be cleaned EVER. Behind the toilet was disgusting, the lock box was rusting apart, and didn't even have a lock, and the entire carpet was so filthy it would take up too many pictures to show! But like I said, it's no surprise, being that this place is owned by Roberts Hawaii. Everything that company does is sub-par. Oh, let's not forget the front desk agent. Got to the front desk and there was no one in sight. After standing there for a while, I walked around the desk and saw the agent standing in the doorway behind the counter with a wad of money in one hand and her phone, which she was texting on, in the other. She didn't bother to look up, and when she finally did notice that I was standing there, she wasn't happy I inconvenienced her. Because it was a last-minute online booking, I asked if I could check in, and she goes, "Well let's SEE if you can check in." She had the worst attitude of any front desk agent I've dealt with, and I've worked front desk. Save $20-$30 and book with another hotel!

Stayed here last week. Room was okay, had fridge and microwave. Carpet needed a good cleaning (lots of stains), otherwise room was clean. Pool area was nice. A few blocks from the beach and downtown Waikiki. I'd stay here again.

We were disappointed with our recent stay at this hotel. The rugs were stained and dirty. The bath tub was chipping away and the tiles were stained and dirty. Would never stay here again, it was like the ghetto. The staff was not really helpful and it was not close to the beach. The online description of the hotel was not accurate. This hotel needs a good overall.

This was a clean 34 year old hotel...the staff friendly...I had asked for a higher up & view ...we got that...but I have to say the windows were especially dirty.. I do not think they had been washes in the 34 yes.

When we opened the door to our room I was totally disappointed from the very beginning. The room and the bathroom was too small. The fridge was a tiny one that sat on the floor. There was a safe in the room but was broken, The carpet was filthy with spots. My bed had a spring that I felt as soon as I layed on it. The paint in the bathtub was peeling off, also when I took showers it felt like I was going to fall through the tub. Could not open the window but just about 2 inches. They had placed a lock in there that you could not remove. So air conditioner ran the whole time even when we were gone. You had to use your credit card to do wash. Pay $7.00 a day if you wanted to use your laptop in your room, or you can use it for free down in the lobby. The gate to the pool was locked. Probably had to pay for that. Didn't even bother. One lady at the front desk was not very people friendly. The one gentleman that worked at the desk was very nice. The maid service was awful, they cleaned well but it took them all day to get to our room. We would take off and come back between 2:30-3:00 o'clock and our room would not be done. So when they came around we would go down to the lobby. Not a good hotel to stay.

I stayed in this hotel for three nights while visiting Oahu. It is not new, it is not fancy. My room was clean, and quiet, and being on the 22nd floor, I had a nice view of Honolulu. Since I was staying by myself, this hotel suited me just fine. I would not try to impress anyone such as a significant other here. I found the staff friendly, although frequently when I would stop by the front desk to ask a question, no one would be there manning the desk - they were in a back room so I had to call out to whoever was working to get them to come help me, which was mildly annoying. During my stay, I spent the majority of my time away from the hotel, often leaving before sunrise and returning after sunset - there was just too many fun things to do on Oahu to waste time in a hotel room. Because of this, I was not as concerned as others might be with the lack of luxury here. There was a pool and small hot tub that I visited on my last night - again nothing fancy, but the kids in the pool seemed to really be enjoying it. I just used the hot tub and had a nice chat with some other guests staying at the hotel.I was not a real big fan of the location of the hotel - a bit too far from many of the restaurants and the beach for my liking. If your desire is to stay in Waikiki and do so inexpensively, this is a good option for you! It was for me.

This is by far the worst hotel I've stayed at. And I've stayed at a lot of hotels. The only reason for staying there is because most other hotels were up to occupancy. For starters, the hostess at the desk was rude. There are a couple of shops near the lobby and the whole area smells like old fried food. If you hang out in the lobby for more than 3 minutes, expect to smell like chinese take out. When we got to the room, we didn't notice anything seriously wrong aside from the age and the size... (really small for two double beds). We dropped our luggage and went out to eat. When we returned, we noticed some sort of smears on the old popcorn ceiling. The shower was extremely small and looked like it was caulked by a two year old. The walls in this hotel are so thin, that you could literally see and feel the wall move from the next unit. You could also hear everything..and I mean everything. We asked to be moved to another room and the same rude clerk asked why it took us so long to decide that we wanted another room. Altough the new room was a bit cleaner, the window a/c unit never really got cold. We decided to just suck it up for the next night. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. There is so much more I could say, but why bother. It doesn't seem like the hotel really cares anyway.

If you are looking for an inexpensive hotel to stay near Waikiki I would recommend it. As far as looks go, it is not much to look at (a little rough around the edges). Also the surroundings are less than picturesque. There were a lot of homeless people near the entrance, that made it a little scary. The elevators to the rooms are only operated with your key card, so we didn't see any vagrants in the hotel. On a positive note the staff was AMAZING!! They gave us great suggestions on things to do on the island. One of the men at the desk told us we were very close to the Hilton Hawaiian Village and it's beach. We walked there and that ended up being one of the biggest highlights of our trip. Without this man we wouldn't have even known this gem was right down the road. We also had a large gap in time from our check out and our flight, so they let us store our bags. We then went on a snorkling tour, and they let my friend use a complimentary room to shower before we headed home, even though we had already checked out. I really thought that was above and beyond!!! Really appreciated the effort. One of the days here they had the water turned off for maintanence for a few hours, so that was inconvenient, but I thought the staff really made up for it.

This was certainly not the worst place I have ever stayed but "no frills" would be an understatement for the condition of the rooms. The carpets and curtains were pretty gross but the rest of the room, including the bed was clean enough. We booked the hotel despite some negative reviews because we just needed one night between flights and this was a place between the airport and Waikiki downtown but really, this was not much closer to the airport than other Waikiki hotels. We head some pretty terrible things about the airport hotels (which were quite expensive) so if you also want to aviod those we would reccomend you spend an extra $10 or so and stay in a nicer place near Waikiki beach.

I would like to thank staff at Hawaiian Monarch Hotel(Salina)I am not sure if I'm spelling her name correct.(sorry).She helped me with my reservation for the weekend of july 4th.And I must say she went above and beyond !.She has a very pleasant personality and great customer service skills. I can not thank her enough by helping me with my reservations.She is a great asset to Hawaiian Monarch Hotel.Thank You so much!

The hotel is old and needs updating Price location and staff very good.The view of the mountains was fantasticRoom was ok except the carpet was so dirty, your feet bled black dirt when entering the shower

I stayed in this hotel to pick up my daughter and bring her back home for the summer. This is a "minimalist" hotel. No bells or whistles come with your room. A simple window unit AC, a bed, tiny television, and an older shower. It is a condo/hotel, and the hotel elevators are seperate from the condo elevators. The best part about this hotel, is that it is easy access to the beach/Waikiki area and the airport. So, if you're looking for simple, this is it. If you're looking for your hotel to be part of your "Hawaii experience", go somewhere else.

This hotel is located is located in Waikiki but on the outskirts. Not much noise and traffic passing by. The rooms are very clean and more than we expected for our two night stay. The property is petty well kept too. You have a few food choices on property including a convenience store. If none of them appeal to you then take a walk to Kalakaua Ave and explore many choices.Will I go back? Absolutely! I like starting in Waikiki but not in the heart of it. Clean property, friendly staff and clean rooms will get us back there. The only reason I gave this a 4 star is because the lack of no bell boys. The parking attendant don't really allow you enough time to carry your bags to the check in counter and to deposit them to your room. I later found out that the parking people is not part of the hotel. However, for $10 daily parking rate is not bad.

I booked a trip to Waikiki and decided to spontaneously hotel hop for the trip. I walked up to the front desk and asked if she has one room with a king size bed for the night and she said she did. She took my credit card, gave me my key and headed up to the room.The room was unbelievably awful! The TV was chained to the wall, the paint was pealing, the room smelled bad, the carpets were dirty. Trying to deal for a night, I decided to just grab towels from the bathroom and head for the hot tub. When I saw large brown stains on their white towels... I'd had it.I walked back down to the front desk 15 minutes later and asked for a refund. I apologized but said the room is dirty and their are stains on the towels. The front desk lady was extremely rude stating "I'm on the phone right now with our hotel cleaning manager and she says that room is perfectly clean." I said I couldn't do it, and said I'd like a refund. She blurted out "we don't do same day refunds." I said I have been in this hotel under 15 minutes and she held her ground. I nicely said, "well I will not be staying here so if you'd like to rent that room out for the night, go ahead" and left. I am in the midst of getting a refund through my credit card company since the Monarch would not.If you want to know THE BEST HOTEL at the same price, check out Aqua Bamboo!! So wonderful, clean, and fantastic staff!

My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights on a recent trip to Honolulu and were pleased with the budget style accommodation located in downtown Waikiki. The rooms are reasonably spacious with a fridge, microwave, tv and coffee maker. The fridge in particular is helpful for storing water and juice. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. The shower was not very powerful and was a weak point of the hotel. The hotel is centrally located within walking distance of the shops in downtown Waikiki. There are good buses to diamond head and if you have a car, there is limited free parking along the canal. We would recommend as a budget hotel in Waikiki.

If you are a hotel snob and will write bad reviews about the bed, carpet, drapes, and lack of granite counters in the bathroom, then don't stay here. Please. It's not for you. BUT - if you are looking for a great deal, the perfect location to shops, Waikiki, Ala Moana, and fantastic views from your room, then you should stay here. It is not fancy-schmancy, there is no restaurant, but there is security, laundry rooms, a great pool, and a really friendly staff. The staff even helped me take a picture of the Ala Wai Canal with Diamond Head in the back ground since that view is not easily accessable. Room 2407 is the room you want with that view. The room was well appointed with a refrigerator, coffee maker, microwave, and a flat screen TV. You will need to bring most personal things with you since they supplied only a small bottle of shampoo. Also supplied - iron/ironing board, safe, and hairdryer, all inside the room. I had a single room and its size was more than adequate for one person. I can't speak to the double rooms, but the size of my bathroom would be tight for two people. The room was roomy tho.ABC stores are on every corner so get yourself some food, drinks, and keep them in your room. You can't beat the views of this budget hotel. Yes, it's older, and dingy, but if you don't like looking at the dingy curtains then move them aside and enjoy the view! One last thing to mention - if you are a light sleeper the city noise may be an issue.

This is an older hotel, the carpet is faded from the sun and the shower squeaks. But it is clean.This is Hawaii not midwest US, cheap hotels are still trying to do everything to have repeat customers. And how much time are you planning on spending inside while visiting Hawaii anyways? The staff was mostly friendly, they gave plenty of towels, little shampoos and soaps. Most importantly was the mini fridge and microwave that insured you could eat a good deal of meals cheaper by getting supplies across the street at ABC stores. I had to take a star off because of the weird internet situation. I don't need cable TV, I need an easy way to book my activities and my phone was not cutting the mustard. Had to go downstairs and book them in the lobby. Other than that great for a busy people looking for a clean bed and working shower.

Easy walk to beach, restaurants and shopping. And the bus service is frequent and handicapped accessible.Found the two bedroom / two bath condo on vrbo.com website. The unit was recently remodeled with handsome appliances including dishwasher and a stackable washer / dryer.With views of Diamond Head and the Pacific, it was a pleasure to have a quick breakfast as the day began.Our week in the city was a pleasure.Very clean and secure unit on an upper floor.

We were booked to stay here for the whole time in Hawaii, but as soon as we arrived we realized that staying here for ten days was not what we wanted. We quickly went back to the lobby and left. This hotel is nice from the outside, and is so old and aged, that when we walked into our room, it was so out dated, and dirty. That we couldn't bare to spend one night in the room. Let alone sleep worrying about if their was a fire, we would never get out.

Stayed at the Hawaiian Monarch the first week of March and it was in my opinion just average or slightly below. Room was a little dated and it was very hard to get the hot water to stop going back and forth from hot and cold on a moments notice. If someone could have seen me jumping in and out of the water they would have laughed pretty hard..lol. Hotel has a large pool and sun deck with out door grills for cooking out which are very nice. Lobby is extremely basic for such a large hotel and upon first arrival it is somewhat difficult to locate. Key cards in the elevator are slightly tricky to use as they work best when inserted and pushed to the right. After a few times you'll get the trick :). Hotel is in the corner of Waikiki and as long as you don't mind walking a little you can get pretty much everywhere. Hilton Beach is close and very nice and the fireworks on Friday night are good from here too. Parking, no parking is included with either the hotel or the condos and you will pay $20/night or $180/month. Parking across the street is cheaper at $18, but you can park free on the Ala Wai with the exception of Mon and Fri from 8:30am-11am when they do street sweeping. Views of the Ko'olaus is awesome from the Ala Wai side. Plenty of restaurants to walk to and for breakfast I highly recommend the Wailana Coffee House...the all you can eat pancakes is just $5.95 and includes eggs bacon and toast! You can't touch this in Waikiki! Not my first choice of hotels, but this trip was short notice and this hotel was cheap and served as a nice crash pad for our stay. Enjoy.

We found the staff very pleasant and helpful , this was our f1rst time at this Hotel We are from Saskatoon Saskatchewan and were recommended by people who stayed at the Hotel many times.Their recommendation was accurate and the price was fair during this busy season..We would stay again and the Location is excellent. .

Located on the main street in 5 min from all shops and ''active life" - not noisy, easy to get to the beach and shops. Poor service: 1) They make the bed, sometimes not every day, and take the garbage out every day. Clean towels every day. 2) there once was a cockroach in my bathroom 3) when I asked to print a ticket on the reception, they said that it's nlot possible and didn't help me to do this in any way. 4) free wi-fi only in the lobby 5) old noisy air conditioner located at the level of the pillow. Noisy elevator! Overall it's a desent hotel for it's prise.

The hotel shows its age - it is possibly one of the oldest buildings in Waikiki. The rooms need some freshening. The bath tube for instance was not in good condition in our room. Given that, we had a nice view from the 22nd level, we could see the beach and the ocean. (in another stay in the same hotel but at the 17th level the view is far from being as nice.)The free locker room at the reception was a great bonus. At least the rooms are clean. Very nice location, around 15 mins to the beach. Bus station 5-10 mins walk from the hotel. Internet available only in the lobby, not in the rooms. But definitely not in the middle of Waikiki. Nice swimming pool with a jacuzzi - but closes at 9pm: a bit too early!Parking is "only" 20 dollars for 24 hours (sadly it is a great deal in Waikiki).

We stayed here for four nights and whilst the location was ok the rest was disappointing. The room was ok but really dated and as with the rest of the Hotel, in dire need of updating. The biggest challenge was getting from lobby and into the room. As many others have commented, the room keys worked about 1 in 10 attempts for the lift or room, very frustrating.However, I guess you get what you pay for , very reasonable price for Waikiki Hotel.

We read some really bad reviews about this hotel, but thought maybe others are a bit more demanding than us. Well, not this time. Our flight was late arriving, when we checked in, it was a breeze and we were quite pleased. The room is a bit dated, but size is adequate, so we did not mind that. However, our nightmares started the next day. Our keys keep failing to work in the elevator as well as for the room. In the elevator, when the key does not work, we just "hitch" a ride with other guests when they used their key card. We approached the front desk and told them what happened and each time the reply was "you did not align the key card properly?" or "you bend the card too much", etc. We watched and talked to other guests, and were told they have similar experience with their keys so it is definitely not an isolated incident. One day, neither of our cards worked and we have to get back to the room right the way, as usual, when we approached the front desk, the clerk did not believe us, so we told her to try it herself. She went to our room and she could not open our door with our keys either. They called security and 2 of them showed up and neither of them could open our door with their master keys either. They called maintenance and at first they thought it was the battery that went dead, but after replacing that, it still did not work. Finally they replaced the whole key card unit and replaced it with a new one and from then on, we have no trouble entering our room. What I am trying to say is, why didn't they believe in the guests but instead made liars of us? We wasted so much time going up and down to get "new keys" to try to open our door. The worse thing is out of three elevators, two of them were out of service majority of the time while we stayed there the 11 days, one time it took 25 minutes before the elevator came! Also, had a bad experience with security that I reported to management, he promised to investigate but he never return with any explanation. All in all, this is one of the worse hotel stay that we had for a long time and it is just too stressful when you are in Hawaii on vacation!

PROS (THINGS I LIKED)1. Great location within walking distance of Waikiki area yet on edge of Ala Wai for greater quiet. 2. I had a room with a gorgeous view of the city and mountains on 18th floor for an extremely reasonable price. 3. Desk clerks were fantastic and extremely welcoming and helpful. 4. Room and bathroom were kept very clean.5. Room furnished with everything I needed and was pleasant and comfortable.6. I had requested a few mire pillows and they put six comfy pillows on the bed! I appreciated that!CONS (THINGS THAT NEED IMPROVING)1. air-condition unit in room was small and very noisy. I turned it off. Windows didn't open.2. No lanai (balcony).3. Key card didn't work well and had to be exchanged.4. No wifi in room. I rented a router/wif-fi device but couldn't get it to work with my Mac Air, but they were quick to the charge.5. Mattress was too firm and hard.6. Carpet was old and questionable.

I arrived to this hotel on 12/19/2013 and left on 12/21/2013. My room was small and semi cozy. The bathroom was definitely the smallest I have ever seen. The a/c is an old antique in the window that made noise and blows directly on you in the bed. They have no ice machine and no service. I will not be going back to this hotel again. Oh yeah, on two different night I saw small roaches that I had to kill. My keys didn't work a couple of times and I would have to go to the lobby to get them adjusted. Oh yeah, expensive parking $20 dollars a day!! John Palmer

I stayed at the Hotel Monarch for 2 weeks. The staff are just great. the hotel was built in 1978, and not any upgrade since then. But for the price, clean, everything works, Safe, Secure, very helpful for any bus information. If you love hiking and getting out of the Waikiki strip and doing your own thing on Public transport, it is a great place to stay, as you are never in the room. The locals that live in the building so helpful, they will steer you where to eat on a budget, The staff outstanding in their knowledge of bus routes. I spent a lot of time as a single person travelling on local transport, and saw so much, that other travellers would not bother to do. I saved so much money by asking questions each day to the reception staff. If you are not on a budget, do not stay here, but if you are a bit of a trekker, and love to walk, it is great. I met the most amazing people by walking and getting out of the norm .I went around the Island for $2.50 on a bus. Private tour $250.00 see what I mean! Just do your homework. The buses take longer, but you meet the locals, and you get to feel the reality of what the real Hawaiians are about .It is a safe place to stay. The crime rate very low. As a single female, I never had any issues. I went out every night alone.There is so much free stuff in Hawaii. Every Friday night the Hyatt put on fireworks, and encourage outsiders to admire. The walk to diamond head, from the hotel fantastic. Diamond head shopping precinct much cheaper to eat at and shop. Good luck, Judy.

Don't except too much. Room is small with coffee machine, microwave oven and TV. Insulation is poor. I can hear every word from room next door. Parking is expensive, $20 per night. Staffs are helpful. Location is good. Short walk to the beach. Price is right. For one night stay, it is ok but I wouldn't stay longer.

If you need a cheap place to sleep in Honolulu, this is an ok place. The room was small and needed a lot of updating. I had a lot of trouble with my keys not working for my room and the elevators. Parking was $20/night. No internet service or ice machine. Only good thing was the front desk people, they were very nice. Would not stay there again.

i had a non smoking room that smelled like smoke, like a las vegas hotel room. i made the bestof it. i enjoyed my stay there overall. my boyfriend and i enjoyed an late nite drink at the bar downstairs. great mixed drinks. great service. we also had our children swim in the pool, they had a great time. the hot tub wasnt hot, but im sure if we asked someone it would have.

have travelled extensively around the world and believe me, I have stayed in some very questionable places. I dont go for luxury but I expect the basics of clean and good presentation. This hotel ranks in my top 3 for the worst. I booked PH103.We arrived late and had to find our way through very dodgy looking people to find a lockbox to get keys in near dark. We were not met nor offered any welcome at all. There was no helpful info left in the condo about what was available in the hotel or in the area and we were left to figure it out ourselves. A call I put in to the manager about the use of the computer in the unit went unanswered. We figured out how to get the free wifi offered ourselves.The hotel is old and tired, looks and feels cheap and nasty. The elevators are disgusting.The first thing that hit us when we opened the door to the condo was the smell. It came from the sink in the kitchen but the damp musty smell was permanent. So were the ants. The showers worked ok and the water was hot but you ended up standing in 6 inches of water as the drains didn't flow. Thanks to the previous users who left their hair in the basin, the shower and on the floor, and thanks to the cleaner for leaving it for me.The lounge furniture was uncomfortable ( and not the same as in the photo) and the decor is old and tired. Everything is worn, stained, chipped and marked. The curtains and blinds were gross, moldy, ripped and frayed.The aircon was the worst. It was so loud and rattled constantly but you had to keep it on as it was so hot. The windows opened but the noise was too much to leave them that way.The pool area was ok.This place would be ok for a family on a budget but if you want any kind of comfort don't come here. This is not a home away from home. For the price, it is not worth it.I booked for 7 nights, stayed 4 and moved out. First time I've ever done that in 30 years.

If all you want is a place to sleep then this is okay. The whole building is not a hotel. Only 50 rooms on 24 floors are the hotel. The rest are residences. And let's just say the permanent residents are not the best. I will never stay at this hotel again!!! I guess you get what you pay for!!!

Could use a little more sprucing up - but location was perfect for the Convention I was attending. Only 2 blocks to the convention center and an easy walk. Love the views from my room and that we had a fridge & microwave. Free coffee every morning would have been a nice touch - and more plush towels would make the customers feel just a little more 'loved'!Had a great HDTV and AC worked great - comfy beds too!
user_name:
Barbara C
Kailua-Kona, Hawaii, United States

review_body: Paint would be nice. But otherwise, the room was small but comfortable. Bathroom small but had what we needed. Dust on the ceiling due to air condition which worked great. Bed comfortable, t.v. Had standard cable channels ...good. Older hotel but overall everything was good. Proce is right considering its not near the beach.

Booked this hotel at short notice after a cancellation elsewhere, and was a bit concerned because of some of the reviews. But the price was good, and I didn't have a lot of time to shop around.Well, overall, the standard was much better than I had expected. The staff were friendly and helpful, explaining where to find things, how to get around, and attractions around Waikiki. The room was clean and the bed comfortable.The aircon *was* quite noisy, and we stayed on the 19th floor and the amount of road noise that filtered through was surprising (no double glazing?), but neither of these were intolerable. Our room cards worked fine, except at the door to the pool, where they needed many tries to get them to work. That was a bit frustrating. And as someone else mentioned, there is a much cheaper launderette nearby. Overall though, I think this hotel represents good value for money in a central location, and it made a good base from which to explore Honolulu. I'd stay again.

My stay at the Hawaiian Monarch was disappointing at best. The hotel is old and in need of much upkeep; many of the rooms are now operated as condo properties so there are a mixture of visitors and residents, which results in increased security, one of the nicer things, however the key-card system intended to separate the floor zones is should be upgraded or maintained, since the readers don't recognize the cards much of the time; I had to get my room key redone before it would work. The room was small, but had decent amenities other than the window air conditioner, which could not be aimed away from the bed; there was also a musty, moldy odor in the unit. Guest services are minimal; there is no furnished Internet in the rooms; for an extra $7 a day, they rent you a standalone interface that worked OK but was very slow by modern standards. The only WiFi is in the lobby. Parking was also a hassle, since the in-building garage is owned separately and they have no chargeback arrangement with the hotel. This meant that I had to pay for parking separately, IN CASH, and was not able to bill it to my room charge, which is something I expect in a decent hotel.None of these problems are disastrous, but they did take away from my satisfaction with the establishment. Unless there is no other choice, I will not be staying at the Hawaiian Monarch again.

I stayed here for 6 months while living and working in Hawaii. Conveniently located in Waikiki, good amenities in lobby, including 4 restaurants and bars and a convenient store. Laundromat on Kalakaua is much cheaper than using the laundry machines in the building.

I stayed one night at the Hawaiian Monarch Hotel prior to leaving on a cruise. Selected this hotel due to the located being closer to the cruise terminal than other Waikiki Hotels. This is only a two star hotel and you get what you pay for.Hotel reception staff were extremely helpful, rooms were large but dated. There was a large stain on the carpet and the room safe was a large ugly metal box attached to the wall. The use of the safe is not included in the room rate.Corridors servicing the rooms were not well lit and there was a distinct odour. I did not use any of the hotel facilities as I arrived late in the evening and left early the next morning.For a one night stay it was ok.

My family of 6 stayed at one of the privately owned condos in the Hawaiian Monarch hotel and we enjoyed our condo. Parking was ample and everything we needed to live comfortably in the condo was available. The views were amazing and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.

We stayed here twice in August, 2013. The first time we stayed, the room was much older, but still ok. The second time we stayed we had a room that was obviously renovated and that was much better. The hotel is located at the edge of Waikiki, towards the city.

My family spent a short stay at the Hawaiian Monarch recently. The hotel is pretty average, but it's clean, the service is very good and the views of Honolulu/Diamond Head and the lagood are breathtaking.

We booked a room for one night at this hotel. It well represents a two stars hotel. The service was good. It was correct for people who doesn't look for a luxury place. The carpet, the bath and the Windows were dirty. The mattress was low quality. Waikiki beach can be reach by 15 minutes walk. Wifi is not available in the room.

I have stayed here several times while working in and around Honolulu and love this hotel. I went in with no expectations the first time and found very accomodating and cheerful staff. Clean rooms and facilities. And a clean pool area. I have unfortunately not been back since 2007 due to work.
user_name:
BeachBumLife
New Hyde Park, New York

review_body: Yuk!!!!! Please read the above I am not repeating everything. This hotel was fine 20 years ago. It is in terrible shape. Threadbare towels, holes in the blanket, stained bedspread. No clock or alarm. Mainly for permanent residents I think.

Problem with Waikiki is that you either pay through the nose or get a place with high security and a rough attitude, and still overpay. Such was the Monarch. Lots of hoops with using the elevators, no ice machine, a large barren lobby co-shared with other "charming" places, $20 a day parking if you want it.Did feel safe there, though.

This is my first review. I wouldn't have written here in all honesty if it hadn't been for Celina (sorry if not spelled right). She went above and beyond asking any questions I had and was very helpful suggesting different activities around the area. She provided maps, both as handouts but also printed others out. She drew specifics on them, where to walk and cut through. She also provided times for special events as well. Great customer service. 5/5 rating for this ^The facility shows some age, but at least has in the room a tv, fridge, iron, and MICROWAVE! There is a pool and laundry room available as well. You may be surprised at the appearance, but keep telling yourself, "You're in Hawaii, don't hang out in your room."Parking on the otherhand is ridiculous. There wasn't a problem finding a spot, but even as a guest you're looking at spending $20 a night.I looked at maybe 5 places or any suggested by travel sites and this appeared to be the best bang for the buck. It is also located in a decent place you can drive anywhere you would ever need to. There's also a Walmart minutes away.

this is cheap hotel and condo but large facility and tall building with swimming pool and zaccuzi. thier is no luxury mood but clean, kind and affordable. Coin laudry, CVS, more. not in hot place and need to walk 10-20min to beach but not boring to walk. If you are the first visit of Hawaii, it is better to find other more atrractive hotels near beach. Good sushi res and grocery store in lobby floor. Never use moped rental store in 1st floor. They will cheat you.

I got a room on the 17th floor with a fantastic view of the Ala Wai Park and the mountains. Every day for ten days of my stay here I`m having my coffee enjoying the view. But that`s all I could really be honest about.On my check in day the front desk staff forgot to tell meI have to use the door card to activate the lift. Got in the lift and after 5min.nothing happened and I panicked.Luckily, another guest got in and he showed me how to do it.The room is spacious and clean with a coffee service area(complimentary coffee for brewing but no filters),an old small refrigerator,iron board (that is difficult to fold back) with iron,microwave,hairdryer,soaps and shampoos and towels.The cabinets are old, worn out, toilet does work but is not looking good.Walls have cracks, and you need to have a strong muscle to pull out shower knobs in the bathtub. No breakfast service available but there are bars and small restaurants in their premises and the surroundings. The aircon is too noisy. The worst part were the cockroaches that keeps crawling all over specially at night. I keep complaining to the housekeeping and front desk about it but all they could do is to spray it. The hotel is 10-15min. walk to the beach and has no computer service for guests who do not have computers with them. A pity for me who has a speaker that can charge only by a computer (USB). Though one staff was kind enough to charge it for me in their computer but she made me feel like it is a big favor to do so in the end. If you only want the view request for this room otherwise I won`t recommend it.

Firstly, people seem to forget that they are reviewing and rating aspects of a hotel at a certain price point. For what I paid ($82/night for two beds), this 1-star quality hotel functioned for our needs. It's on the edge of Waikiki(10 min to beach, 10 min to Kalakaua(fashion/restaurant street), 15 min to Ala Moana Center(huge mall) on foot, and 20 min taxi to airport($29 flat rate from Charley's Taxi)). Location was great for Waikiki, however, we will stay in North Shore(Turtle Bay) or Kailua next time we visit.Room was small and very dated, but had mini-fridge, microwave and other extra ameneties. The entire hotel needs to be gutted and remodeled. Pool was very basic, but large and the sun deck is huge! We laid out every day. Staff was super friendly. We did not fit in at this hotel at all(we spent most of our time enjoying Hilton Hawaiian Village and the Westin resorts for drinks/dinner. I would only recommend this hotel if you are looking for a clean place in Waikiki for under $90. We had a wonderful time regardless!

It's the little things that were bothersome.. you can barely rinse your hands in the sink, there's chips in the tub, the AC is so loud, the carpet was pretty crusty, you can easy trip over the fridge walking in, I guess fresh sheets are out of the question but the staff was great.

The staff was extremely helpful, we arrived at 6.45 am because my partner had a meeting at 7am and we were able to leave our rental car there (at a price but that's normal for busy Honolulu) and I was able to check in at 9am which was really great for me, as otherwise I would have had to hang around town for hours. The pool was nice and the hotel facilities and room were fine. It might not be the best location for holidayers but suited us as we needed to be near the Convention Center. We also were able to walk to the Ala Moana shopping center (about 15 mins).

Let me start by saying that i believe most/or at least a good quantity of rooms here are privately owned...which would account for the varied reviews on here...that makes it somewhat hard to compare (aside from the fact that nearly all rooms are still furnished in 70's furnishings).I needed a cheap place to stay or about 10 days with semi-kitchen facilities and managed to secure room 2208 on the 22nd floor. Yes the rooms are small, but somehow they still managed to fit in two double beds, a fridge,tv,small table and chairs & large closet. The room also came with microwave, coffee maker,rice cooker,blender,pots & pans, toaster, weird little two burner cooker (which I'm yet to try), amongst other utensils. The room had wooden floors and was exceptionally clean given its age..and im a stickler for cleanliness. The beds were comfortable, although you could hear the plastic mattress protector scrunch a little it didn't seem to affect the comfort level overall.The best part about this room was:The amazing view of the Ala Wai, Partial Diamond head....and off to the right...the oceanAnd......wait for it: FREE WIRELESS & CALLS Within the USA & Canada...(don't know why the hotel or other rooms don't have it connected) My only real gripe......and it's a big one; was that the shower was absolutely awful, almost cancels out the positives of this room..Yes I've staid in far better places for the dollar value but this is Hawaii and you do get what you've paid for.. Would definitely stay again (but only if they fix the shower first).
