Perth, Western Australia, Australia

review_body: This was my last hotel on my holiday and was just looking for a good shower and a decent bed. On arriving it was around 8.30pm and was left waiting at the counter for a while, I could hear someone on the phone out the back but there was no way of getting their attention. Other then that my stay was great. The room was huge and I appreciated being able to hide all my bags after collecting so much stuff. The tv was very small but I survived. The room came with a fridge - helpful. The hotel is in a good location close to a few restaurants, a 10-15min stroll to the beach and the same to ala moana shopping centre. ABC store seconds away for All those late night snacks. I only had my room serviced once and they did a good job. The hotel also as a pool which I did not use but looked clean and I saw others using it. I did go to the massage parlour and it was fantastic. I would stay here again for sure

I think the best thing about this hotel was its staff. Every single person at the desk was fantastic and went out of his/her way to help and make sure that my stay at the hotel was very good.I had a little studio for 4 nights. This set up served very nicely for my purposes. I was attending a conference at the Hale koa hotel, a 5 minute walk away. Hilton Hawaiian Village was right there and I could go to their beach area easily and then keep on walking as far as I wanted on the Waikiki beach front. It was great to be able to have a stroll on the beach early in the morning. There was an all-night diner very close by and fast food, pizza and Japanese downstairs. Other sit-down restaurants were within few minutes’ walk. There was even a Seven Eleven. Since everything was very expensive in Honolulu, it was good to have not so fancy things around too. I had a microwave, a small fridge, ironing board, free coffee first day. The room was very clean, good bed, plenty of good lighting. Although I had no ocean view (5 minute walk to see the ocean as I said before) my room faced a canal and mountains in the background. It was kind of fun to watch crew practice. The only thing that was annoying about the room was that it was difficult to have the air condition, computer and the Internet modem on at the same time because there were not enough electric outlets to plug everything in. So I had to rearrange the furniture to have everything on. Luckily enough the table was very small and can be dragged. The studio was very small so I had to make sure that I did not bang into the fridge or the television. Actually I found it rather humorous moving things around. So, I did not see it as a big deal.First night I could hear the traffic down the main road, but considering that it was a city, it was not bad at all. I could get my work done, and sleep in peace.If I come to this area of Honolulu again for something, I will certainly stay at this hotel.

We ended up at this hotel because it was the only thing available for our dates that was less than $500. Other reviewers have said the rooms were tired and needed updating. That's a generous assessment. You might be thinking 'you get what you pay for' but this hotel was not inexpensive. The dark green carpets were faded, the '70's bedspreads had holes in them and the quilted stitching was unravelled. The drapes had worn pinholes in them and the finish on the bath tub was peeling. We checked out after the first night and slept on the floor of our son's living room. HOWEVER, the front desk staff could not have been friendlier or more accommodating and the beds were comfortable (despite their unsavory appearance). There seemed to be a lot of Europeans staying there and I felt bad that this might be their perception of Hawaii. This hotel could definitely have ruined my Hawaiian vacation if it had been my first visit. I don't think the problem was with the staff but with the management company.

I stayed for 5 nights and knew to expect a "budget hotel" but was still disappointed with the small room size, stained carpet (room 1712), threadbare sheets, dusty light fixtures and mis-matched old furniture. On the positive side the hotel is quiet, the bed was comfortable and it is close to the beach and resort properties/amenities.

We spent one night in the hotel after an exhausting flight from Europe. The hotel is accessible from HNL airport by taxi for 35USD, or by a shuttle for USD15/person. So what you save at hotel cost you spend by taxi. But the hotel is in a good place near the center if Honolulu, the Waikiki Beach and the sport channel. It is equipped modestly but everything functioned well. Very little noise thanks to good windows. Air condition, somewhat noisy but working. No hotel restaurant but near is one. I was satisfied.

I was there for 1 night on my current Hawaii-Trip, had one transfer day in Honolulu-Waikiki!And that's why I can't say much about the hotel, but:Room was clean and spacious (I was traveling alone), view was nice (they had me on the 20th floor, room 2012, mountain view). There was a coffee-machine, a fridge, etc.They had NO WiFi, what so ever (not even paid one!)Location is ok ... if your having a transfer day or a very short stay. Walking distance to Waikiki-Beach aprox. 15 minutes. Seems like a bad neighborhood at night.A 7/11 is 3 walking minutes away.As another reviewer posted out: Celina was VERY helpfull, nice and courteous!If nearer at Waikiki-Beach or free WiFi it would have been a "Very Good", so it's just a "Average". But: Room was totally OK & clean!

After reading some of the other reviews I was a little apprehensive about booking at this hotel.The hotel is a little dated, but the rooms and common areas are extremely clean.The best thing about this hotel is the staff.They are extremely helpful and friendly.This was our sixth trip to Hawaii. We stay in budget hotels because we don't spend much time there. In all of our trips to Hawaii, this is by far the best staff that we have encountered.I hope to return next January. We are already planning to stay at the Hawaiian Monarch.

My wife and I stayed here as a layover on our way to kona, and it was exactly what we expected. Room was decent but crowded, hotel looked like it was stuck in the 70's. if you are just going to sleep here and nothing else, it's fine. It's within walking distance of the big boys. My only real complaint is the pillows. Come on, these pillows had to be from the early 90's. pillows are cheap Monarch, if you update anything, update them.

This property is truly stuck in the 1970's, as it has no Internet available for guests and an actualbank of pay phones in the Lobby area. Apparently, the property had an actual Internet Kiosk forGuest sue, and Management made the ridiculous choice to tear it out. I can understand that the building does not have WiFi, as this would be costly to do in this olda building.....but, come on management, either a free computer or two, or pay-to-use computers,would be indeed aappropriate now that we are in the year 2013. This archaic situation is especially ironic in the the property is in an excellent location for business travel, as it is at the"downtown" end of Waikiki and convenient to the McCully Street freeway on ramp. The rooms are smaller than most competing properties in this price range (such was WaikikiPark Heights or Ambassador), but they are clean with comfy beds. One big advantage is a roomy parking garage--parking staff assured me that the garage almost never fills so you wonthave the problem of coming in late at night and having to walk blocks to a parking garage with space. Allin all,Don Adams as Maxwell Smart of Jack Lord as Steve McGarrett would fit in just fine

I found two of their staff (Selina + Clifford) to be outstanding in taking pride in their work and making sure their customers are treated with respect and care. The hotel room itself looks tired and worn out, with a cracked sink and bathtub, furnitures very dated too. But hey, you get what you are prepared to pay for. If it is clean enough for me to rest the night and take a hot shower, I am quite happy even with the white noise from the air conditioning unit. The two excellent staff helped made my experience better though.

This hotel is perfect if you plan to use your hotel room to just sleep and shower. There is a local ABC store nearby, the Food Pantry for buying food, a 7/11 that is open 24 hours and there is a chemists near by in case you need some cream for a sunburn.There is bus stops near by that can take you anywhere you need to go on Oahu. Buy a 4 day bus pass for $25.The hotel is not that great. It is pretty much run down and needs a refit. If you are going to be out all day and just come back to your room to sleep and shower this hotel is perfect. You get a small fridge, a microwave and a coffee maker. Internet in the rooms is not free. If I remember correctly it was $9.95 for 3 days, $14.95 for 7 days and $4.95 for 1 day.

FIrst off, I could tell this place was going to be nasty from checking in with the "robo" clerk at the front desk who didn't even bother to make you feel welcome. No Aloha spirit here. Then upon getting to my room on the 15th floor reeked of stale cigarettes, even though the rooms are suppose to be non-smoking their are other tenants that are condo owners so they can smoke what they want I even encountered one that he said enjoys his dope. To top it off, the room itself was gross, the carpet was dirty and there was some type of noodles left in the bathroom sink, hope it wasn't barf from the prior guest. The bed was questionable so luckily I brought my own airline top cover so I wouldn't touch the bedspread. Unfortunately, I had prepayed for a four night stay otherwise I would off checked out. That would teach me to not get the cheapest place in Waikiki. Next time, I'll spend a few bucks more for a better place. The only thing this place has going for it is the view.

The room was horrible! Tiny room crowded with too much stuff. Dirty, stains everywhere. Broken shower, tore curtain, flickering lamp and what looked like blood in the bathroom. And the countless bugs everywhere and under everything! Smokey dirty smell in the room and very rude service from front desk assistant Clifford Johnson. Got a refund and went to Aqua Skyline at Island Colony. The room at skyline was amazing! And i would recommend it just dont stay at Hawaiian Monarch you'd be better off sleeping outside it'd be cleaner!

I just returned from a four night stay here and it wasn't bad.The lady who checked me in (Fau?) was nice but after giving me my room keys gave me a look like 'stop asking me questions.'Cheeseburger-Waikiki Restaurant a half block away has a good breakfast special & even a better customer service oriented waitress (Lauren).The only problems with my room were the sink dripped a lot and often times I had to turn on the hot water in the shower to get hot water to come out of the sink.Bath towels could use a litle upgrading, as mine were a little old.Close proximity to conventon center-5 minute walk-and shopping area on Kalakaua or beach area-10 minutes.I'd recommend this hotel if you're looking for a very basic room that's not right in the middle of Waikiki.

I would never stay there again. First of all, no one greeted us nor helped us with our bags. The lady at the front desk didn't even say aloha or anything. She was timid and rude. Our room was TERRIBLE! We could smell marijuana next door. Our room smelled like crap. My mom found a cockroach in the bath tub! Yes a ROACH!!! There were blood stains in the bath room. The sheets didn't feel clean. I was itchy. It was just HORRIBLE!! You get what u pay for. And we got CRAP!!!

We were apprehensive after reading some negative reviews; I insisted on seeing the room before accepting it. Maybe we were lucky, but we had a fabulous and large room at the end of a hallway on an upper floor. I looked at the room and came back reporting to my wife, "You'll love it!" She did. We received excellent and flexible service from our Housekeeper, Arlene.From the table by a large window overlooking the Ala Wai Canal, we could also see the Pacific Ocean and Diamond Head. We walked easily to Shore Birds (best tiki bar anywhere - and we're from the Florida Keys) and the Hawaiian Village. We also got around by car and bus, making the entire island accessible. The Monarch is well located on the western side of Waikiki, which makes Honolulu and such wonderful attractions as the Iolani Palace and the Bishop Museum closer. The pool deck is huge! Gas grills were clean and ready to use in an alcove with all the tools right there for you. We would definitely consider staying at the Monarch Hotel again.

Stayed in a vacation rental in this building recently - the rental was great - enjoyed the stay. The hotel itself is, as others have said is run down. I really think this a shame the owners really need to spend some money refurbishing the building it could be great - what a waste of a good building in a good location.But:1. The staff are great2. It was clean, at least in the part of the building where the private apartments were , hallways nicely carpeted, trash taken away more than once a day. Liked the fact that the Lower Lobby and right-hand side lifts were for the private floors only and that you needed a security card to use the lift to get up to these floors.3. The pool area good although could do with the space being utilised more (more plants, replacing of the broken jacuzzi etc) pool itself nice and the BBQ area/grills always clean.Not all bad!

I read the reviews here before I checked in so wasn't expecting much. My flight was 3 hours early but they let me leave my luggage until actual check in. Location is a good 10 minute walk to the main commercial strip of Waikiki, good for me since I wanted to be away from crowd. 10 minutes to Convention Center and 15 minutes to Ala Moana Shopping. The room was dated but clean. My bathroom was fairly decent sized, new curtains, vanity, hair dryer, shower/tub combo. 2 double beds, only needed one. Stained curtains a turn off, windows not operable, tiny TV. On the plus size there is a fridge, coffee maker (fee for coffee), and a microwave. The sushi restaurant downstairs was very good. The pool was dirty, at least there were cigarette butts, and debris in water. Overall the decor was something from the 70's, did'nt bother me for the price. I did get a ocean view so this was nice. Parking on-site was $16 a day. Pharmacy next door had hot food and an ABC on the opposite corner. As a solo traveler or if traveling with good buddies should not be a problem, not for romantic couple or families. I found the people living on-site rather seedy looking.

overall its a cool location rooms were sizeable i liked it it was queit and everything i need was in there they made the bed every day and it was very clean nice town hotel was surprised on how cheap needs to make parking mote affordabe though had tp park on the steet:( but that was the only down side

Customer service sucks. We were 30 mins early and they would not even check us in. Not like we would go straight to the room. Not worth the $ to stay here. Dinosaur TV with a huge remote!No Internet at ALL!Bathroom TINY!Parking sucks.NEVER AGAIN!

This is a fairly decent and reasonably priced place for those wanting to be near Waikiki without breaking the bank. The rooms are fairly spacious however the furniture looks a somewhat dated. The TV was really old too. The bathroom smelled somewhat musty, probably due to the old shower curtain. My room faced north so my view consisted of the Ala Wai Canal and the mountains. Quite spectacular! The beach is just a short walk from the hotel and the downtown area can also be reached on foot in no time. The guys at the front desk were genuinely friendly and helpful. All in all this is a great choice for those on a budget.

From check-in to check-out, our experience at the Hawaiian Monarch was positive. The front desk was friendly and very helpful. As airline employees with family in the islands, we travel more often to the islands and have tried many of the hotels in Waikiki and we feel we have found our favourite place. The check-in process was very smooth which comes in handy after a day of flying. The rooms were clean and to our surprise, equipped with a microwave and small fridge. The bathroom had a blow dryer and there was even an ironing board and iron in the room.The only negative for us is we don't like spending $16 per day to park our car so we decided to take the City Bus and the bus stop is a few blocks away. Under normal circumstances this would have been fine but with a bum foot in this trip, it did present a physical challenge.

As I approached the front desk, the front desk assistant greeted my husband and me with a smile that let us know that we were welcomed at the hotel. We arrived early, so our room was not yet ready, but no problem. The hotel had a safe place where we could store our luggage until the room would be ready at 3:00 p.m. So, my husband and I went for a walk and had lunch. After lunch, we thought we would go back to the hotel and see if we could wait for our room by the pool. It was only about 1:30 or so and we expected that our room would not be ready. But, lo and behold, our room was ready. The front desk assistant registered us for our room and helped us retrieve our luggage from the safe, locked luggage storage room located beside her front desk location. When we entered our room we were pleased at how nice, clean, and pretty it was. We had only planned on being there for one night so all the amenities that we needed for one night were there... except for ice. My husband and I travel extensively and in every hotel we have been in, there was always a way to get ice. We looked around for the ice bucket and didn't see one. So, we called the front desk and to our amazement we learned that there was no ice bucket, furthermore, there was no ice vending machine. What a bummer. But, that was the only thing negative we found about the hotel. I would advise that they get an ice vending machine on each floor. It is Hawaii, after all and Pina Coladas taste better with ice.We discovered that we needed to find a camera shop and the front desk assistant was kind enough to recommend two camera shops for us. He even went online and printed out a map for us to find our way. We were able to find the camera shops and get what we needed. To me, that was above and beyond the call of duty. We were very pleased to have that level of service.The bed was comfortable and we woke up the next morning to check out of the hotel. Still, the service was excellent. The front desk assistant was so friendly and helpful to everyone and he even called us a cab to get us to our destination.I would stay at the Hawaiian Monarch Hotel again. I would even recommend that my family and friends stay here, too. The friendliness is genuine. The accommodations are beautiful and comfortable. When you are traveling, there is not much more you need from a hotel.

The Monarch has both hotel rooms and privately owned units for rent. I've rented a privately owned unit which was well furnished but pricey, The last time I booked a hotel room as part of a package which was clean but worn and tatty, still very good value for Hawaii. It's an expensive place to visit and anything cheaper will most likely be filthy and even dangerous. I mainly like the location because it's at the beginning of Waikiki allowing an easier escape of the tourist zone. However, I'm not sure I'd reccomend it as a family resort due to the fact there are a lot of transient people renting long term there, a scummy pub in the basement and a gangster gogo bar on the premises. Great if you like to party, perhaps disconcerning if your not into commercial sex, drugs and rock n roll. I spent alot of time in reception for the free wifi and saw alot of crazy poopoo going down. Having said that the security and staff are excellent considering their duties often extend to being social workers and mediators.

Excellent service, friendly staff, and helpful, nice rooms, our family enjoyed this vacation. We book the vacation with holiday from tripaura.com, prices were cheap than a lot of other travel sites. We got a good deal. We looked around a lot. The trip was excellent and enjoyable with the vacation we really needed.

As I arrived to check in there was noone at the front desk so I waited thinking they probably just went into the back for something. Yet still I wait, and wait and whisper hellooooooooo, then shout hello! The associate stepped out, no apology, she says are you checking in? After giving here my name and card I tell her I have my kids with me. She looks at me and looks down at the paper holding my rm keys and tells me how to get to my rm. my kids and I get there and the door is already open and there is only one bed. Wow such service. What happened to the aloha with this island? Front desk associates need to learn people skills. My daughter could see the difference between the attitude of the people in oahu and Kauai. Kauai is much friendlier to guests of the island and locals alike. Poor rating for this hotel. Not staying there again

Our unit was renovated fully furnished and had all the basics we needed to cook and enjoy our time at the beach. We had views up the mountain, of the beach, city and the pool below. It was an amazing place and we really liked the security of the building. Trash, recycling, laundry and parking were all easily accessible and there was even a small convenience store close. Easy to get in and out of waikiki from the Monarch. Overall it was a fantastic place and we were super satisfied,

I stayed here in January 2012 - the week of the Pro Bowl so options and prices were limited. At that late in the game, I was able to get a decent rate of about $70 per night. The location is not too bad... close to the Tony Romo and Century Plaza. It is half way between Ala Moana and the main Waikiki strip. It is also close to the car rental places around Ala Moana Blvd. There are a couple 7-elevens around and even a drug store close by. I would say most of the past reviews are accurate. The rooms are a bit dated and old... and not the cleanest. That said... this is more like a 2 and 2.5 star hotel. You get what you pay for. I found the room sufficient for my lodging.The staff wasn't too bad and they were helpful. They allowed us to check-in a little early because my daughter needed her nap (about 30 minutes) and I found that very nice. I would probably stay here again if the rate is low.Pro:Price.Location. (but do expect some walking)Con:Rooms are oldNot as clean.Only a few rooms have views.

It was just yuck. The room smelled. There was a dead bug caught behind the glass of the picture hanging on our wall...and to top it off, they had tried painting the bathtub. Probably to cover up blood stains of a previous guest.

Before I booked my trip, I was confident that I found a nice hotel to stay in from an online booking. Then, I thought the price was too good to be true "cheap", I had found a "great deal"! But when I got to the hotel, I arrived at 1:50pm, I was told check-in wasn't until 3pm. That wasn't a problem, but when I finally got into my room, the room was a bit disgusting. The carpet was really dingy as if there were a lot of spillage and it was NOT properly cleaned/disenfected. There were a lot of staining on the walls, the microwave was dirty, bathroom was dirty. I was starting to dislike this deal already. Few days after being in the hotel, I find out that they were running a "personal service" in the very bottom floor, which there were a lot of people loitering at night around the lobby area and the lower floors. I felt unsafe, especially at night. Overall, the room setting was a bit odd. At the end, during check-out day at 11:15, a local female from the FRONT DESK calls my room in regards to check out. I asked if I could extend until 12pm, because I was not quite ready yet to check-out, assuming that I waited for them to check-in on my initial arrival. She denied my request, AND she threatened me of charging me $30 for late check-out /and or pay a whole entire day of stay. I rushed to the front desk, as I was walking away she laughs with her co-worker as if I was a joke. I would not recommend this hotel for vacationers.

This hotel is kind of a hotel / time share / apartment building. We booked through HotWire and it was cheap, even for during a holiday season. The room was small, but clean and quiet. The location is great for the price and certainly within walking distance of everything Waikiki. If you’re just looking for a place to throw your stuff down during the day, then go with this hotel. It has in / out parking in a structure for a fee, but that is well worth it if you have a rental car.

I give this hotel an average rating because it truly is a "budget" hotel. You get what you pay for. If your vacation involves being out all day and only needing a place to crash at night, then this is the place for you. Very basic amenities. It's a bit old. Tub was dirty. Towels were worn and paper thin. Walls were thin too. Asked for a crib twice and it never came. Housekeeping is only available during the day. I was only there at night to sleep so those issues didn't bother me. Close enough to the beach and activities but far enough away that you avoided crowds. I would stay here again if I were going to stay in Honolulu for a couple of days. More than 3 nights would be pushing it. AVOID THE PARKING GARAGE! It's $16 a night as a hotel guest. They only accept cash. You have to check into the hotel before you can park your car and there's no clear signage explaining that until you pull in and create a traffic jam! Once I parked I asked the attendant if I needed to pay $16 for both nights I was planning to be there. She said, "As long as you don't move your car, you are fine." I didn't move the car out of the garage for the two nights I was there. As I was leaving and after I checked out of the hotel, the attendant demanded another $16. I explained what I was told and he said, "You are the second person today who said that. That is not how it works."

A good value if you are there to see the sights and just use the hotel for sleeping.Not fancy but clean.BEWARE if you use the parking garage.Our rental car was broke into and a camera and handicap plackard was taken.They did nothing about.The parking garage is not owned by the hotel.The hotel staff was friendly.

While our initial sense of the place was very bad - they didn't want to honour their website's offer of a free shuttle bus from the airport - eventually everything worked out brilliantly. The staff were lovely once we arrived, allowing us to check in hours before the allotted time and sorting out a refund for the shuttle bus. Quiet rooms, lovely pool, extremely convenient location, overworked but friendly and helpful staff and fantastic price made it a great stay. In fact, two stays as we were there for one night before Christmas and two nights in early January.

I went hawaii in February 2011 and stayed in Hawaiian Monarch Hotel. The hotel location is convenient and peaceful from the crowd of beaches. The beach area is barely 800 meters from the hotel. the rooms are average but large.

The hotel is located close to a 24 hour 7/11, and the staff was amazing there. Papaya soap, and shampoo in the bathroom. Close to bus stops for 2, 13, and B busses taking you to Chinatown, or to the busy part of Waikiki and 4 bus to University of Hawaii of Manoa. Recommended to get a month pass for $60 at the 7/11. So you should go at the beginning of the month, and maximize the value, there's a 4 day pass for $25 for a shorter stay. Public transit is $2.50 each way. Laundry on the 5th floor, makes it easy, and hastle free. Change machine located next to the payphones in the lobby. And detergent and dryer sheets only 2 bucks from the front desk. I was in room 1813. Very nice view of the North side of Waikiki, and you can see the daily rainbow from the mountains. I'm not use to the heat, so the AC was amazing in the room. Definately recommend the late check out if your catching a late flight. Also for a cheap lunch, go to the University with your bus pass. $6.19 for a different daily special, and you can buy something for later too. And you have to go to a Rainbow Wahine Volleyball game if they're playing. Not too far from campus, and $25 for great seats.

I had read many reviews after booking this hotel and honestly I was not disappointed. I seen and heard others there at the hotel that weren't as satisfied but I don't know what they're problems were. The place was quiet, very secure and very friendly and helpful staff. The only thing to note was the tubs was painted over but nothing I've seen before but beds were always made and even towels were replaced when I tried to recycle them to conserve energy. I also was offered and accepted my luggage to be held securely since my departure time was later than my check out time. I would definitely visit again on my next trip.

I loved staying there. the room was clean, two beds, tv, cable, safe, iron and board, coffee, micro and refrig. shampoo provided. great pool. in the building is a day spa, sushi bar, sports bar, breakfast and lunch rest. bank next door, subway, 7-11, waikiki hamburger bar and grill and of course abc stoe. there is a little store in the hotel with better prices than abc. in the parking area is the moped and scooter rental or cars, either one. 8 min walk to the beach at hawaiian village. my friends stayed at hawaiian village. i could walk to their beach before they could get down the elevator and to the beach and for half their price. this is a yes. you dont need a car. robertshawaii will suttle for 20 bucks round trip. if you need a day car, check the lobby or walk to avis, one block away.

Hawaiian Monarch is a very comfy hotel, staff is really kind and helpful. I stayed there for nearly two months and really enjoyed it and finally felt like at home. The outdoor swimming pool is amazing, not so crowded, and very peaceful. The hotel is located about 15 minute walk from Waikiki Beach and really close to various fast foods and ABC stores.

We stayed in this hotel 4 nights in the beginning of November 2011. If you decide to book here set your expectation very low and you will not be disappointed. This hotel is very old and is only maintained in correct shape, no major renovation was done last few years. Because it is often fully booked, don't expect major improvements from the owner in the future. So forget aesthetics, all what you need close to Waikiki is clean, cheap place to sleep and take a shower. If these are your goals, this place is for you. For us personally, the only major negative point is a very loud noise from the traffic. This happens because AC is very poorly integrated into the windows and let pass all noise from the street. So as the consequence we could not sleep well. Other then that, it was clean, friendly and helpful stuff, friendly customers we met in the lift, good security.Additionally, if you like sushi, there is small place just few steps from the desk. Sushi here is not expensive, fresh and good quality .We eat it for every breakfast.

My wife and I arrived and the first hint we got about this hotel is when the shuttle bus driver asked us what hotel we were staying at and we told him, he stopped, looked at us and just went "Oh". This should have told us, we arrived to police on scene dealing with problems at the mini scooter hire shop next to the lobby, hmmm, them greeted by a very nice lady at the counter which is situated...well its almost outside there is no lobby as such. We were checked in and told our room, we went up, the elevator was old, badly maintained and had to share it with a lady who had the largest basket of laundry ever, thats no vacation laundry. We got out of the elevator and was greeted by decor that was dated and just awful, the colors on the woodwork were nasty and badly painted as if my teenage son had done it. The room was small, with two beds that had torn and badly stained sheet, we didn't even sit on them in case of what we might find. Everything had a dark layer of dirt on it, the cable from the wall to the ceiling light, the microwave, the television. The screen on the window was chicken wire used for animal pens, below the air conditioner was a metal tray of water. The closet looked like it might collapse at any moment and it stunk of something similar to vinegar. The view out of the window was onto another tower block that had broken out windows with wood covering the doors and tattered curtains blowing in the wind. We looked briefly at the bathroom and that was when we decided no more. We walked our cases back down to the lobby (well desk really) and stated we could not stay in that room, they showed us another but lets be honest it was no better. We checked out there and then. On a plus they offered us a full refund which did surprise us there so customer service was good. Oh and as we walked out the hotel with our cases in tow another police car was dealing with yet another problem on the street, We took that as the ultimate sign. Maybe this is good for young people who really are not that worried about where they stay but my wife and I do. We walked up to the Hilton nearby and begged for a room damn the expense.

We were a bit worried before our trip after reading reviews on this site. But, we were not disappointed. It is early 80's style but seemed well kept to us. We did not fly to Hawaii to stay in a hotel room. If we had, then we may have been disappointed. Our room was clean and cleaned well daily. It is not a luxury hotel but is less than half the price of the luxury hotels. It is near the nicer hotels so the neighbor hood is just fine. We walked up and down the street to the beach and had no troubles. Someone mentioned the need for your key card to use the elevator. I stayed in a Hyatt in South Carolina in which you had to have a card. That is common in high traffic areas. It's called security. I would stay at the Hawaiian Monarch again in an instant. Now, when I'm 85 and just want to sit and look at the ocean, I'll stay at the Hilton on the beach! We even had our toddler with us so I would recommend this to families who want an inexpensive place to stay so that they can spend their money on having fun!

this is close enough to the beach and shops, its very cheap compared to other hotels nearby, but its definitely get what you pay for. not the nicest, cleanest hotel I've ever stayed at, but not the worst. We didnt plan on staying in the room that much, and this hotel is perfect for that. If you're looking to spend a lot of time in your hotel, I wouldnt stay here. But if you're looking for cheap, close, reasonably nice, this is a fine hotel. the staff are pleasant and helpful. No real issues.

I have stayed in a lot of countries all over the world and this hotel would be acceptable to me if it was located in a 3rd world nation. The whole experience was just creepy, I would have preferred a hostel bunk to this hotel. The tower the hotel is in contains apartments and condos so it doesn't feel like a hotel at all. It actually feels like you are renting creepy apartments. Because of the shared nature of the building you need to slide your room key into the elevator to be able to use it at all. The hallways leading to the rooms are dark and seriously needing paint. The room itself was shabby. There were holes and rips in my comforter that had just worn down from use. I was terrified of taking the sheets off because I was certain there would be bed bugs. After struggling with it for a while I tried to take the sheet off but there is another creepy bed cover underneath that had blood stains and that is when I realized I REALLY didn't want to know what was under there. The mattress had no padding left so when I laid down I could feel the individual springs. The bathroom had black mold, the tub was plastic that creaked and flexed when I walked around in it (and I'm not very heavy). No internet, and broken computers in the "lobby" and when I accidentally left my key in the room and asked for another key, the nice girl behind the desk just asked, what room number? She didn't verify my identity at all. I could have just asked for any room number and gotten a key.The only good thing I can say is that the air conditioning actually worked and the staff was nice.

The hotel is older but was clean and has mini fridge and microwave.Parking is separate so it's 16.00 a day if you have a rental car . The staff was very nice and the pool location is really great on the 6th floor outside.The rooms are not fancy but you are only there to sleep .I would stay again .

If your records go back that far, my husband Raymond Bolduc and I visited during the 70's, 80's and 90's several times. We were then from Massachusetts. We always stayed at the Monarch. It has been several years now, but thought you would like an objective opinion..old to new. I realize that you are probably focused on the condominium side rather than the rentals. Everything was ok. The staff were excellent . The selection of eating establishments leaves a lot to be desired. Rap music and just Pizza after flying for 14 hours was not very warming.  My only major complaint is the parking garage. I did rent a car and of course parked at your hotel. The woman informed me that I could pay for my ten day stay up front. $160.00. After 5 days of never using the car, we decided to turn it in. As a courtesy and to get my refund , I told her that we were turning the car in. All I got was NO REFUND. That's it. It is enough for me to tell you that I will never recommend your hotel for my friends or will I select it for myself again should either have a rental car. I would have paid daily had I realized that. Policy or not, give me a break ! I paid up front so I wouldn't forget and owe YOU money. Who ever heard of such a thing. That $160.00 will cost the Monarch some business . Thank you for your timeSincerely,Janice Bolduc

Hi my name is Anna.I am from NYC.My son started college in Honolulu and I went with my son.I stayed in Hawaiian Monarch for one week in sept 2011 at the recommendation of one of my friend from Honolulu.The location was very good. I was able to walk to my son's dorm and close to all the attractions in waikiki and very close to bus line.What impressed me the most was the helpful attitude of the front desk staff every one was nice especially Shera Faatea and Kori Tofilau who went above and beyond to help me to find places and directions for me and took their time to help me.They made my stay very easy they are very pleasant and extremely helpful.I recommend this hotel for their service.
