review_body: Well now! How can I say this. First of all the rest room facilities were less than wonderful. The toilet was so lose on its pedistal that you never knew when it was going to topple much like Gadhafi in Lybia. The bathtub was totally worn out and needed replacement. It took a man and a boy to turn on the water faucet to control the flow and then you weren't sure when the water was hot or cold and when it would change. The bed was too soft small and the pillows were hard. The room was very small and needed paint. The Pool was in repair and could not be used. There was no ice available and had to be purchased at the local store. With all these problems we encountered another big one. After a nice meal at one of Wiakiki's best restaurants we went back to our room. As we neared the door we saw another couple entering our room with a key given them by the front desk. They rented our room to another party when we were out. Oh yeah and it was one more thing that we felt was way out of the ordinary. Will we return? Not in this lifetime.

This hotel came as a package with air and car. It was a reasonably priced package. I could have chosen another and paid slightly more, but the pictures looked nice and legit and it was good enough, so I thought. It was a big disappointment. Without our GPS, we would not have been able to find this hotel. The hotel didn't even have a sign. The parking is $16 a day that you can't charge to your room because it is independently owned...and they only took CASH. So a good part of our vacation budget was unexpectedly spent on parking fees. There is no public parking anywhere closeby. The front desk smelled heavily of Pine Sol when we checked in. It felt and looked dirty. There were two computers infront of the front desk that didn't work, and there was no WIFI in the room. The front of the hotel had a moped rental place that just cluttered the whole front loading area. The hallway felt greasy, smelled musty and was dark. All of these led us up to our room that smelled badly and felt dirty. We wanted to turn around and run! The shower had black mold in the grout. It was a place where you would not want to take your shoes off and not want to lay down on the bed because the whole room just cried bed bugs. We opened the curtain to look across a boarded up condo with a guy standing in a window watching our room! The nicest draw to this hotel would have been the pool area, but when we checked in we were informed that it was being renovated. I called Expedia begging to change our hotel, but they made it so difficult to do and required us to pay for the new hotel on our own and to risk not getting a refund from this hotel we were stuck in. The location is not good...too far from the center of activity in Waikiki. Do not walk around at night either. Not a good place to be after dark. I strongly recommend anyone to NOT stay at this hotel. I am certain you will be sorry.
It was under major construction when we stayed but there was a lingering damp smell that was entirely different . Awesome views though just not a room to sit in all day .

My sister and I were going on a Pride of America cruise so we arrived in Hawaii 2 days earlier - found this hotel through the Roberts website - checked it with Trip Advisor and thought it will be OK and the price was right. The hotel might be a little tired but the staff were so helpful and friendly. Our room was fine and I am passing on this tip - come to Hawaii early before embarking on a cruise and stay here-

My husband and I stayed for 8 nights at the Hawaiian Monarch. I would definately stay at this hotel again. The room was very clean and the staff was absolutely wonderful. The hotel is a few blocks from the beach but that was nice because it was quiet and that was nice when you are exhausted from site seeing and want to relax. The rate we received was great!

stayed here for the weekend & it was muy magnifique. The hotel clerk was very pleasant and very helpful. the room was clean and the view was nice. Diamond Head + Waikiki beach = BEAUTIFUL! The housekeeper was nice & pleasant as well. the location is in walking distance to the beach & the stores. I love it!

My wife and I stayed here for a week and we were happy that the rates were low and thought we could save money by staying here. The pics online seemed decent, but the moment we arrived at the hotel, everything seemed so old and dirty (lobby area). When we got to our room, it was worst. The bathroom tub looked like it hadn't been cleaned and the room smelled funny (like old cigarettes). When we would flush the toilet, it made a sound like a dead seal. The curtains were old and dingy and the sheets seemed clean, but definitely old and worn out. My wife pretty much wanted to sleep with her shoes on the whole time! The furniture was all random and nothing really matched. The good thing was we spent most of the time outdoors doing activities, so we were only in the room to sleep and shower at night. Another plus was the location. it's just minutes and walking distance to the heart of Waikiki. My recommendation is if you don't care about cleanliness and comfort and just want a cheap place to stay at night, this might be ok.. but it's definitely worth it to spend the extra $50-75 bucks a night for a decent and nice 4 star hotel.

I stay in the 14th floor and I want to get out of here!!! That was the only thing I could think of! Couldn't sleep because of the street next to the canal! Yes, the windows don't block the noise at all! Nice pool, but that is the only positive thing I have to say! You don't even get what you pay for!The parking area is horrible, lobby is horrible, elevator horrible (and I could hear all the bing bing bings in my bed!!!), room seems nice at first sight, but not clean when you take a serious look at it, bathroom not clean, and so on, and so on!But the worst is the noise! I was tired all day long because I couldn't sleep all night long!Horrible!

Ive been traveling to Hawaii in 2009 with a buddy of mine and stayed at the Hawaiian Monarch for a month! When we arrived we booked a accommodation about 30 minutes walking to get to Waikiki beach, after staying there for 1 night we decided to look a accommodation near the beach with a budget in our price range. After walking around with our luggage we got drawn into the Hawaiian Monarch and became friends with the manager who arranged a very good price for us. Overall the accommadtion is close to Waikiki beach (about 10 minutes walking), near the clubs and malls. The hotel got simple rooms with 2x1 single beds a tv, microwave and bathroom. In other words if you dont mind simple yet cozy rooms (lowbudget) with a little walking distance to the beach and the centre then the Hawaiian Monarch is definitly something to stay.

Located on the outer edge of the Waikiki section of Honolulu. Had a good view of the mountains from our room. Had to pay extra for parking each day. No internet for guests in rooms. Had to unplug lamps to have outlet for recharging cell phones at night.

Hawaiian Monarch is located in Waikiki and is in walking distance to almost everything: The beach, the restaurants, the shops and the nightlife are within a 10-15 minute walk. Besides the ideal location, one more thing that makes this hotel attractive is its affordable price. On average I paid $ 65 per night (including taxes) which is not so bad. Rooms have fridge, TV, and microwave. No free internet and no free breakfast. I stayed on the 15th floor and I had perfect view from my room’s window. If you stay in this hotel ask for a mountain view room. Note: The hotel offers a one–way free bus ride from airport to hotel with the Roberts bus company. You should take advantage of this. On the downside, one thing that you will notice by just walking in the hallways is that the hotel is old. My room was small and it’s furniture was old and in bad condition (dirty, scratches). Both carpet and mattress had some weird strains that honestly I don’t want to imagine what it was. In the bathroom, the bathtude was dirty (black sand) and during the nights a strong tobacco smell was coming from the ventilator. All rooms are close to elevators and you constantly can hear a “beep beep” sound whenever the elevator door opens or closes. This was very annoying. In conclusion, if you visit Honolulu for honeymoon or plan to spent time in your room do not choose this hotel. If you need just the basics (sleep and shower) then this place is perfect. Just remember that this place is not a Hilton or Marriott.

The hotel was situated about 10 minutes walk from the Waikiki Beach and about 20 from the biggest Hawaiian mall. The bus stops were available nearby, which made it easy to get anywhere within the island. We had a nice room on the high floor and could admire the beautiful view of the city. The bathroom was small and the tub looked pretty old. There were a fridge and a coffee maker in the room. The remote control was as big as a book. The pool and jacuzzi situated on the 5th floor were very nice to enjoy although the pool was very small. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

we stayed in Hawaiian monarch hotel for 7 nights. the hotel really has all that we needed: comfortable bed, quite clean room, nice view from a window - our room was on 23rd floor, laundromat and vending machines on a lower floor, outdoor swimming pool etc. The location is within walking distance to beach (12min), ala moana center (15min), waikiki downtown (15min). There some dinning possibilities very close to the hotel and ABC store is right on the corner. the staff was helpful and well informed. the hotel has good value of what you get for the money you pay. the only disadvantage of the hotel (and I think I will not be the first to mention it), is that it is really, really old - literally everything needs renovations - rooms, furniture, bathrooms, lifts..., but it really did not matter that much - all in all, it is Hawaii!

If you want Hilton style rooms please stay in Hilton, if you are looking for cozy place thats within 10-15 minute walk (depending on your pace) of the beach, downtown Waiikiki or Ala Moana shopping center the Hawaiian Monarch should be your choice. My stay there from Nov. 1-8 was quite relaxing and worry free. If you get hungry there is number of restaurants within couple blocks or you may try "The Cream Pot" restaurant which is located on the left of the lobby (there waffles are delicious).

This was the second time I stayed at Hawaiian Monarch and it didnt let me down. The staff is incredibly friendly, the rooms big and clean and it is just great value for money. It is a 20 mins walk to the beach, but the Ala Moana shopping center with several bus connections is very close by. It is half the price of the hotels in central Waikiki and the service it just as good. I would definitely recommend it if you are on a tight budget.
Pictures look nicer than the hotel really is. Sheets looked and felt old. There were little gnats along the baseboards. The staff was extremely friendly. Definitely needs to be updated.

I am not a complainer by nature, but The Hawaiian Monarch Hotel was absolutely horrific. There was a homeless man in the "lobby." The two "white" leather sofas were disgusting - one was missing an arm. Hotel staff can only be described as "creepy." There is no ice machine, blow dryer didn't work, floors were dingy, room was dusty, curtains were scary,...I could go on. I wish I had been warned. I would have stayed elsewhere.

We stayed at the Hawaiian Monarch 4 nights on our first trip to Hawaii and we could not have been happier with the place. The staff made this trip wonderful. They have a lot of knowlege and Aaron was great to work with. He made us laugh and gave us great ideas for food and more. The hotel needs a bit of work but really not much. I work for two hotels and can tend to get a different veiw of places. The bed was wonderful and the fact that the hotel had small fridges and great AC was wonderful. The room itself seemed a little small in the way it was set up but worked ok for us. I loved the pool area even though there is not much there but chairs and the pool it self. It is odd being overlooked by the apartments next door. I felt safe and secure in this hotel, the only issue I have with it is its location to downtown when it comes to someone who cant walk very far. Take the time to talk with the front desk to learn about The Bus when you first get there it pays off. We would stay there again just to deal with the staff. I would pay big bucks to have someone like Aaron work for me at the hotels I manage.Thanks from the Newly Weds

I can speak about the services from the front desk not the hotel rooms itself because I was an occupant through a timeshare program of one of the penthouses. It did have a beautiful view and was well kept. Aaron Robinson could easily be at a five star Hotel with the manner in which he dressed, courteously answered questions, and made you feel your concerns were very important. I witness tenant and guess walk by stop to speak or return his smile. No one had a disparaging word to say about him. It is refreshing that he comes to work with a warm smile that greets all.

This hotel is one of the best kept secrets in Waikiki - I shouldn't even be telling you this. The Hilton it is not but for proximity to the downtown area & the major shopping centre make up for this. After all how much time do you spend in the room when you are on holiday anyway. The staff were most helpful. This was our 3rd time staying at the Monarch and will definitely be staying there again.

I stayed here with 3 kids for one night. It was a last minute trip and I booked it through Hotwire. (I didn't get to choose, it chose for me, if your familiar with Hotwire.) I didn't fear too much based on reviews that others had given the hotel. I arrived and was greeted by great staff. Aaron was terrific. Some of the other high points are:Inexpensive parking. ($14 for 24 hours)Good location.Great views, even city view was pretty decent.Staff was awesome.The room was clean but the beds were terribly small. They told me that I had two queens but I think they were fulls. The mattresses were terrible. I could feel the springs inside the mattress. The pillows were small and thin. I honestly feel they have better bedding at a Motel 6. Despite the good listed above, I cannot give that great of a rating as I could not get a good night's sleep at all. The bottom line is that I would not recommend this hotel to any friends or family. Granted, I got the hotel on a last minute deal for less than $80 for the night but given the choice, I would have gladly put down the extra $20 for a better night's sleep.

I would defiantly reccommend this hotel to friends as well as stay here again myself i loved it.Great value for money and the location was fantastic.Aaron was amazing in helping us during our stay in finding all thebest attractions and with local transport if you have any uestion defiantly find him to askLocation to the beach was amazing to a short no more than five minute walk and you are in paradie

Our room on the 14th floor had a good view of the city. The room was neat and cleaned daily, the beds were comfortable, the shower adequate, the price reasonable, the clothes storage more than adequate, the service courteous.

Stayed here for 2 nights. Found all the staff to be friendly, courteous and helpful. Our room (21st floor) more than met our expectations (having read some previous reviews here) with twin double beds, a clean bathroom, coffee machine, air con and great views across the city. Perhaps the hotel is not the most ultra-modern, but it was fine for us. It is not in the more busy/touristy parts of town (a short 5-10 minute walk away) but that is no bad thing. Would happily stay again.
Great staff and memorable vacation, location excellent. I would recommend this hotel highly for anyone on a budget.

My 22 floor room contained these amenities: Aesthetic decor, table with two upholstered chairs, killer views, air con, blackout drapes, refridge, microwave, flat screen TV, small safe, hair drier, hot-pulsating shower, entry door peep hole, coffee maker, excellent lighting, great mattresses, Kleenex, shampoo, hair drier, hangers, and abundant towels. Plus . . . Elevators keyed for security, complimentary daily newspaper in the lobby, excellent location within walking distance of mainstream Waikiki sans crowds and noise, convenience store and two restaurants in lobby, laundry facilities, and pool. The entire desk staff treated me like family, and I'll book no where else on future trips!

I went to Hawaii a day early before my cruise. I am not fussy at all. Actually I'm very simple. Well when we landed that Friday we watched the news and heard about the earthquake in Chile. Wow. Well, not long after that Hawaii was under a tsunami warning. We were checking out anyway on Saturday because we were heading to the port. Saturday morning was very eerie because the news put out a warning that everyone near the beach must stay above the 12th floor for their safety. Sirens were blaring. The young lady at the desk called and asked what were our plans. We asked if we could have a late check-out. We went downstairs and "Josh" the manager was on duty and he said he couldn't do it but he had to charge us for another day. WTH, there's a tsunami warning in effect. No problem. We'll check out. We only wanted a few hours until the warning was lifted. Most hotels will accommodate if you ask. I didn't see a line of patrons trying to check in. I would even pay for a partial day. Josh couldn't do that either. The hotel wasn't even that clean but like I said, I only needed it for a night. I was very disappointed and when I returned from the cruise I booked a room at the Marriott. At least I know what I'm getting.

This hotel met all of our needs and I am very happy to pass a recommendation on. It is very cheap, but fully lived up to our expectations of a good clean room in a central location. We only needed somewhere to sleep and did not use other faciliies on the hotel than the pool (there is a big BBQ by the pool btw).We werent too impressed with the restaurants/bars at the hotel, but as it is so close to the city centre there are loads of other restaurants nearby. Staff is very friendly and reception is open 24 hours. My highest recommendations:)

I'd agree with fellow travellers; Aaron was very helpful and always smiling. I think you get what you pay for. So, don't expect too much & you won't be too disappointed.There were a few interesting characters there, for sure but we weren't there to rate the clientele.Hygiene needs a look into and the walls are a bit too thin for my liking but as a base to explore the locality - it suited fine.

First you should know that the Hawaiian Monarch is part residential and part hotel so you'll see a nice mix of local and tourists intermingling. There is a night club and several nice restaurants on site, which is nice but has potential to be bad (when I got back to the hotel one night police were there.) Cons:The water in the shower fluctuates from hot to cold at random regardless of how much you fiddle with the knob, the pain in the bathroom is flaking off, there was a huge blood splatter on our duvet, housekeeping never answered their phone, and the TV remote did not work properly. Pros:Extremely friendly front desk staff, free local newspaper daily, secure elevator, convenient location (within walking distance of almost everything), restaurants on site.

After reading some of the reviews we were wondering what the hotel would be like. We were pleasantly surprised and very happy with the pleasant, courteous, and helpful staff. It is an old hotel, but clean and comfortable with all rooms overlooking the Ala Moana canal. It is centrally located between Waikiki and the Convention center and Ala Moana Shopping Center. Buses run a few minutes walk from the hotel and there are shuttle services available to the airport, ship terminals, and for excursions at very reasonable prices.

My sister and I only needed to stay the one day because we came in a day earlier than our scheduled package. I must say from the moment we got there, Aaron was more than helpful. His knowledge of the area and transportation available and how much, was awesome. He even told us about all the great places to eat and how to get there, even pinning the places on a map for us. That's what made our stay pleasant and fun. The service was great. The room had everything I needed, including a microwave. My sister needed an iron. It just took one call and one was brought up immediately. The room was not the most modern, but was clean and neat, beds and sheets were comfortable, which is always my concern, when prices are this reasonable. So thanks again "Aaron" for making our stay a pleasant experience.

The rooms are very basic. There was a persistent odor in the hallway similar to raw meat and bleach. Rooms were cleaned minimally. The A/C unit needs to be upgraded; it is too small and very noisy. Had to turn up the volume on the TV when the A/C is running. At one point received dirty towels that looked like it was used to clean blood off someone/something. Aaron Robinson quickly remedied the situation by providing clean towels and apologized for the error. He was the only staff person that possessed a great smile. Aaron is a star! He made it a pleasure to be at the hotel with his positive attitude and smile. Hotel security is exellent. Passkeys needed to access upper floors. Parking security and hotel access from parking is also excellent; passkeys needed at all entry points to hotel. Parking lot staff need to improve friendliness and need to smile more often. They may not know this but they can affect a customer's experience or desire to return to the hotel.
The rooms were clean and serviceable. The staff at registration was extremely friendly and helpful.

I would not recommend this place. I arrived at 10:30 pm and pulled into the drive. I was told that I was in the valet spot for "The Nightclub" and there was no designated spot to park for guests who were registering. I backed up in a rather dangerous manner and pulled into a commercial driveway that clearly stated "No Parking". Finding the front desk was very confusing. I had to pass by numerous clubbers who were overwhelmingly young, native hawaiian, attitudinal, and rather sad looking.The employees at the front desk were very nice and very apologetic that they were out of modems ($10 per day) and therefore the only internet was on the (3) public computers directly across from the front desk in the very small lobby. They graciously afforded me 60 minutes of free internet. (It's that kind of place.)I was told that I would have to pay $14 for parking. I went back out and entered the parking structure. However, I had to pass by the "Club" valet area and noticed a large sign that said "Hotel Registration" which was filled with cars that apparently been parked by the Club valets. There was literally no spot left for hotel guests to park while registering.When I reached the top (5th) floor of the parking structure, I knew I had entered another world and one where I did not belong. There was a group of young people doing something - drugs or alcohol - that they were earnestly trying to conceal. Someone else was water- blasting the concrete floor. Very strange.I quickly retrieved my luggage from my car and headed for the elevators while trying to attact the minimum of attention.The room was OK but very dated. It was very tight and cramped in the entry but opened up in front of the alcove containing the closet (which I never used). The bathroom had a small and angled (neo-modern?) vanity and one of those shower curtains that wraps around the end and side of the tub. It was very tight in that tub. Difficult to avoid contact with the shower curtain which was pasable except the shower curtain had green stains from the previous guest's shampoo (or ???). The shower head was the cheapest, most ineffecient kind ever invented.I would not go back here again. I needed a place to stay. I came, I slept, I left early. I would not go back.Three (3) stars is a joke. It was cheap which is good as it is Waikiki. I would give it a 1/2 star. Maybe a full star on a good day if I never had to see that night club crew and didn't park on the fifth floor.

We were very fortunate to have met Vanessa on the first day of our trip. She was very helpful in booking all of our travel arrangements. She had great suggestions! The staff was overall very friendly. The location of the hotel is great.

Positive points:o) location – close to everything;o) great views to city (from high floors);o) microwave, coffeemaker and refrigerator in room;o) high cleanliness;o) soundproof walls;o) spacious cupboards;o) swimming-pool.Negative points:o) NO!!! free internet access;o) water shutoffs every week, during the rush hours for taking bath (9:00-1:00PM) always;o) the basic, “cooling only” air conditioner;o) evening and night swimming is not allowed (the pool is closed at dusk).

The staff were very informative and nice .you got a question they have a answer.Its not the Hilton or Hawaniian Prince but neither are the prices.i found it to be clean and had every thing i needed.would i stay there again of course

The staff was great, as always. I've dealt with both Josh and Vanessa and they have always gone way beyond their requirements. You can walk to all the things in Waikiki and feel safe, enjoying your time there. The only change I'd like is internet access for a flat fee during your stay. Other than that, enjoy it!
The hotel is near everything and the price is fine. They should renovate the showers and rooms, but the staff is wonderful. Specially Vanessa, she`s very atencious and terrifc.

Look, for the price per night that we paid you can't beat it. This place is located within walking distance to EVERYTHING!!!! There's a slightly shady bar downstairs, but if you aren't self concious you can walk in there and everything is just fine. No, there may not be a lobby but a lot of things in Hawaii are open air. This is the second time we've stayed there and lets face it, when you are in Hawaii you aren't living in your room. It's perfect for what you need, if you aren't royalty! The staff was friendly too. Yeah, there are a few ants in the bathroom, but we lived in Hawaii for three years, so you are going to have that. The air conditioner was quite noisy but it did what we needed it to do and it didn't keep us up at night. Great place to lay your head.

We requested an iron and ironing board which we NEVER received. There were two of us in our room and everyday the housekeeping staff would leave us ONE bath towel, that's it, no wash clothes, no hand towel, just ONE bath towel. They NEVER took the dirty glasses, or gave us new ones. The towels were either dirty, or had stains on them as we found large black and brown places on them. The pool water was cloudy, no way we were going in there! The walls were paper thin, like a dorm room and you could hear everything. Parking garage was tiny, and a nightmare to get in and out of. Water was turned off one day due to some problem, then one of the elevators broke and was NEVER fixed. The hotel bar served the worst pizza in the world. The pillows were paper thin and lumpy, the windows were so dirty you could barely see out of them. The housekeeping staff never threw away trash that was on dresser.

My friends & myself checked in & checked out within 30 min. It was the worst hotel i have ever stepped foot in. First off, i would not have been outside this hotel at night by myself. There was no lobby to speak of, just 2 couches sitting in front of the check-in desk. You are given a key card for your room, that is also used to run the elevator.....and i can see why. I was scared to death the whole 30 minutes we were there.The hallway to our room smelled musty & moldy. There was not enough room in the room to even turn around without running into something or someone else.The bathroom had mold around the tub & sink. The water in the shower would not turn off.....drip, drip,drip!!!There was also a sign posted in the room that the water was to be shut off for 3 hrs. Not a real problem.....but from 9am-12noon!!!! Prime shower time. Give me a break.I had seen & smelled enough in those 30minutes to know i could not stay there.If your looking for cheap, this is the place. But beware!!!! You get what you pay for!!!!

This hotel was grreat to stay, close to everythng. Not far from the mall. There were some things I didn't enjoy. Everytime we took a shower, the curtains never covered the entire shower, causing the floor to be really wet. On top of that I ended up losing a pair of shorts. I think the housekeeper stole it. Possibly when she was cleaning our sheets. Besides that, the mini coupes that you can rent were awesome. Cheap price and a fun trip to drive down the strip.

The front desk was very helpful. A shame they had not beengiven the task of renovating the hotel something it desperatelyneeds. The room was furnished from a down at heel op shop,the towels you don't even want to know about. The room andother amenities looked like the staff had long ago given up.when we found out that the room cost $60 per night and not$175 we paid we were disappointed to the max. 1/2 star.

Overall satisfy witht he room, great view of downtown, close to every activity sites for day cruising and night life adventure. Even though parking is close by but with a charge and wifi is not available without additional charge. Housekeeping are great and can always be counted on. This place is in a great centralize location to stay.
The staff was great. It was close to beach, shopping and restaurants. The price was great. Will stay there again.

My husband and I found this hotel to be both clean and comfortable. The location also made it easy to catch a variety of the trolleys and buses available which made traveling around Waikiki and Honolulu fun. With restaurants and loads of shopping in the neighborhood, there was loads to keep us busy. Try the Creme Pot for a wonderful breakfast or brunch and for a great cheeseburger, there's the Cheeseburger in Waikiki just up the street from the Hawaiian Monarch. Their cheeseburgers are great and the service is the best I've seen in a long time. They were quick and very helpful at every turn.

If you have to spend several days in Honolulu, for the price this place was okay. If you only have one night to spend in Waikiki -- stay somewhere else because it'll be worth your money to be on the beach. The location at this place is a few blocks from the beach, but there's a nice ING cafe across the street for free internet and cheap coffee. The rooms were liveable but don't expect Hilton-esque decor or linens. It's very basic. But for a long stay you can deal with it for the savings. The pizza is cheap and good at the pub also.I was one level above the pool deck and thank God it was only for one night. It sounded like there was a dance party going on across the hall and next door sounded like a taping of the Jerry Springer show with arguments and throwing things. Hopefully they weren't on their honeymoon. The staff was nice, but they really need to get security to leave their post downstairs and check out the floors every now and then. Thankfully I had ear plugs. If I was going to be there another night I would have definitely asked to change rooms, so make sure when you check in you get a room higher up so you at least get a nice view.

Vanessa was the dayshift desk clerk and she was very friendly, great service. She went out of her way to help us. Gary was the night shift desk clerk and he was also very friendly and nice~very helpful.

good location, great price, clean, comfortable, safe, nice people.central location, ABC store across the street, parking on site (for fee) .only negative is the room was a little tight b/c of the HUGE furniture in the room.also, the internet was expensive in the lobby $3.00 = 15 minutes, kinda pricey for me.other than that, awesome, liked it and would stay there again.

Our stay at the Hawaiian Monarch was a very pleasant one. Great location, nice size clean rooms, comfortable bed and a gorgeous view. Also Kings Pub is located in the lower level, in which we went to every night. Lots of Fun!!! The desk staff was a very helpful, especially Josh, he went above and beyond helping my sister and I. We are definitely coming back real soon. Thank You.
Excellent and personal service from Cheryl and Gary.Thank you

The Hawaiian Monarch Hotel was a fabulous location for our honeymoon! The room was nice yet simple, the grounds were spacious and the location was fantastic. There is even a nightclub and two restaurants on the property so we hardly left! Plenty of room around the pool so we never even went to the beach. And a midnight swim in the Ala Wai River was nothing if not romantic! The staff were courteous and helpful (thanks for the bus route and shopping tips guys- very beneficial) and all in all we had a great time! We'll be back again for our anniversary,Cheers!

Of all of the places I have ever visited in my life, this, without as much as a receding wisp of doubt, by far comes out the lowest of the low.Now, for the price I, I was fully expecting to be somewhere… basic. I am no snob and don't expect the Ritz by any means. I'll let you make what you will about this place from my experiences:• Cockroaches in their tens• Beds literally crawling with bugs• Ant infestations• Constant noise at all hours, if not from the neighbors who I was sure at one point were about to kill one another, from the building work on the 4th floor continuing well into the night• Elevators that don't look like (or sound) they've seen so much as a drop of oil since the 80s and will hold out for a good 10 minutes before finally allowing your keycard to operate the keypad.• Security staff with false legs (now I'd like to see him try and run after a robber)• About every week (I stayed here for some length of time on business) the water would be turned off for a day (beginning at… wait for it… 8AM!) for "essential safety maintenance", with the only tiny notice of forewarning being posted the day before outside the elevators where nobody has any hope of noticing it.• When I arrived, I was greeted by a colony of pigeons living right outside my window, making loud cooing noises at around 4am each morning.In all, visit at your peril.

This was THE WORST hotel (motel) I have ever stayed in. The room was filthy. I would not recommend this motel to anyone... not even my worst enemy. Room service was also terrible.... we never had our room serviced for the 2 days we stayed. The bed was very hard which gave myself and especially my husband bad back spasms. There was NO free internet access. The way the motel looked and smelled...parking should have been free. There was no kind of professional customer service. If this motel was to give us a free weekend stay...it would be a DEFINITE NO!! DO NOT STAY AT THIS MOTEL!! DO NOT STAY AT THIS MOTEL!!I rate this motel a (-10) negative ten.

When I first checked in, I walk to the front desk welcomed by the female employee on her cell phone and her friend taking a picture of her. I don't think that was a part of customer service training. When I get up to the room, nice but small. Parking at the hotel was convenient yet pricey, Parking attendants need training. Other than that it was allright.

This is. by far, the worst hotel I've ever stayed! Dirty room full of cockroaches, very noisy, smelly and expensive. Also, this hotel apparently found an extra source of income... prostitution. Just go to floors 7 or 8 and wait for few minutes around 11PM. I have no idea how this hotel got 2 stars! Based on what? The only good thing I wasn't bitten by bedbugs...lucky me...

There is no wireless internet. I called the hotwire staff right after I made the reservations and the representative helped me to phone the hotel right away and confirmed the hotel have wireless internet access. But there is no wireless internet when I got there even on the lobby of the hotel. I had to pay extra for the wireless internet but the connection was still soooooooooooooooo slow.It's totally not what the hotwire representative told me!

We only had 24 hours on Oahu and planned our vacation to the letter except for our stay here. No hotels available so we booked this place through hotwire. We arrive at the front desk at 10:30 p.m. and they didn't have our reservation. We were almost opting to sleep on the beach after watching the parade of interesting people and working girls around the construction site of a lobby. After getting hotwire on the phone to resolve our reservation problem and checking out the room, we decided to stay. Our room was clean. The carpet was new and the bathroom very clean. Old but clean. The rooms are independently owned so some can be much newer than others. I was looking for clean and moderately priced and that's what I got. Think of a cinderblock high rise, because that's what this place is. The location is great, but one night was enough for me. Never again if I can help it.

Compared to many, I have been lucky not to find bed bugs. However, the toilette didn't flush, and the drain was clogged with hair. The walls are extremely thin so to hear the tenants next to you. In my case, I ended up with a gay couple as neighbors, who was totally unbearable. I had to fight with my neighbors to have them shut up. They would fight at 3 a.m. for instance.I work and study and on a budget, so i couldn't just say, "enough I'm leaving." The carpet was disgusting and the bed covers had cigarette burns and bugers. The good side was that the previous tenant left two sets of towels, dishes and burners. The management was also helpful...they fixed the flush and replaced malfunctioning appliances for free. The downside is that your comfort is dependant on your neighbors.

Be very careful of your reservation. Don't book with them, they are scammers and will steal you money! I booked and then had to cancel 2 days after and they wouldnt refund the money! Their policy was outdated and was inconsistent to their online policy of cancellation either 24, 48 or 72 hours prior...STAY AWAY FROM BOOKING WITH THEM.

We were very pleased with our room for the price that we paid. It was in fair condition and clean. The staff was courteous and let us check-in 2 hours before the official time. I would highly recommend this hotel for those who want a clean, safe place to sleep but would rather spend their time & money on other things. John & Rachel

Ok for the price and only if your are staying a day or two. This is one of the least expensive ok hotels in Waikiki and is in fair location (a little far to lug things to the beach, close to shopping and other Waikiki activities, good from a driving point of view)Parking is $12. Room had microwave and small frig. Free Internet was available only in the lobby.Bathroom toilet wasn't flushing but housekeeping was there within 2 minutes both times we called.Room was adequate and clean and was worth the modest price (Hotwire).There are a few better hotels under $100 if you are planning a longer stay.

I travelled to Honolulu, with my family from Australia we firstly booked the sister hotel the Resortquest Circle would definately never recommend that hotel for any family, the room was like a shoe box. Requested to be moved out, so stayed at the Monarch and was put on the 20th floor with good views, only problem we had 2 single beds and a sofa for a family, not really practical. The maid service was very bad, in 10 days did not have linen changed, beds just pulled up and sofa not even touched, did not vaccum floors, wipe benches. Air con very noisy and didnt seem to cool the room down.The spa was out of order for half the vacation, which was very inconvenient.The lady on the front desk was very helpful and kind.

This hotel is for people looking for a bargain and willing to walk. If you are not a walker, this hotel isn't for you. We spent 5 nights there a few years ago and had a good experience. we were looking for a bargain and this was it! The room was clean and staff was friendly. Nothing spectacular but we weren't expecting that. This is a budget hotel in Oahu which was clean and spacious. We got a lot of walking in which was nice as laying on the beach doesn't burn the calories. The pool was fine... Overall- great for the price... good bargain.. would recommend for younger couples looking for a good deal.. not good for families or older couples not wanting to walk.

Got this as part of an Orbitz package... It was adequate, except the room had twin beds, and the shower curtain was mildewed and smelly. Finally got that replaced after two calls to the desk. Quite a distance from the beach, but "TheBus" stops a block away. Close to Ala Moana shopping.

I was at first apprehensive about booking 1 month stay at Hawaiian Monarch after seeing mixed reviews on tripadvisor.com I have decided to take the chance as I just could not pass on the fantastic view from the Monarch penhouse units. I was pleasantly surprised by how clean my penhouse unit was. The unit came equipped with high speed wireless internet access and 2 plasma TVs (one in each room). Beds and linens seemed new. The carpet was spotless and views from each room of the unit was just amazing. I can't speak for the lower level studio units but would definitely recommend anyone to rent the higher level penshouse units! great value too!

I was a bit worried to stay this hotel because of bad reviews. But my room was OK fortunately, no bugs, no dirty carpet. There was bath tab (but really dirty).As somebody said the blanket was smelly. I think traveler should bring room shoes and Fabreze!If you look for a hotel just for sleep and shower, this hotel will be reasonable price and close to Waikiki and Ala Moana.PS. My floor was 15F. Elevator area was dirty cause they are painting wall, door, everywhere. I saw a lot of notice there.

We had a 12 hour stopover in Honolulu on our way home to Australia and I booked this through Priceline.com without knowing the hotel name - just the general location. Well the location was fine (walk to Waikiki action) but the hotel, if you could call it that, was vile. The very best thing about it was the girl on the desk, who was lovely. The room was hideous, pubic hair was on the bathroom floor, stained and chipped mismatched furniture throughout, dank hallways, it felt like I was going to crash through the bath bottom while showering (oddly the water pressure was good though). Terrible curtains that did nothing to block out the morning sun. There was a big cigarette burn in the bedspread. Need I go on? It really does need to be torn down. The one redeeming feature is Cheeseburger in Paradise, which has great burgers and is across the road. We've backpacked through Southeast Asia and stayed in many dives, for some reason, this dump just seemed so much worse - probably because it cost 9 times as much as something similar in Southeast Asia!!!

carpets where DISGUSTING like someone threw up on every inch, my hotel bathroom floor was sticky so i wore my shoes the enitre time from out of the tub to leaving. they didnt even have an alarm clock or iron/ironing board. the person at the front desk is also the bell hop so it took forever to get new towels or an iron...this hotel was cheap and good if you are not going to be in your hotel ever, except for the 8 hours you are sleeping. nice view, parking was horriable, $9 a day and sometimes the lot would be full...this hotel has something like 26 floors and only 5 VERY small floors for parking. if you wanted a spot you need to get there before 5pm or you are screwed for the night and will have to park somewhere else and walk EVEN though you have already paid.

A total surprise! I booked this trip as part of my Rest and Recuperation leave for duty in Iraq. I have slept better in the bunkers of Iraq and Afghanistan. I was truly disappointed that Expedia would include this hotel as part of their package deal. This place was dark, dirty, dingy and gloomy from the entrance to every floor the elevator stopped on. The on site laundry room was too expensive and the front desk only provided minimal change as not to run out for other guests. I was afraid to spend too much time there anyway; and they charged for the ice. PLEASE spend the extra money to upgrade to a better hotel. We learned our lesson on this one. I will always check the reviews prior to booking a hotel room with Expedia.com.

Our original booking was with Sand Villa, but they sold our reservation to this place...The guy at the front counter had enough nerve to complain about someone being barefoot in the lobby when we were checking in. It turns out that that barefoot person should have been worried about what diseases he might incur while walking in this putrid establishment. Here's what we encountered: (1) A very negative person at the front counter (2) An additional $9 a night for parking (3) An unsafe surroundings (4) Dirty, worn, and stained carpets throughout (5) Holes in carpet (6) Bugs on counter in bathroom and on microwave (7) Smoke-smelling pillows (8) Partial shower curtain (9) Stained sheets (10) Stained walls... I could go on... I have stayed in many a hostel and even slept on floors of kitchens in Amsterdam, and this place beats them all! We weren't going for the hotel, but we did expect a minimal effort...None to be found at The Monarch! You're better off camping with the homeless on the windward side of the island! (Travelocity did ensure that we got a refund and we ended up staying with family on the island.)

Their site says they are a 3-1/2 star, but elsewhere they are rated a two. It's comparable to a hostel.The first day we were told they had just transitioned and are now "under new management". Knowing that, we held our breaths for what we'd experience. We stayed on the 23rd floor where all carpets and sheets were stained. My mom found a bug in her bed, and we were disappointed to find that the room was NOT cleaned when we had returned from town. The bath-tub was questionable, and the room, and elevators smelt retched. The coffee pot was dirty, and the floor so stained that we decided to keep our flip-flops on the whole time. The redeeming aspect of the hotel is the fact that the new management is planning to change things. Hopefully they have the funds to gut the whole facility and start from scratch. I’d expect the hotel to be suitable in perhaps six months from now. I wish them good luck on their remodel.

I had to stay in this hotel and had a horrible experience also. There putrid smell made me stay out of the room as long as I could until bedtime. Bed mattress--a hygenic biohazzard. Be careful of the activity in the community areas at nighttime. Be safe.

Got a really bad bug bite at this hotel. Skin-burrowing mite lives in the bed.I was the first victim, and the painfully itchy red spots spreading rapidly, and even after I got home, it's still increasing. Just yesterday the red spots started to grow on the skin of the person I went with. I saw some kind of insect laying dozens of white tiny eggs on the drainage of air conditioner.The door makes squaky sound all day. Everyone I see at this hotel does not look healthy, and I saw in my very eyes the police investigator interviewing the crying female resident of this hotel at the lobby!!! I could not believe my eyes. What kind of hotel is this? Trust me, I could not rest at this hotel.People should not use this hotel.Even if it costs a bit more, you should get a decent hotel. This is the last place you want to stay in the whole world. I am asking the travel agent to return the money.

This is a discount, high-rise hotel geared to budget travelers. If you want to stay somewhere fancy, you shouldn't go to a place that is giving away $40 rooms on Priceline.The location is fine (it's not in the ghetto, as one truly ridiculous review said), but you will have a short walk to the beach and some other areas in Waikiki. The service is fine. The hotel is average as a whole.If you're coming to Hawaii to enjoy the outdoors and only need a place to rest your head at night, this hotel will do just fine. I enjoyed my stay.

This is a nice place to stay if your on a budget. Its clean and safe and the staff a very freindly. Ive been here several times already and I have no complaints. Its not a 4 star hotel but its worth it. I dont care much for big budget hotels. As long as I have a comfortable place to stay, Im happy
the customer service was very lousy, arrogant and not trained.during the week ends, they increase the price indiscrminatory

I too booked my stay here before reading any reviews, but I was pleasently suprised with our stay. The carpets and rooms could use a little face lift, but the staff frienliness really made up for that. They were so helpful from the front desk clerk to the bellperson everyone was very nice. It is not the Ritz Carlton so if you are looking for an upscale hotel this is not it. They have spectacular views we had a great one from the 21st floor. It is a short walk to the beach unless you are in horrible shape you should not have a problem. My husband and I had a great time. There are plently of restaurants within walking distance. We had a great stay!

I booked this hotel early this year through Pleasant Hawaiian Holidays. I booked it because it was inexpensive and before I read any reviews of the place. After having read some of the reviews, I was dreading this vacation.We checked into this hotel September 7 and departed September 13. Thankfully, we were pleasantly surprised by the Hawaiian Monarch. It was out of the heart of Waikiki (which we liked), and although the rooms were rather small (similar to those in Manhattan hotels), ours was clean and safe. Admittedly, the halls and the lobby could use some updating. And it might be nice if the elevators were air conditioned. The pool was very nice (a little spartan perhaps) but we only spent a couple of hours there one evening while doing a load of laundry.Others have noted that there are not a lot of amenities at this hotel. This is true, so if you want a hotel with a restaurant, room service, spa, etc. don't stay here. But if you want a safe, clean place to shower and sleep, the Hawaiian Monarch is worth the money.The desk staff was very helpful, as was the bell captain. Considering how little time my husband and I were in our room, we're glad we didn't blow a bunch of money on another hotel. The Hawaiian Monarch met our needs quite nicely.Our 19th floor room had a mountain view that was just beautiful.

Satyed there from Aug 31, 2004 until Sep 7th, 2004.This should be called a motel not a hotel. The carpets were dirty. There is no room service, but there is a famouse fast food chain next door. It was in the 90's and there was no air conditioning in the elevators. The rooms had those small window units that you find in some backwoods mom and pop motel in the middle of nowhere. The rooms were about the same too. Many of the units are being sold off to buyers, so needless to say, in the mornings we awoke to the sent of ciggerettes blowing in under the door. The front desk said we could stuff our 2 towels under the door to stop the smell from comming in. When we arrived there were multiple police cars present for some reason. We saw them there often during our stay. There was a nice pool, however no hot tub, and no towels at poolside (had to use the ones we stuffed under the door.) And where did they come up with the only a short walk to the beach and shopping? Long hot walk to all the attractions. Felt like I was in the getto surrounded by low income housing. Might be OK for someone on a REALLY TIGHT budget, but would be too embarresed to recomend to a friend. NEVER AGAIN. Do yourself a favor and spend the few extra dollars on a nicer hotel that is close to the attractions. Oh yes!!!, forgot to mention, a day befor we checked out, they had the nerve to slip a note under the door to tell us we had to be out by noon. Go figure.

We stayed there for a total of 12 nights in November 2003 and although we knew it was a 'budget hotel' we still got one heck of a shock. Trust me the tour brochure pictures and the reality are vastly different. For starters the entrance and lobby are shabby not to say the least, complemented with carpets full of holes and tares. The resturant (if you can call it that) is akin to some sort of downtown sleaze bar and the hotel shop is nothing short od a joke. Be prepared to be followed around by the 1 member of staff. The hallways resemble a prison interior and that said, still need a new paint job. The rooms are tidy but basic. The bathroom and the windows do have mould around the edges and what is it with charging for in-room coffee. In short you can do far better for the kind of money you are going to be paying - give this hotel a miss! O' and what ever you do, don't smoke in the rooms - the staff go nuts.

I grew up at an early age (1963) in Waikiki. I live on the mainland the past 25 years but go for visits. I has always avoided staying in Waikiki like a pleague has hit. This trip I had no choice. Another reviewer - a woman - left a review earlier this year that really helped my husband and I decide. She said it was a key carded room with very good grounds and parking lot security. She said she could stay by herself and feel safe. That was good enough for us. We stayed from 5/9 to 5/14... Rm. 1714 with a mountain view. The room was really nice and as the lady said, I would stay there again because it is very safe! Great safe place for the $$

We have just returned from a 2 centre holiday which consisted of 3 days in Las Vegas and 7 days in Oahu, Honolulu. It was our first visit to both places and we enjoyed them both immensely. Circus Circus was the hotel in Las Vegas and no problems were encountered, in fact we would liked to have stayed longer. Oahu was simply paradise but the Castle Hawaiin Monarch Hotel was a disgrace. We have travelled to lots of different places and stayed in lots of hotels worldwide and this without doubt was the worst we have ever encountered. I have no idea what the nightly rate is as we booked it as a package here in England. To keep it simple, it is dismal, dark and drab. It is the most un-welcoming place we have ever seen. The entrance to hotel reception is appalling. The rooms are 'furnished' to an extremely poor standard and the bed linen was disgraceful. Dirty, holed and unironed would be a good discription for starters. Its a long way to travel to be disappointed and we certainly were that. DO NOT go to this 'hotel' even if you want the basics as you will regret it totally. Oahu is beautiful, very clean, the people are delightful, the flowers are sensational but the Castle Hawaiin Monarch is awful.

We have just spent 10 nights at the Hawaiian Monarch Hotel/Condos and were plesantly surprised - having read some of the reviews beforehand we thought we were going to hate the place. We were on the 10th floor, corner room with many views of the city, the room was small but perfectly acceptable for two of us, house cleaning, the laundry and pool were very good. Would recomend it at that price!

Stayed here three nights. Had requested non-smoking room. Got smoking room. Hotel said they didn't have any non-smoking rooms. Very small room with twin beds. Dirty drapes with cigarette burns. Window airconditioner. No alarm clock or radio. No hair dryer. Packet of coffee in room is $1.56. Ice is twenty five cents. Cockroach on ceiling. No restaurant. Drab hallways that need painting. Hotel is old and dingy. Would not recommend this hotel.

This is a great hotel for someone on a budget. I actually paid around $250 for four nights. Not too shabby for a place I only slept at during my visit to Honolulu. It was definitely within walking distance of the beach and other areas. True, this is not a Hyatt or Hilton, but rather along the lines of an older Holiday Inn perhaps. The halls are definitely line with worn carpet and funky pink paint. I stayed on the 21st floor and had a fun view of the city/mountains/canal. The staff was very friendly but the elevators old and slow. I think I would stay there again, but if traveling with my wife, I may drop a few extra bucks and go someplace a bit nicer.

I stayed at this hotel for 9 nights. It is a basic budget hotel but clean. I felt safe there due to the security cards required for the elevator and the security guard at night (good place for single women to stay). The phone calls are expensive 0.75 cents per call. The only drawback is it is a loooooong walk to the beach and amenities but it is away from the hussle and bussle and is quiet. It is also close to the Ala Moana shopping centre. I would stay there again but it is good value for the money. Keep in mind some rooms are better than others so if you are not happy ask for another room.

I spent 9 nights at the hotel on the 21st floor with a view of diamond head and the canal, to one side and the ocean to the other, the staff were ok, its a little bit away from the main action around, if you can walk 1/2 mile then you are ok. The Hard Rock cafe and the ala mona center are easy to reach. The beach is around 1/2 mile. there is a 24 hour ABC store around 450 yards away, on the whole the hotel is ok. the room was basic, TV, fridge, Bath and shower, the walls are a bit thin and you can hear most of next doors bed springs, but hey you pays your money you take your chances, it is one of the cheapest hotels around the area, But it is clean. The bar is open from 4pm till 4am and is ok. now i know where the hotel is i would book it again, but if you want to walk right out on to the beach look elsewhere and pay more money

I am a young woman who likes to travel to Hawaii quite often and I usually stay at the monarch bcuz I really just want a half decent place to sleep....I go for the night life and beach days so I dont spend much time at the hotel...if you are looking for any class dont stay here...of you want a place to crash, stay here...its reasonably priced....and if you wanted class you wouldnt come to Honolulu anyhow! You should go to Maui....

We've been at this hotel on September 6 to September 14 2003. We had a very good time at this hotel. Good cleaning, friendly and REALLY CLEAN! And, in the evening there's was security guard, so it's very safe. Good Price, good time. Plus, accomodation, internet and motorcycle rental, etc....We will return at this hotel anytime!

We spent 14 nights here in September 2003. The hotel was close enough to all the action in waikiki, but after a few days walking to everything got very old. The room was a little smaller than expected. The walls were also very thin. The price for a local phone call or toll free number was $0.75. We had to request an iron/ironing board from housekeeping, which you could keep for an hour at a time. The room was not as clean as you would expect in an american hotel. We had to change rooms since our air conditioner broke. The staff at the front desk and the bell desk were both very friendly and helpful. The views from the rooms were very nice. Overall the hotel was okay for the price that we paid, but next time we would rather spend a little more money to stay at a better hotel.

I spent 3 nights at the Hawaiian Monarch Hotel in August 2003. The air conditioner barely worked at all and I spent a lot of time stuck in the elevators because cards are required to operate the elevators and mine rarely worked. The parking attendant was rude to me and when I talked to the hotel mangement about it they said they couldn't help me because the parking business and the hotel business were seperate. It costs extra money for ice. The place is a dump and I am sorry I stayed there for 3 nights. Never again-that's for sure!

We stayed at the Hawaiian Monarch in Dezember 2002. The room was not realy clean, you could find some womans hair in the bathroom from the former guest. The Windows were dirty, the tube had got cracks with rust on it. The Internet Station was out of order. Altogether it looks like from the fifties. The prices for walk in is great, but booking from Germany (Travel Agent, especially Exit B.V.) is too expensive for these old Equipment. May be it it ok for one night.

I stayed at the Hawaiian Monarch in Nov., 2002. Overall, I was disappointed during my 6-day stay. It was OK for me, but I would never take my wife or family there. There are much better hotels nearby. The best thing about this hotel was the price - and I was on a budget. The views were great and the front desk did treat me well. The hotel was also near the convention center and there was a nice Internet cafe nearby. But you have to know this is a budget property. It's not a Hyatt or Hilton. The rooms are average, but the air conditioners don't work well and the rooms get hot in the afternoons, even with the air conditioner on full blast. I won't stay here again. If I'm on a budget next time, I'll stay at the Maile Sky Court (about the same price and a cleaner hotel with better air conditioners).

This place is half condos half hotel. We arrived late and left early but everyone was very accomodating. Room was small (5 steps x 5 steps) and bathroom was functional. Served its purpose though. OK for the 7 hours we were guests.

I was a little apprehensive about staying at this hotel since it was part of a great "bargain" package. We arrived to find a nice clean room with great hospitality. The hotel was accomadating and even though the travel agent did not confirm our reservations, we were able to get a room with no problems! The hotel is a short walk to the beach and away from all the hustle and bustle. If you stay here get a room as high as you can get. The views are amazing! The only concern we had was the pricey parking garage, but if you are willing to move your car early then you can park for free on the side streets. Restaurants are within walking distance and so is the nightlife. We if we return, we will stay at the Hawaiian Monarch again. Aloha!
